name: Adobong Kangkong
ingredients: 1 bundle kangkong, washed, hard stems removed
instructions: Saute garlic & onion in a heated pan or wok with cooking oil.
Add the water, soy sauce & vinegar.
Cover & simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the kangkong and cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until the stems are tender.
Serve with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!​​

name: Adobong Manok sa Gata (Coconut Milk)
ingredients: 2 pounds or 1 kilo chicken cuts, I used leg quarters (thigh and legs)
chili pepper if you want it spicy
instructions: In a small bowl, add soy sauce and vinegar.  Set aside.
In a large pan or wok, heat a small amount of oil then pan-fry the chicken pieces until all sides are browned. Remove from pan and set aside.
Using the same pan or work and oil. Sauté' the garlic until fragrant then add the crushed peppercorns. Cook for a few seconds.
Return the browned chicken into the pot. Stir and cook over medium heat for another 3 minutes.
Add the bay leaves and soy sauce-vinegar mixture. Do not stir. Cover and simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes. Turn the chicken and continue cooking for another 5 minutes.
Add the coconut milk and brown sugar. Simmer for 30-45 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cook until sauce is reduced and thickened.
Serve with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!

name: Adobong Pusit
instructions: Pull out head, tentacles, innards, and transparent ribs from body of squid, making sure not to burst the black tint. Cut off tentacles just above the eyes.  Discard innards and transparent ribs.  Wash and drain squid bodies and tentacles well.
Transfer the cleaned squid into a wok or pan.
Add fish sauce, lemon or calamansi juice, sugar and chili pepper. Let stand for 15-30 minutes.
Cook the marinated squid in high heat while constantly stirring until the liquid almost dried out.
Add the cooking oil. Cook for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve hot with rice.
Enjoy!

name: Adobong Sitaw with Pork​
ingredients: 1/2 lb or 1/4 kilo pork belly, cut into strips
1 bunch, about 15-20 pieces strands of long beans
instructions: In a large pan or wok, heat cooking oil.
Add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add onion and cook until soft and translucent.
Add pork belly and cook until pork turns brown.
Add water and soy sauce then stir.
Add vinegar. Do not stir.
Cover and simmer for about 10 minutes.
Add long beans and cook for another 5 minutes or until beans are tender.
Serve with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!

name: Adobo with Oyster Sauce
ingredients: 1 lb pork belly, cut into serving size
1 tbsp calamansi, use lemon if not available
instructions: Combine meat, half of the chopped garlic, half of the chopped onion, soy sauce, vinegar and calamansi. Simmer until meat is tender and sauce is reduced.
Remove the meat from the wok. Set aside.
Remove the sauce leaving the pork fat.
Add the rest of the chopped garlic and saute' until frangrant.
Add the rest of the chopped onion and cook until soft.
Bring back the meat into the wok.
Add oyster sauce and stir until well incorporated.
Bring the sauce back and cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve over hot steamed white rice.
Season with sesame seeds if you like.
Enjoy.

name: Ampalaya Con Carne
ingredients: 1/2 tbsp fish sauce or salt to taste
instructions: Slice bitter melon into half and remove seeds.
Slice diagonally and place into a bowl with salt to remove some bitterness. Soak for 30 minutes then drain the water.
In a heated pan with cooking oil, saute garlic, onion and tomatoes.
Add the ground beef or pork and cook until color turns brown.  Do not overcook the meat or it will be dry.
Add fish sauce or salt to taste.  Simmer for about 2 minutes.
Add the bitter melon. Do not stir. Cover and cook for about 3-5 minutes or until the bitter melon has slightly softened. Do not over cook or it will be soggy.
Stir and add the beaten eggs and cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Asian Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 lb. beef sirloin steak, cut into thin strips/slices
1/2 cup cauliflower, cuto into serving pieces
instructions: In a bowl, marinate beef strips in soy sauce and cornstarch for at least 15 minutes.

name: Baked Chicken Thighs
ingredients: 2-3 pieces bone-in chicken thighs with skin
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray.
Arrange chicken thighs on prepared baking sheet.
Combine oregano, thyme, paprika, salt and pepper.
Sprinkle spice mixture liberally over chicken thighs.

Bake chicken in the preheated oven until skin is crispy, thighs are no longer pink at the bone, and the juices run clear, about 1 hour. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
For extra crispy skin, broil for 1-2 minutes.
Serve with rice or vegetables.​

name: Baked Fish Fillet
instructions: Arrange the tilapia fillets in a pan covered with an aluminum foil.
Brush both sides of the fillets with enough olive oil.
Squeeze with lemon juice.
Sprinkle with basil and garlic salt.
Top with cherry tomatoes.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until tilapia flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with your favorite steamed vegetables.
Enjoy!​ ​

name: Baked Mussels
ingredients: 15-20 pieces mussels on half shells, rinsed and cleaned
1/2 cup or more grated cheddar  cheese for topping
instructions: I used frozen green mussels. To prepare, defrost the mussels by running it under cold tap water for  approximately 2-3 minutes and set aside.

Some recipes precook the mussels, while others don’t. The only advantage of precooking is that the mussels open up on their own. If you decide not to precook, it will be a little hard to handle to prize them open with a knife.

If using fresh mussels, scrub the mussels, removing any dirt and hairy bit, clean and discard any that are broken. Put the mussels in a pot with the water, cover and put on a medium-high heat for a couple minutes until they open up. Remove from the heat and remove one side of the shell.​
If oven is not available, these mussels can be grilled as well.
If the mussels were precooked, bake for only about 10-12 minutes.

name: Baked Salmon Fillet
ingredients: butter or oil for greasing the foil
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F.
Place salmon fillet on a prepared sheet pan lined with foil or a baking dish greased with some butter oil.
Combine garlic, olive oil, thyme, rosemary, salt & pepper and spread over the top of salmon.
Bake uncovered for 20 minutes.
Serve and enjoy! ​

name: Baked Tilapia
ingredients: 1 large tilapia, cleaned and scales removed
1 tbsp fresh or 1/2 tbsp dried parsley
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F.
Clean the tilapia and make a slit on the side. Deepen and widen the cut along tilapia belly by using a sharp pointed knife.
Sprinkle both sides of the fish including the stomach/belly with salt. Set aside.
In a small bowl, combine chopped onions, tomatoes, garlic and parsley.
Fill the mixture to tilapia head and belly.
Wrap the fish with foil. Make sure it is completely covered.
Bake for minutes 25 minutes.
Remove from oven, fold foil on each side to expose top skin and broil for 4 minutes. (Make sure to keep an eye on it to avoid burning the skin).
Serve  with rice and toyomansi* sauce, if desired.

name: Baked Whole Tilapia
ingredients: 1 piece whole tilapia, gutted and scaled
1/3 cup celery, chopped or slice diagonally
1/4 tsp salt plus more for seasoning  the fish
instructions: Season the cleaned fish with salt. Set aside for 10-15 minutes.
In a medium bowl, combine onion, tomatoes, garlic, green onions, celery, salt and pepper.
In a small bowl. combine oyster sauce, sesame oil and juice.
Line a large tray with foil big enough to cover the fish and make a packet.
Spread 1/3 of the vegetable mixture in the middle of the tray then place the tilapia over it.
Brush inside and all sides of tilapia with oyster sauce mixture.
Stuff the fish with 1/3 of the vegetables then the remaining mixture on top.
Cover with foil and fold the the sides to seal. Making a foil packet allows space for steaming and avoids steam and juice from oozing out while baking or steaming.
Bake at 375 F for 20-25 minutes or until cooked through. It can also be grilled or steamed if desired.
Cut the foil from the sides.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Baked Oriental Chicken
ingredients: 5-6 slices boneless skinless chicken breast, halves
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 deg F. Place chicken in a nonstick baking pan or line the pan with a foil.
Combine plum sauce, seasoning blend and soy sauce in a small bowl.
Pour mixture evenly over chicken, turning pieces until well coated.
*** (Marinate overnight if desired)***
Bake uncovered for 35-45 minutes.
Serve and Enjoy!

name: Bangus sa Mais
ingredients: 1 large bangus (milkfish), cleaned, rinsed and sliced  into 4 or 5 servings
2 white or yellow corn, scraped off the cob
salt or fish sauce to taste​​
instructions: In large pot or wok, heat cooking oil.
Saute garlic. Cook until fragrant.
Add onion and cook until soft.
Add the corn and cook for about 3 minutes or until slightly tender.
Add water. Bring to a boil.
Add the milkfish and cook until the fish is cooked through.
Add fish sauce and pepper leaves.  (I added about 1 1/2 tbsp fish sauce). Simmer for few minutes.
Serve and enjoy.​

name: Barbecue
ingredients: 2-3 lbs pork belly or any preferred meat
instructions: Combine sauce ingredients.  (Makes about 3/4 to 1 cup)
Marinade the pork with the mixed barbeque sauce and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Cook the marinated pork over grill.
Use the remaining marinade to baste the barbecue for added flavor and to keep the meat from drying out.
Remove from grill when done.
Serve fresh from the grill.
Enjoy your yummy BARBEQUE!

name: - Pork
ingredients: 2-3 lbs pork belly or any preferred meat
instructions: Combine sauce ingredients.  (Makes about 3/4 to 1 cup)
Marinade the pork with the mixed barbeque sauce and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Cook the marinated pork over grill.
Use the remaining marinade to baste the barbecue for added flavor and to keep the meat from drying out.
Remove from grill when done.
Serve fresh from the grill.
Enjoy your yummy BARBEQUE!

name: ​Batsoy
ingredients: 2 lbs pork butt or belly cut into strips
instructions: Heat a small amount of cooking oil in a pan or wok.
Saute ginger. Remove from pan and set aside.
Saute garlic and onion then add the cooked ginger.
Add the pork. Simmer for 15 minutes or until the pork becomes tender.
Add the fish sauce and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the water and pork cube. Bring to a boil.
Add the pork blood. Stir occasionally while simmering.
Add the sliced celery and simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve with hot steamed white rice.
Enjoy!​

name: Batchoy
ingredients: 2 lbs pork butt, belly or shoulder, strips
instructions: Heat a small amount of cooking oil in a pan or wok.
Saute ginger. Set aside in the pan then add garlic. Cook until fragrant then continue sauteing with the ginger root.
Add onion and cook until soft.
Add the pork. Cook for about 10 minutes or until the pork becomes tender.
Add the fish sauce or salt to taste. Stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the water and pork cube. Bring to a boil.
Add the pork blood. Stir occasionally while simmering.
Add the sliced celery and simmer for an additional 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve with hot steamed white rice.
Enjoy!

name: Beans & Tofu in Oyster Sauce
instructions: Using the same wok, saute garlic.
Add the beans. Cook until tender.
Add the fried tofu and oyster sauce.
Stir until sauce is well incorporated with fried tofu cubes and green beans.
Serve with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy! ​

name: Beef and Beans
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil to blanch the green beans.
When the water comes to a boil add the green beans and let simmer for about 1 minute.
Rinse under cold water to stop the cooking. Set aside.
In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, vinegar, sesame oil, crushed red pepper and cornstarch. Set aside.
In a large pan on medium high heat saute' the garlic, and onion in oil.
Add the beef strips. Cook and stir until beef is tender.
Re-whisk reserved sauce and add to the pan with beef.  Add water. Simmer for 1 minute.
Add the green beans and carrots.
Stir well to combine. Add oyster sauce and sesame seeds. Continue to saute' about 2 to 3 minutes longer.
Serve and enjoy! ​

name: Beef and Green Beans Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 1/2 tbsp rice vinegar o dry sherry (rice wine)
1 lb green beans, stem ends snapped off and cut into 2-inch pieces
instructions: In a small bowl, dissolve cornstarch in water. Add soy sauce, rice vinegar or rice wine (sherry), sugar, pepper and pepper flakes. Stir and set aside.

In a wok or large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add the green beans and stir-fry until crisp-tender, about 5-6 minutes.  Stir frequently until some beans are lightly charred.  Remove from pan and set aside.
Using the same pan, add a small amount of cooking oil. Saute' garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant.
Add the ground meat. Cook until no pink remains in the meat.
Bring back the beans and stir to combine with the meat.
Add sauce and stir to combine. Add green onions and cook until thickened, about 1-2 minutes. Do not overcook as you want the beans to remain crisp-tender.
Remove from heat and serve over a bowl of hot rice and sprinkle some green onions if desired. Enjoy.
Recipe yields about 4-6 servings.​

name: Beef Caldereta
instructions: ​​Simmer over low heat for 10-15 minutes.
Add coconut cream and liver spread. Stir to combine.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the cooked potatoes and carrots.
Add the bell peppers and chili peppers. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
Enjoy.

name: Beef Steak
ingredients: 1 big yellow onion, cut into rings
2 tbsp calamansi juice or 3 tbsp lemon juice​​ ​
instructions: In a pan or wok, marinate meat in soy sauce and 2 tbsp calamansi or lemon juice for at least an hour. Overnight is better. :)
Add water to the meat marinade. Make sure all of the meat are flat or straighten out. (If not, it will curl and will be hard to pan fry later).
Bring the meat to a boil removing scum as it gathers and simmer for 30-45 minutes or until the meat is tender.
Remove the meat from the pan. (Reserve the liquid from the wok where you boiled the meat).
Pan fry all the meat & onion rings.
Simmer the fried meat with the reserved liquid for 5-10 minutes.
Add the onion rings.
Add more calamansi or lemon juice as needed.
Simmer for 2 minutes.
Serve with hot rice.
Enjoy!​​​
Recipe yields 5-6 servings

name: Beef Stroganoff
ingredients: 1 lb beef sirloin or round steak, cut into strips
3/4 cup whole milk or 2% reduced fat
1/3 cup sour cream or plain yogurt
egg noodles (cooked according to package directions)
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a non-stick pan.
Add the beef. Cook until well browned. Remove from the pan and set aside.
Using the same pan, add a small amount of cooking oil.
Add the garlic and saute' until fragrant.
Add the onion and cook until tender.
Stir the soup, milk, paprika and black pepper. Heat to boil.
Stir in the sour cream or plain yogurt.
Return the beef to the pan and cook for another 3-5 minutes.
Serve over the prepared noodles.
Sprinkle with parsley.

name: Beef in Corn & Asparagus
ingredients: 1/2 lb beef, thinly sliced cut in strips
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a pan or wok.
Add the beef and cook over high heat. Cook until the beef changes color.
Add garlic then onion until translucent.
Pour in the soy sauce. Stir.
Add the asparagus. Cook until it tender. About 1 minute.
Add baby corns and cook until heated through.
Add the oyster sauce and crushed pepper.
Stir until sauce is well blended.
Best served with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!

name: Beef in Corn & Cream of Mushroom
ingredients: 1 lb beef sirloin or beef chuck, thinly sliced and cut into serving size.
1 can, 10.5 oz cream of mushroom soup
1/2 tbsp fish sauce (optional) - cream of mushroom is high in sodium
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a pan or wok.
Saute garlic & onion.
Add the beef.
Cook for 5-10 minutes or until the meat turns brown in color.
Add the water.
Let it simmer for another 10-15 minutes or until the meat is tender.
Add the cream of mushroom soup.  Stir to combine and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the whole corn. Simmer for another 3 minutes.
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving bowl.
Enjoy!

name: Beef Mechado
instructions: Boil beef in water until tender. Set aside the beef. Reserve 2 cups of soup.
Pan fry the potatoes, carrots and bell pepper. Remove the vegetables from the pan then set aside.
In the same pan, stir fry garlic and onion.
Add the boiled beef and fish sauce. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the tomato sauce. Simmer for few minutes then add the soup stock. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the soy sauce and vegetables. Cook until sauce becomes thick.
Serve with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!​

name: Beef with Broccoli
ingredients: 1 lb beef sirloin, thinly sliced cut into strips
1 medium to large head broccoli about 2 cups broccoli florets
1 tsp + 2  tbsp rice wine or rice vinegar
1/4 tsp ground black pepper and more for seasoning
instructions: In a lage bowl, combine beef, 4 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp rice vinegar and ground pepper. Stir well. Cover and marinate for at least 30  minutes.
While beef is marinating, combine 2 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp rice vinegar, sugar, oyster sauce, sesame oil and cornstarch. Stir well until sugar and cornstarch are dissolved. Set aside.
In a small pot, boil water and blanch broccoli for 1 minute. Remove from water and set aside.
In a work or large pan, heat cooking oil. Saute' garlic and ginger. Add the marinated beef and stir-fry until beef becomes tender.
Add the sauce mixture. Stir the sauce with the beef and cook until sauce thickens, about 3 minutes.
Add the blanched broccoli and stir until well combined .
Season with ground pepper if desired and add some toasted sesame seeds.
Serve over rice and top and toasted sesame seeds.
Enjoy!​

name: Beef with Cashews
ingredients: 3 oz or 2/3 cup unsalted roasted cashews
6-8 green onions with tops, cut into 1-inch pieces
instructions: Heat 1 tbsp vegetable oil in a wok or pan.
Add half of meat; stir fry 3-5 mins until browned. Remove from wok; set aside.
Repeat with 1 tbsp vegetable oil and remaining meat.
Combine water, cornstarch, soy sauce, sesame oil, osyter sauce and chili sauce in small bowl; mix well.
Heat remaining 2 tbsp vegetable oil in wok. Add cashews, carrots, green onions, ginger and garlic. Stir fry for 1 minute.
Stir cornstarch mixture; add to wok with meat and any juices.
Cook and stir until sauce boils and thickens.
Serve with rice.
Enjoy.

name: Beef Stir Fry
ingredients: 1 lb beef top sirloin, cut into thin strips
instructions: Heat 2 tbsp of oil in large skillet or wok.
Saute garlic and ginger.
Add the beef and cook until tender, about 8 minutes.
Remove from skillet.
Using the same pan, heat 2 tbsp of oil.
Add carrots and brocolli; cook for 3 minutes.
Add green onions; cook for 1 minute.
Add orange juice concentrate, soy sauce and crushed red pepper; toss to coat.
Add cooked beef. Cook until heated through.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Beef Tapa
instructions: Combine marinade. Stir well..
Arrange meat in a container or ziploc bag.
Pour marinade. Make sure the beef is fully coated with marinade.
Cover and refrigerate overnight. Turn at least once.
In a pan with cooking oil. Fry the marinated beef until lightly brown.
Serve with sunny side up eggs and plain rice or garlic rice.
Enjoy!​​​

name: Braised Beef
ingredients: 1 lb beef loin / chuck / brisket, cubed
1 tbsp cornstarch dissolved in 1/4 cup water
instructions: In a large pan or wok, heat about  cooking oil.
Saute' garlic until fragrant.
Add onion and cook until onion is translucent.
Add the meat and cook until meat turns light brown, about 8 minutes.
Add the water, brown sugar, star anise and bay leaves.
Cover and cook over low heat for 50-60 minutes or until the meat is fork tender.
Add the carrots and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the dissolved cornstarch and cook until the sauce becomes thick, about 5-8 minutes.
Serve over a bowl of hot steamed white rice and garnish with chopped green onions.
Enjoy!

name: Braised Pork Belly
ingredients: 2 lbs pork belly, cut into serving size
1 1/2 tbsp cornstarch dissolved in 1/4 cup water
instructions: In a large pan or wok, heat about  2 tbsp cooking oil.
Saute' garlic until fragrant.
Add onion and cook until onion is translucent.
Add pork and cook until meat sides turns light brown or golden about 10 minutes.
Add water, soy sauce, brown sugar, star anise and bay leaves.
Cover and cook over low heat for 45 minutes or until the meat is tender and sauce is reduced.
Stir and add the dissolved cornstarch and cook until the sauce becomes thick.
Serve over a bowl of hot steamed white rice and garnish with chopped green onions. You can also garnish it with toasted sesame seeds if you like. Enjoy!

name: Braised Spareribs
ingredients: thumb sized ginger, thinly sliced into strips
2 pieces greens onion, pale part only
chopped green onions and toasted sesame seeds for garnish
instructions: No rice vinegar? You can use 3 tbsp distilled white vinegar.  But if you have apple cider vinegar, combine 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar and 1/4 tsp granulated sugar.
If you can find dark soy sauce, use 1 tbsp dark soy sauce and 2 tbsp regular soy sauce.
If you are not a fan of ginger, just cut the ginger in big pieces, add it together with the anise then remove later before serving.
Do not omit the star anise. It makes the sauce aromatic and flavorful.
Sesame seeds are best when they are toasted. To toast, heat a small pan or skillet (without oil) over medium heat then add the seeds. Shake the pan until the sesame seeds are golden.
Benefits of parboiling:

name: Breaded Pork Chop
ingredients: 1 lb or 2 pieces large pork chops
instructions: Marinate pork chop in soy sauce, garlic vinegar, tomato sauce, salt & pepper for at least an hour. Turn several times.
Simmer pork chop in marinade until dry. Remove from pan.
Dip each piece in egg.
Roll in bread crumbs.
Deep fry until golden brown.
Serve with banana ketchup or your preferred dipping sauce. I bet ranch will be good too! :)
Enjoy!

name: Bulalo
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs beef shank (with bone marrow), cut into chunks
2 pieces white or yellow corns, cut in halves
instructions: In a stock pot, simmer the beef shank for at least an hour or  until tender. For a quick process, you can use a pressure cooker if  you have one. It will only take 10 minutes from the time it starts boiling.
Remove the scum that rises above the soup. Add more hot water if necessary.
When beef is fork tender, add the onion, salt, whole peppercorn and corn. Let stand for 5-8 minutes.
Add the cabbage, chinese cabbage and bokchoy. Season with fish sauce according to taste.
Remove from heat.
Serve with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!​

name: Burger Steak
instructions: Heat cooking oil.
Saute onion. Cook until translucent.
Add the sliced mushrooms.
Add flour, whisk using a wire whisk until no more lumps.
Add water, beef bouillon and ground pepper.
Simmer until mixture slightly thickens.
Pour the sauce over the fried patties.
Serve with mashed potato and/or hot white steamed rice.
Enjoy!

name: Cajun Crabs
ingredients: 1 dungeness crab or 8-10 blue crabs, steamed and cracked
1-2 tbsp hot sauce (depends on how spicy you want)
instructions: In a small bowl combine paprika, lemon pepper and cajun seasoning. Set aside.
Melt butter over low heat in a large pan or wok.
Add garlic and saute until translucent.
Add the seasoning mixture. Stir and cook for 3 minutes.
Add hot sauce and sugar.
Simmer for another 3 minutes.
Add the steamed crabs, sausage and corns.
Stir until the sauce and crabs are incorporated.
Transfer to a serving plate.
Serve with steamed white rice.
Enjoy!

name: Cajun Shrimp
ingredients: 2 lbs / 1 kilo head-on and shell-on shrimp, rinsed
instructions: You can make this recipe a seafood boil by just adding other seafood variety like mussels, crabs, clams and more!
You can add more hot sauce as you wish depending on how spicy you want it.
You will definitely have extra sauce here. I suggest saving it and store in the freezer for future use.

If you can't find Cajun seasoning or you wanted to make your own, combine paprika, salt, garlic powder, black pepper, onion powder, dried oregano, cayenne and thyme. Add 2 tbsp Paprika and 1 tbsp each for the rest of the mentioned seasonings. You can adjust them to your liking.
I hope these tips help!

name: Chicken Adobo
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs chicken, cut into serving size
instructions: In a pan of work. marinate chicken pieces, garlic, bay leaves and soy sauce for at least 45 minutes to 1 hour or overnight would be better.
Turn on the stove.
Add water and stir to combine. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add vinegar and peppercorns. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Serve with white steamed rice.
Enjoy!

name: Chicken Adobo with Coconut Milk
ingredients: 2 pounds or 1 kilo chicken cuts, I used leg quarters (thigh and legs)
chili pepper if you want it spicy
instructions: In a small bowl, add soy sauce and vinegar.  Set aside.
In a large pan or wok, heat a small amount of oil then pan-fry the chicken pieces until all sides are browned. Remove from pan and set aside.
Using the same pan or work and oil. Sauté' the garlic until fragrant then add the crushed peppercorns. Cook for a few seconds.
Return the browned chicken into the pot. Stir and cook over medium heat for another 3 minutes.
Add the bay leaves and soy sauce-vinegar mixture. Do not stir. Cover and simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes. Turn the chicken and continue cooking for another 5 minutes.
Add the coconut milk and brown sugar. Simmer for 30-45 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cook until sauce is reduced and thickened.
Serve with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!

name: Chicken Afritada
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs chicken, cut into serving size
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a pan or wok.
Saute potatoes, carrots and bell pepper.  Cook until half cooked.  Drain on paper towels. Set aside.
Using the same pan, saute garlic then add onion. Cook until onion is translucent.
Add the chicken cuts***. Simmer for 10-15 minutes or until tender. (requires occasional stirring).
Add the fish sauce and cook for 3 minutes.
Add water when it starts to dry up. Bring to a boil.
Add the tomato sauce. Let it simmer.
Add all the vegetables. Simmer for another 5 minutes or until the carrots and potatoes are tender.
Remove from heat & transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve with hot steamed white rice.
Enjoy!

name: Chicken Cordon Bleu
ingredients: 1 cup evaporated milk or fresh milk
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chicken breast, ground pepper and seasoning powder.
Add evaporated milk. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Lay the chicken breast flat on a plate. Add 2 slices of ham and cheese. Tightly roll the chicken breast and wrap in foil making sure each sides are secured.
Steam for 15-20 minutes. Remove from steamer.  Let it cool for a bit. Remove the foil.
Place flour, eggs, and bread crumbs in three shallow bowls. Working with one at a time, roll the chicken first in flour, then eggs then bread crumbs pressing to coat.
Fry until golden brown.
Combine the sauce ingredients. Slice the Chicken Cordon Bleu and serve with the cream sauce. ​
Recipe yields 3 rolls.
Enjoy.

name: Chicken Curry
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken, cut into serving size
instructions: Season the chicken cuts with salt and pepper, Add 1 tbsp curry powder and mix until chicken are evenly coated. Marinate for 10-15 minutes.
In wok or large pan, add about 2-3 tbsp cooking oil. Add potatoes and cook until tender or until sides are lightly browned. Remove from pan and set aside.
Using the same pan, add carrots and cook until sides are lightly browned. Remove from pan and set aside.
Using the same pan, add bell pepper. Cook for about 1 minute. Remove from pan and set aside.
If oil has dried up, add about 1 tbsp cooking oil. Saute garlic and ginger. Cook until fragrant. Add onion and cook until softened.
Add the marinated chicken. Stir to combine then cook until lightly browned.
Add the fish sauce and cook for about 1 minute.
Add water and coconut milk. Simmer for 20-25 minutes. Stir occasionally.
Add cooked vegetables and 1 tbsp curry powder. Stir and cook for another 3-5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, add chili pepper if desired.
Remove from heat. Serve and enjoy.

name: Chicken Fillet ala King
instructions: ​Combine marinade ingredients. Add to sliced chicken breasts and mix until well distributed. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.
In sauce pan, add butter and cook until melted
Add carrots. Saute' for 1 minute.
Add the chicken cube and cook until chicken cube has dissolved.
Combine all purpose and water. Stir well then add into the pan.
Add evaporated milk and all purpose cream. Continue mixing until sauce ingredients are well combined.
Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook until sauce has slightly thickened.
While sauce is simmering, coat the marinated chicken with bread crumbs.
Fry until golden brown.
Top with sauce ala king.
Sprinkle with green onions if desired.
Serve immediately with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy.

name: Chicken Inasal
ingredients: 1 tsp lemon juice or calamansi juice
instructions: Combine garlic, ginger, crushed peppercorns, calamansi or lemon juice, vinegar and salt.
Place the chicken pieces in the marinade for at least an hour, or overnight. Keep in the fridge until ready to cook. ​

name: Chicken Mang Inasal (New)
instructions: Grease the grates with cooking spray, turn on the flame to preheat and cover until temperature reaches 350 F.  If your grill doesn't come with a temperature gauge, just make sure the plates are heated for few minutes.

Add the marinated chicken on the middle grates and brush them with prepared oil. Turn off the heat in the middle where the chicken are placed at and leave the two sides (far sides /empty grates) turned on to high heat. Cover the grill and grill the chicken for about 20 minutes.
Flip the chicken on the other side and brush with prepared oil. Cover the grill and cook for another 20 minutes.
Turn the chicken again, brush with oil and cook each side for additional 10-15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
This process of grilling the chicken avoids burning the chicken skin. Slow grilling also makes the chicken juicy with the skin mildly crispy and the inside fully cooked.

name: Chicken Nuggets
ingredients: 4 slices of bread, edges trimmed and cut into small pieces
1 lb or 500 grams chicken breast, cut into small cubes
instructions: Soak bread in 1/3 cup milk.
In a blender, combine chicken, garlic salt, onion powder, pepper, paprika, mustard, soy sauce and ginger powder.
Blend for about 1-2 minutes. Remove and stir-in cornstarch.
Transfer the mixture to a greased surface like a tray, silicone mat, parchment or wax paper.
Add about 1 tsp or more of vegetable oil.

Grease hands with some oil to knead. Flatten the mixture into a square or rectangle. You can use a offset spatula to make it easier and achieve an even shape. Cut into serving pieces about 2 x 2 or smaller.
Whisk eggs, salt and 1 tbsp milk.
Dip the nuggets into the egg and coat with breadcrumbs.
Freeze for about 30 minutes before frying. The rest can be stored in the freezer for up to 2 months for  later use.
Heat cooking oil in a deep pan. Deep fry for about 3 minutes or until golden.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.
Recipe yields 25-30 chicken nuggets.

name: Chicken Pochero
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken, cut into serving size
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a pan or wok.
Add bananas and fry until lightly browned. Remove from pan and set aside.
Add potatoes and fry until lightly browned. Remove from pan and set aside.
Add chorizo. Remove from pan and set aside.
Using the same pan, saute garlic & onion.
Add the chicken. Simmer for 5 minutes or until tender. (requires occasional stirring).
Add the fish sauce and cook for 2 minutes.
Add water and tomato sauce. Simmer for about 8 minutes.
Add all the cooked bananas, potatoes and chorizo.
Add green beans, garbanzos and whole peppercorns. Simmer for 3 minutes. Season with additional fish sauce or salt if needed.
Add pechay or bokchoy. Simmer for 2 minutes.
Turn off heat & transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve with hot steamed white rice.
Enjoy!​​

name: Chicken Tinola
ingredients: 1-1/2 to 2 lbs chicken (cut into serving pieces)
1 thumb size ginger root cut into think strips
2 small to medium sayote/chayote or green papaya (cut into wedges)
1 cup or more fresh pepper leaves, moringa (malunggay) or spinach
instructions: In a pot or wok,  heat cooking oil. Saute' ginger and let juice come out.
Add garlic and saute until fragrant.
Add onion and cook until soft.
Add the chicken cuts and cook for 5 minutes or until the chicken colors lightly.
Add the fish sauce. Stir to combine.
Pour-in water and bring to a boil. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
Add the chicken cube and sayote/chayote. Continue simmering until sayote/chayote is tender. **If using papaya, add green papaya a little earlier since papaya is firmer than chayote.
Add the pepper leaves, spinach or malunggay.
Cover and turn off heat.
Best served with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!

name: Chicken Tocino
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken leg meat, thinly sliced and cut into serving portions
instructions: Combine marinade. ingredients. Stir well.
Marinade chicken in mixture.
Cover and refrigerate for over night or better for 24 hours.Turn at least once.
Pan-fry in cooking oil.
Serve with sunny side up eggs and plain rice or garlic rice and vinegar as dipping sauce.
Enjoy!

name: Chicken & Pork Adobo
ingredients: 1 lb pork belly, cut into serving sizes
1 lb chicken, cut into serving sizes
instructions: In a wok, marinate chicken & pork belly in soy sauce, bay leaves & garlic for at least 1 hour.
Turn on the stove. Add water and simmer for 30 minutes.
Add vinegar and simmer for 10 minutes.
Turn off the stove and remove marinade (sauce) leaving the meat, garlic & bay leaves in the wok.
Turn on the stove to medium heat, add cooking oil and stir fry the meat in the wok for 5-10 minutes.
Put-in the sauce back to the wok. (optional - If you want it with sauce.) Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with hot rice. Enjoy!

name: Chicken Sipo Egg
instructions: Boil enough water in a deep sauce pan. Cook the quail eggs for 5 mins. Remove shells and set aside.
In a wok or pan, melt butter. Saute garlic and onion.
Add the chicken strips and cook for about 2 minutes.
Add the mixed veggies, chicken cube, garlic powder, salt & pepper. Stir until combined.
Add water, all purpose cream and cornstarch dissolved in water. Let it simmer and cook until sauce starts to thicken.
Add cooked quail eggs and cook for another minute.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Chili Crab
instructions: Steam the crabs. Remove the cover and cut the body in half or into 4 pieces. Set aside.
In a bowl, mix together ketchup, water, cornstarch and soy sauce. Set aside.
Heat oil in a skillet or pan. Fry garlic and onions. Add pepper flakes.
Add the crabs and fry about 5 minutes.
Stir in sauce mixture until the crabs are well coated. Cover and let simmer for few minutes.
Stir in lime juice.
Stir in beaten egg until it is fully cooked.
Remove from heat and sprinkle with green onions.
Serve and Enjoy!!!

name: Coca Cola BBQ
ingredients: 2 lbs or 1-kilo pork short ribs or baby back ribs
salt and pepper to taste if desired
instructions: Carbonated drinks are great marinades for meat
Marinating meats in carbonated drinks like Coca-cola will result in melt in your mouth goodness
When lighting your coal for grilling, do it with your lid off or grill uncovered. This is to allow air to quickly make the coal burn.
Cover after it has been lit and starting to burn so that heat increases making coals burn faster. It will take 20 to 30 mins before it's ready.
Be patient
Coal is ready for grilling when you see it turn gray ashes on its surface.
Barbeques go great with dips or pickled garnish. So, make sure to make some before you start grilling!
Basting sauce can be prepared ahead of time. Store in an airtight container and refrigerate for no more two weeks.

name: Coconut Curry Shrimp
ingredients: 2 1/2 tbsp pepper juice from the jar of pickled pepper
instructions: Cook the shrimps in water. Remove from water once it starts boiling. Set aside.
In a wok, saute garlic, onion and ginger in cooking.
Add the coconut milk. Let it simmer.
Add curry paste, pickled peppers and pepper juice.
Add the boiled shrimps.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cook for 8-10 minutes or until you see the shrimp fats coming out from the head's shell.
Serve with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!

name: Corned Beef with Cabbage
ingredients: 1/2 tbsp fish sauce or salt to taste
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a pan or wok.
Saute garlic and onion.
Cook until onion is translucent.
And tomatoes and cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add the corned beef.
Stir and cook for about 5 minutes.
Add water and fish sauce or salt. Let it boil.
Add the cabbage.
Simmer for 1 minutes. Season with ground pepper. Stir and turn off heat.​
Best served with white steamed rice.
Enjoy.​​

name: Corned Beef with Potatoes
ingredients: 1 can (11.5 oz) corned beef (I used Ox & Palm or Palm Brand )
instructions: Heat 2 tbsp of cooking oil in a pan or wok.
Pan fry potatoes until tender. Remove from pan. Set aside.
Using the same pan, saute garlic, cook until color turns light brown.
Add onion. Cook until translucent then add tomatoes and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the corned beef. Stir to combine and cook for about 5 minutes.
Season with salt according to your taste.
Best serve with white steamed rice and fried egg if you will be preparing it for breakfast.
Enjoy :)

name: Crabs in Spicy Garlic and Butter Sauce
instructions: Steam the crabs. Set aside.
Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
Cook the garlic in the butter until translucent.
Stir in the parsley, salt, and pepper.
Continue to heat mixture until bubbling. Add the crabs.
Toss to coat.
Allow to simmer in the butter mixture until completely heated, 8-10 minutes.
Serve and Enjoy!!!

name: Crab with Miswa​
ingredients: 1 whole dungeness crab or 5-6 blue crabs, cooked, cracked and halved
green onion / spring onion, sliced or chopped
instructions: Saute garlic and onion. Cook until translucent.
Add the rice wash and let it boil.
Add the cooked crabs. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the misua and cook for another 5 minutes.
Add the green onions and salt to taste.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Creamy Baked Salmon
ingredients: Salt, Pepper, Dried Thyme, Dried Rosemary - for seasoning
instructions: ​Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut 1 sheet of aluminum foil of 15-inch (40cm) length.
Combine all ingredients for the garlic cream sauce in a bowl and set aside.
Prepare vegetables on a sheet of foil.
Season with salt, pepper, thyme and rosemary.
Place salmon on top of the seasoned vegetables.
Season the salmon with salt and pepper.
Spoon over some of the dill cream sauce on top.
Wrap sides of foil then fold up each ends to seal.
Transfer to a baking pan.
Bake until salmon has cooked through, about 20 minutes (may vary based on the thickness of your salmon fillets).
Carefully open foil packets and serve warm with additional dill cream sauce if you want.
Enjoy!

name: Creamy Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb or 1/2 kilo chicken breast, cut into cubes
1 tbsp olive oil or vegetable oil
green onions or spinach or vegetables of choice
instructions: Cut chicken breast into cubes.
Transfer the chicken cuts into a bowl then add olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, basil, chili flakes and salt. Mix well then marinate for about 10-15 minutes.
In a saucepan, add milk and bring to a low simmer. Add cream cheese and cook until melted. Add parmesan cheese and cook until smooth.
Season with garlic powder and dried basil.
Continue cooking until sauce thickens.
Serve with steamed rice or cauliflower rice.
Enjoy!

name: Crispy Buttered Garlic Chicken
ingredients: 1/2 tsp seasoning powder (majic sarap or other brand)
instructions: Marinate chicken in pepper and seasoning powder for at least 30 minutes to an hour.
Saute' garlic in margarine. Cook until fragrant. Set aside.
Combine batter ingredients.
Add the marinated chicken. Mix until well combined.
Heat cooking oil in a deep pan.
Add the breaded chicken. Cook until golden and crispy.
Transfer to a serving plate and drizzle with sauce.
You can also use the sauce as a dipping sauce if you like.
Enjoy.
If you have tried this recipe, please let me know by commenting below. Thanks!

name: Crispy Chicken Fillet with White Sauce
ingredients: 1-1/2 lbs boneless chicken breast fillet, about 5 pieces
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chicken breast and marinade ingredients. Mix until chicken is well coated. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.
In a medium saucepan, add butter and cook over medium-low heat until melted.
Add carrots and saute for about one minute.
Combine all-purpose flour and water. Stir well then add into the pan.
Add evaporated milk, all purpose cream and chicken cube. Continue mixing until sauce ingredients are well combined and chicken cube has dissolved. Bring to a light simmer then reduce heat to low.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir constantly and cook until sauce has slightly thickened.
While sauce is simmering, coat the marinated chicken with bread crumbs.

In a pan, heat cooking oil. Fry the breaded chicken breast until golden brown and cooked through, about 5 minutes depending on the thickness of the chicken breast.  Remove from heat and drain on paper towels.
Drizzle warm sauce over fried chicken fillets and garnish with green onions if desired.
Serve immediately with hot steamed rice, mashed potato or roasted or steamed vegetables of your choice.
Recipe yields about 5 Chicken Fillets.
Enjoy.​ ​

name: Crispy Fried Chicken
ingredients: Oil, for frying, preferably peanut oil
instructions: Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
Dip the seasoned chicken in the egg, and then coat well with flour.
Heat the oil to 350 degrees F in a deep pot.
Do not fill the pot more than 1/2 full with oil.
Note: If you do not have a gadget to check the temp of the oil, just make sure that the oil is hot enough before dropping the chicken. If not, your chicken will be oily.

name: ​Crispy Pata
ingredients: extra salt for rubbing the leg after boiling​
instructions: Combine water, pork leg, salt, onion, peppercorns and laurel leaves. Boil for at least 1- 1 1/2 hours until tender. You can also use a pressure cooker and boil for 12-15 minutes (boiling time or when it starts to whistle) or until tender.
Remove from the water and cool it down.
Refrigerate for at least 8 hours or overnight.
When ready, rub the whole leg with salt and rest for 30 minutes.
Heat cooking oil deep enough to fry the pork leg.
Add the pork and fry for few minutes or until just the color turns light brown. Do not fully cook.
Remove from the oil and cool completely.
Once the pork has cooled down, heat the cooking oil again.
Deep fry the pork leg again until golden and crispy.
Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
Enjoy.

name: Crispy Pata Choco Binagoongan
ingredients: 1 cup pork stock (reserved from the boiled pork)
instructions: ​While waiting, prepare the sauce by adding cooking oil in a heated pan.
Saute onion then add garlic. Cook until onion is soft and garlic is aromatic.
Add the shrimp paste. Saute' for about 5-8 minutes.
Add the reserved pork broth and chocolate syrup. Let it boil
Add the vinegar. Do not stir. Continue boiling.
Add sugar and cook for another 10 minutes.
Once the pork has cooled down, heat the cooking oil again.
Deep fry the pork leg again until golden and crispy.
Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
Rest for few minutes before adding the binagoongan sauce.
Serve with fried eggplants if preferred.
Enjoy.

name: Daing na Bangus
ingredients: 1 whole milkfish (bangus), cleaned & sliced daing-style (butterfly cut)​
instructions: Combine marinade. Stir.
Arrange bangus in a container or ziploc bag.
Pour marinade. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Turn at least once.
Fry until brown.
Serve with tomatoes and or salted egg and plain rice or fried rice.
Or serve with Pickled Papaya or what we call Atchara. Link for the recipe below.
Enjoy!

name: Easy Baked Chicken Thighs
ingredients: 4 pieces bone-in chicken thighs with skin
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray.
Combine mayonnaise and olive oil. Set aside.
In a separate small bowl, combine paprika, salt and pepper.
Marinate chicken thighs with mayo mixture and combined seasonings.
Set aside to marinade for at least 2 hours.
Arrange chicken thighs on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake chicken in the preheated oven until skin is crispy, thighs are no longer pink at the bone, and the juices run clear, about 50 minutes.

name: Easy Fried Chicken
ingredients: 6-8 pieces chicken legs and or chicken thighs
salt and pepper to season the chicken
oil for frying, preferably peanut oil
instructions: Rinse the chicken legs and pat dry.
Season with salt and pepper. Let stand for 30 minutes.
In a bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt.
In a another bowl, beat two eggs.
Dip the seasoned chicken in egg then coat well with flour mixture.
In a deep pot or pan, heat oil to 350 F .

Note: If you do not have a gadget to check the temp of the oil, just make sure that the oil is hot enough before dropping the chicken. If not, your chicken will be oily. To check the oil, dip the edge of a wooden spoon. Oil is ready when bubbles gather around it.
Deep fry for about 10-15 minutes or until golden and crispy. Frying time varies depending on the size of the chicken.
Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve with Gravy, Banana Catsup, Sarsa ni Mang Thomas or Ranch.
Enjoy.

name: Easy Sesame Chicken
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs chicken meat (breast, thigh,  or leg) sliced diagonally
instructions: ​​In a large bowl. mix together chicken, soy sauce, sesame oil, egg white and grated garlic. Marinate for 10-15 minutes. Add flour and toss to combine until chicken meat is fully coated.
Fill a deep pan with vegetable oil. Fry the breaded chicken until cooked through, crisp and golden. Set aside.
In a wok, stir together 1/2 cup water, vinegar, sugar and soy sauce. Turn heat on medium and let simmer for about 1-2 minutes. Do not stir.
While simmering, dissolve cornstarch in 2 tbsp water. Lower heat then add the dissolve cornstarch.  Stir constantly and continue simmering until sauce is thick.
Add the fried chicken pieces and toss with the sauce until fully incorporated.  Add the sesame seeds.
Serve immediately and garnish with more sesame seeds if desired.
Enjoy.

name: Embutido
ingredients: 6 pieces vienna sausage (cut in half lengthwise)
1 cup bread crumbs or 2 slices of white bread tear into small pieces
instructions: Mix together the ground pork, raw egg, tomato sauce, pickles relish, carrots, bell pepper, raisins, onions, bread crumbs or white breads, salt and pepper. Combine well.
Spread the mixture on aluminum foil.
Arrange the sausages, hard-boiled eggs alternately on top of the flat mixture.
Shape into a roll about 5-6 inches in diameter and wrap in foil.
Steam for 1 hour.
Refrigerate. Unwrap and slice before serving with ketchup.
Enjoy!

name: Escabeche
ingredients: 4-5 pieces Hasa-Hasa (Short-bodied Mackerel)  or 1 piece Apahap (Barramundi) or Tilapia - Fried
instructions: Fry fish and set aside.
Mix water, vinegar, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In a pan or wok, saute ginger, garlic and onion.
Add vinegar mixture. Do not stir. Bring to a boil.
When boiling, add yellow powder, fried fish and bell pepper. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with steamed white rice.
Enjoy!

name: Filipino-Style Chicken Barbecue
instructions: Grease the grates with cooking spray, turn on the flame to preheat and cover until temperature reaches 350 F.  If your grill doesn't come with a temperature gauge, just make sure the plates are heated for few minutes.

Add the marinated chicken on the middle grates and brush them with extra marinade. Turn off the heat in the middle grates where the chicken are placed at and leave the two sides (far sides /empty grates) turned on to high heat. Cover the grill and grill the chicken for about 20 minutes.
Flip the chicken on the other side and brush again with marinade. Cover the grill and cook for another 20 minutes.
Turn the chicken again, brush with oil and cook each side for additional 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
This process of grilling the chicken avoids burning the chicken skin. Slow grilling also makes the chicken juicy with the skin mildly crispy and the inside fully cooked but still juicy.

name: Fish Sarciado
ingredients: 2 whole Tilapia or any fish you prefer (cleaned and pan fried)
3-4 large tomatoes or 15 pieces cherry tomatoes, diced
instructions: Season the fish with salt.
Pan fry the fish in cooking oil. Set aside.
In a separate pan, saute garlic and onion. Cook until onion is translucent.
Add the tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add water and simmer for 3-5 minutes.
Add the beaten egg and fish sauce. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add the fried fish. Pour some sauce over the fish and cook for 5 minutes.
Serve with hot steamed white rice.
Enjoy!​

name: Fish Steak
ingredients: 1 milk fish, bangus, cleaned, sliced & fried
instructions: In a pan or wok, combine water, soy sauce & lemon juice. Bring to a boil.
Add the fried fish. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the onion rings. Simmer for 3 minutes.
Serve with steamed rice.
Enjoy!

name: Foil-Baked Salmon in Basil
instructions: Tear two sheets of foil big enough to wrap salmon, stack one on top of the other, and drizzle about 2 tbsp. olive oil in the center. Place flour salmon filets on top of the olive oil.
Top each piece of salmon with a soy sauce, basil leaves, garlic, onion, tomatoes and lemon juice.
Wrap salmon in foil.
Bake at 450 F for 20-30 minutes.
Serve hot, and enjoy!

name: Fried Rice
ingredients: Pork adobo, divided or cut into small pieces
instructions: Heat a small amount of cooking oil in a wok.
Fry the beaten egg. Remove from pan and divide into small pieces.
Add a small amount of cooking oil and saute the garlic.
Add the chorizo, carrots, and green peas. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add the rice and mix well. Cook for 3 minutes.
Add the pork adobo and garlic salt.  Cook for few minutes.
Transfer to a serving plate.
Enjoy! ​

name: Fried Tofu in Oyster Sauce
instructions: Open your package of tofu, drain, and squeeze out as much moisture as possible.
Cut the tofu into uniform cubes or chunks.
Heat cooking oil in a wok.
Fry tofu cubes in oil (enough to coat bottom of pan) until browned on all sides.
Remove "done" pieces from wok. Set aside.
Using the same wok, saute garlic.
Add the asparagus. Cook until it tender.
Add the fried tofu and oyster sauce.
Stir until sauce is well incorporated with fried tofu cubes and asparagus.
Serve and Enjoy! ​

name: Garlic Butter Salmon Fillet
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 F .
Place salmon over a baking pan lined with foil that is enough to cover the salmon.
In a small bow, combine butter, lemon and garlic
Pour over the salmon.
Season with salt, pepper, oregano and parsley.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven. Add lemon wedges on top of the baked salmon.
Bring it back to the oven and place on top rack.
Broil for 3-5 minutes. Make sure to keep an eye to avoid burning the top of the salmon.
Remove from oven.
Scoop the butter sauce from the sides of the pan and pour over the salmon.
Serve with your favorite sides.
Enjoy :)

name: ​Garlic Buttered Shrimp
ingredients: 1 lb or 1/2 kilo shrimp, cleaned and deveined
instructions: Combine shrimp and sprite/7Up. Marinate for at least 30 minutes. Remove the shrimp and reserve marinade.
Heat butter in a wok or large pan.
Add the garlic. Cook until fragrant.
Add the marinated shrimp.
Stir until all well combined.
Add the pepper. Continue stirring until shrimp turns orange in color.
Add the reserved sprite/7up.
Cover and bring to a boil.
Immediately remove the shrimp (to avoid over cooking) leaving the sauce in the pan.
Add fish sauce and seasoning powder.
Simmer for about 2-3 minutes or until the sauce is reduced and slightly thickened.
Return the shrimp and stir until just combined with the sauce.
Transfer the shrimp on a serving plate and drizzle with extra sauce.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Garlic Chicken
ingredients: 1 - 1 1/2 lbs chicken, cut into serving portions
instructions: Combine sauce ingredients. Set aside.
In small bowl, lightly beat egg white.
Add in cornstarch and sherry wine. Stir until cornstarch is dissolved. Add chicken and coat well. .
Stir-fry garlic in heated cooking oil. Add in chicken and cook until tender (around 10 minutes).
Add the prepared sauce and green onions.
Cook for about 15-minutes while stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving plate.
Serve with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!​

name: Ginataang Hipon sa Kalabasa
ingredients: 20 strands long beans, cut into 3 inch long
instructions: In a pan or wok, saute galic and onion.
Cook until onion becomes translucent.
Add squash and long beans.
Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the water. Simmer until squash is half cooked.
Add coconut milk and fish sauce.
Cook for few minutes. Let it boil.
Add shrimps. Simmer for 15-10 minutes or until the vegetables are cooked.
Add the chili pepper (optional)
Serve hot.
Enjoy!​

name: Ginataang
ingredients: siling labuyo, sliced  or 1/2 tsp crushed red pepper
2 bundles kangkong (water spinach) washed, hard stems removed
instructions: In a wok or deep pan, saute the ginger in cooking oil.
After browning, remove from the pan.
Saute garlic and onion on the same pan. Cook until onion is translucent.
Add the ginger, crushed red pepper and shrimps.
Cook until the shrimp is half cooked.
Add the coconut milk and simmer in low heat.
Add the kangkong leaves. Simmer till cooked.
Season with salt to taste.
Remove from heat.
Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Hipon with Kangkong
ingredients: siling labuyo, sliced  or 1/2 tsp crushed red pepper
2 bundles kangkong (water spinach) washed, hard stems removed
instructions: In a wok or deep pan, saute the ginger in cooking oil.
After browning, remove from the pan.
Saute garlic and onion on the same pan. Cook until onion is translucent.
Add the ginger, crushed red pepper and shrimps.
Cook until the shrimp is half cooked.
Add the coconut milk and simmer in low heat.
Add the kangkong leaves. Simmer till cooked.
Season with salt to taste.
Remove from heat.
Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Ginataang Manok with Quail Eggs
ingredients: 1 tsp annatto powder dissolved in 1/4 cup water
instructions: Heat pan with cooking oil. Fry potatoes and carrots. Cook until slightly tender.  Set aside.
In the same pan, saute garlic and onion.
Add the chicken and fish sauce to taste. Cook for 10 minutes or until the chicken is tender with occasional stirring.
Add the coconut milk. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the dissolved annatto mix.
Add potatoes, carrots and quail eggs.
Simmer once.
Remove from heat.
Serve hot.
Enjoy!

name: Ginataang Puso ng Saging
ingredients: ​​1/2 lb pork belly or pork shoulder,  cut into strips
instructions: ​Trim off stem of banana heart. Peel and discard the outer, fibrous skin layers of banana heart until you reach the lighter, softer core. Cut in half and slice thinly. Soak in cold water with salt for 20 minutes then squeeze to release bitter sap. Rinse at least 3-4 times and drain well. Set aside.
In a pan or wok, heat cooking oil.
Saute garlic then add onion and cook until translucent.
Add pork and cook, stirring occasionally until color turns light brown.
Add fish sauce and continue to cook for about 5 minutes or until pork is tender.
Add the banana heart. Stir occasionally and cook until softened and releases liquid, about 5-10 minutes.
Add the coconut milk. Cover and simmer while stirring occasionally about for 10 minutes or until sauce gets thick.
Add chili pepper (if desired).
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with hot steamed rice.​Enjoy!

name: Ginisang Munggo
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups pork, cut into strips or cubed
2 tbsp fish sauce or salt to taste
instructions: Rinse the mung beans in running water.
In a pan, boil mung beans in 2 1/2 cups water. Cook until tender.
In another pan, heat a small amount of cooking oil and pan fry the pork. Cook until tender. Remove the pork from pan and set aside.
Using the same pan, saute garlic, onion and tomatoes.
Add the pork and fish sauce.  Cook for few minutes.
Add the cooked mung beans together with the water.
Add bittermelon leaves and cook for 5-8 minutes.
Transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve and Enjoy!

name: Ginisang Sardinas / Sauteed Sardines
ingredients: 1 can (15oz) mackerel sardines, I used Ligo Sardines
instructions: Heat cooking oil In a pan or wok,.
Saute garlic, onion and tomatoes.
Add the sardines, soy sauce and lemon juice.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with hot steamed white rice.
Enjoy!​

name: Ginisang Sayote
instructions: Saute garlic, onion and tomatoes in cooking oil.
Add the ground pork. Cook until the meat turns light brown.
Add the fish sauce (patis) and cook for few minutes.
Add the sayote/chayote and combine it with the pork. Add the ground pepper. Cook for 3 minutes.
Add the water and simmer for 5 minutes. Season with salt to taste. Make sure not to overcook the sayote.
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve hot.
Enjoy!​​

name: Ginisang Sitaw at Kalabasa
ingredients: 1/4 lb pork, strips or cut into cubes
string beans cut into 2 inch strips
instructions: In a pan or wok, cook pork strips in 1/2 cup of water until brown and tender. (Water will dry out and oil from pork will come out).
In the same pan, saute garlic and onion until transparent.
Add the shrimp and pork. Cook for few minutes.
Add string beans and squash. Stir fry for few minutes.
Add water and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add shrimp cubes.
Cook until vegetables are tender.
Serve with rice. Enjoy.

name: Ginisang Upo
instructions: Saute garlic, onion and tomatoes in cooking oil.
Add the ground pork. Cook until the meat turns light brown.
Add the fish sauce (patis) and cook for few minutes.
Add the upo (gourd) and combine it with the pork. Add the ground pepper. Cook for 3 minutes.
Add the water and simmer for 5 minutes. Make sure not to overcook the upo.
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Green Beans in Oyster Sauce
instructions: Blanch green beans in a large stock pot of well salted boiling water until bright green color and tender crisp, roughly about 2 minutes. Drain and shock in a bowl of ice water to stop from cooking.
Heat cooking oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and saute' until fragrant.
Add the green beans and continue to saute' until coated in oil and garlic and heated through, about 3 minutes.
Add oyster sauce and cook again for another 3 minutes or until green beans are slightly tender.
Season with sesame seeds. Stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper if desired.
Remove from heat and serve with a bowl of white steamed rice or as a side for lightly seasoned fish or meat.
Enjoy.

name: Grilled New York Steak
ingredients: Slices of New York Strip Steak
instructions: Prepare the grill brushed with some oil or butter.
Season your steak with salt and pepper.
Grill according to your liking.
Serve and enjoy :)

name: Grilled T-Bone Sreak
instructions: Combine all the ingredients together except the meat. (makes about 1 cup)
Marinade the steak with the mixed barbeque sauce
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Cook the marinated beef over grill.
Use the remaining marinade to baste the barbecue for added flavor and to keep the meat from drying out.
Season with steak seasoning while grilling.
Serve with grilled vegetables of your choice.
Enjoy your yummy STEAK :)

name: Grilled New York Steak
ingredients: New York Steak or Ribeye Steak
instructions: Season the steaks with garlic salt or salt and ground pepper.
Prepare the grill, brush with butter to avoid sticking.
Grill steaks, covered, over medium heat 5-7 minutes on each side or until meat reaches desired doneness (for medium-rare, a thermometer should read 135°; medium, 140°; medium-well, 145°).
Brush with butter (if desired) during the last four minutes of cooking.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Halabos na Hipon
instructions: In a wok, bring water to a boil.
Add salt & shrimps. Cook for 3-5 minutes.
Remove the shrimps from the water.
In a separate pan, fry the shrimps at least 2 minutes on both sides.
Serve with dipping sauce.
Enjoy!​

name: Higadillo
ingredients: 2 lbs pork belly, cut into strips
1/2 cup pork or beef liver, cut into strips
1 cup all purpose sauce (Sarsa ni Mang Tomas)
1 tbsp fish sauce, adjust according to taste
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a pan or wok.
Saute garlic, onion and tomatoes.
Add the pork. Cook for 5 minutes or until color turns light brown.
Add liver. Stir to combine.
Simmer for 10 minutes or until the pork & liver becomes tender.
Add the fish sauce and cook for few minutes.
Add water and vinegar. Do not stir. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add sugar and all purpose sauce. Simmer for 10 minutes or until the sauce becomes slightly thick.
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve with hot steamed white rice.
Enjoy!

name: Honey Baked Salmon
instructions: Pre-heat oven to 375 degrees F.
Line baking dish with aluminum foil big enough to fold over and seal to cove the salmon.
Lay down salmon fillets and sprinkle salt and pepper to taste.
In a small saucepan, melt the butter over low-medium heat.
Add the honey, garlic and lemon, and whisk until the honey has melted through the butter and the mixture is well combined.
Pour the butter/honey mixture over the salmon, and using a pastry brush or spoon, spread evenly over the salmon.
Fold the sides of the foil over the salmon, covering completely and sealing the packet closed.
Place baking dish on the middle rack and bake for 15-18 minutes.
Open the foil, garnish with parsley and broil for 2-3 minute to caramelize the top.
Serve with steamed rice, quinoa or vegetables on the side.
I served mine with stir fried vegetable medley.
Enjoy.

name: Honey Chicken Wings
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken wings, cleaned and pat try with paper towels
salt and ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: ​In a non-stick wok or large pan, melt butter over medium heat.
Saute' ginger and garlic until aromatic.
Add chili flakes and chicken wings.
Fry for about 5-7 minutes. Keep turning the wings.
Add the soy sauce and sesame oil Cook for about 8-10 minutes.
Add the honey and cook for another 8-10 minutes or until the chicken is cooked and sauce becomes sticky. Cook under low heat while stirring occasionally as you do not want to burn the chicken wings.
Season with some salt and pepper if desired.
Enjoy!

ingredients: 2 lbs pork belly cut into strips
1/2 cup pork or beef liver, cut into strips
3/4 cup all purpose sauce (sarsa ni Mang Tomas)
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a pan or wok. Saute garlic, onion and tomatoes.
Add the pork and liver. Simmer for 20 minutes or until the pork & liver becomes tender.
Add the fish sauce and cook for few minutes.
Add water and vinegar. Do not stir. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add sugar and all purpose sauce. Simmer for 10 minutes or until the sauce becomes slightly thick.
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve with hot steamed white rice. Enjoy!

name: Honey Garlic Chicken
ingredients: 4-6 pieces chicken drumsticks or 3 chicken leg quarters
1/4 cup honey or blue agave syrup
instructions: In a small bowl, combine all sauce ingredients together. Set aside.
Make a few slits on the chicken legs. (This makes the sauce sink in the meat).
Place the chicken legs in a zip bag. Add the sauce.
Marinate the chicken for at least 30 minutes to 1 hour.
Heat oven to 425 degrees F.
Transfer the marinated chicken legs into the baking pan or tray lined with foil. I I always line my tray with foil for easy clean up. :)
Bake for 35-45 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
Broil for 1  1/2 - 2 minutes if desired. (Keep an eye when broiling to avoid burning the chicken).
Enjoy your Baked Honey Garlic Chicken! ​

name: Honey Garlic Chicken Drumsticks
instructions: Make a few slits in the meat of chicken legs.
Arrange on a baking tray or pan. Pat dry with paper towels.
Season with salt, pepper and onion powder.
In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, honey and sesame oil.
Pour over chicken legs.
Add garlic and mix to combine or until chicken legs are evenly coated with the sauce.
Marinate for at 1 hour turning at least once.
Bake in a preheated oven at 425 F for 20 minutes.
Turn the chicken legs completely over on its other side and bake for another 20 minutes.

Turn again and cook for an additional 5 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. If desired, broil for additional 2-3 minutes for a crispier skin. (Make sure to keep an eye when broiling to avoid burning the top.)
Remove from oven and while hot, pour some sauce over the baked chicken.
Top with toasted sesame seeds.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Hot and Sour Shrimp
ingredients: 1 lb medium raw shrimp, peeled & deveined
1/2 small cucumber, cut in half lengthwise
1 medium red bell pepper, cut into short thin strips​​
instructions: Combine rice vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar and cornstarch in a small bowl. Mix well. Set aside.
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat.
Add shrimp, garlic and red pepper flakes; stir fry 1 minute.
Add mushrooms and bell pepper strips.
Stir fry 2 minutes or until shrimp are opaque.
Stir vinegar mixture.
Cook and stir 30 seconds or until sauce boils and thickens.
Add cucumber. Stir fry until heated through.
Serve over hot steamed rice.

name: Kare-Kare
ingredients: 2 1/2 lbs Pork or Beef hocks or Ox tail ,cut into 2" lengths
1 bundle sitaw or long beans (cut 3" length)
instructions: Boil the pork hocks until soft. Set aside. Reserve the broth.
In a wok, saute garlic and onion.
Add pork hocks and fish sauce. Cook for few minutes.
Add 2 1/2 cups of the pork/beef broth, salt, achuete and peanut butter. Simmer for 5 mins.
Add the vegetables and cook until vegetables are tender. Stir occasionally.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve with bagoong or shrimp paste.

name: Kinilaw na Puso ng Saging
ingredients: ​​1 lb pork belly, cut into strips
instructions: ​Trim off stem of banana heart. Peel and discard the outer, fibrous skin layers of banana heart, until you reach the lighter, softer core. Cut in half and slice thinly. Soak in cold water with salt for 20 minutes then squeeze to release bitter sap. Rinse at least 4x and drain well. Set aside.
In a pan or wok, heat cooking oil.
Saute garlic then add onion and cook until translucent.
Add pork and cook, stirring occasionally until color turns light brown.
Add fish sauce and continue to cook for about 5 minutes or until pork is tender.
Add the banana heart. Stir occasionally and cook until softened and releases liquid, about 5 minutes.
Add water, cover and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add vinegar. Cook uncovered without stirring for 5 minutes.
Add chili pepper (if desired). Stir and continue to cook for another 10 minutes.

Serve with hot steamed rice.
​Enjoy!

name: Korean Beef Bowl
instructions: I used Kikkoman Soy Sauce for this recipe. I am telling you this because different brands vary. Some are salty than others. Kikkoman has this aroma but a little lighter in taste.
Substitute lemon juice for rice vinegar if not available but I suggest to have this in your pantry as it as another useful ingredient when making Chinese food.
Use Sriracha sauce to substitute for chili garlic sauce. It can be adjusted or totally omitted if desired.

name: Lechon Kawali
ingredients: 2 lbs pork liempo, cut into small sizes
instructions: Boil water with salt.
Put-in the pork and boil until tender. Remove the scum on top of the liquid so you can use the liquid for soup.
Remove liempo from fire and let it cool.
Heat cooking oil which can submerge the whole liempo.
When hot (350 deg F),  put liempo & cook for 10-12 minutes until the skin is crisp.
Remove from the oil and drain.
Enjoy! ​

name: Lechon Paksiw
ingredients: 2 1/4 cups all-purpose sauce  (Sarsa ni Mang Thomas)
instructions: Chop lechon into small serving pieces.
In a pan or wok, combine soy sauce, vinegar, salt, water and sugar.  Stir and let it boil.
Add garlic, peppercorns, lily flower and all-purpose sauce. Simmer for 3 minutes.
Add left over lechon. Lower heat and simmer until lechon skin becomes very soft and sauce thickens.
Best served with hot white steamed rice.
Enjoy! ​​

name: ​Lemon Herb Salmon Fillet
ingredients: 1 slice salmon fillet or steel head (salmon trout) fillet with skin
(Use fresh Parsley and Rosemary if available or if preferred)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F.
Place salmon fillet on a prepared sheet pan lined with foil.
Season with salt and pepper.
In a small bowl, combine olive oil, rosemary, parsley and spread over the top of salmon.
Insert some slices of lemon under the salmon fillet. (You can also do this before placing your salmon but I like doing it after so that the seasoning won't get to the lemons).
Cover the prepared salmon with foil.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and squeeze some lemon juice before eating.
Serve and enjoy! ​

If you would like to pair it with Parmesan Roasted Brussels Sprouts, click photo below for the recipe link. Or if you have tried this recipe or if you have questions , please feel free to drop a comment below. Thanks :)

name: Lemon Pepper Fish Fillet
instructions: Arrange the tilapia fillets in a pan covered with an aluminum foil, big enough to close it later into a pocket.
Brush both sides of the fillets with enough olive oil.
Sprinkle with lemon pepper salt seasoning.
or ***
Squeeze in the lemon juice.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Close the aluminum foil into a pocket to seal the fillets inside.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until tilapia flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with your favorite steamed vegetables.
Enjoy!

name: Lobster tails in Coconut Milk
ingredients: 1 thumb size ginger, cut into strips
2 small chili peppers or siling labuyo, sliced (optional)
small amount of cooking oil for sauteing
instructions: Wash lobsters and drain. Steam for 12- 15 minutes.
With a sharp knife or kitchen shears, carefully cut top side of lobster shells lengthwise. Pull apart shells slightly. Make a slit in the middle of the lobster and set aside.
In a pot or wok, sauté garlic, ginger and onion in cooking oil. Cook until onion is translucent.
Add the coconut milk, water and green onions.
Bring it to a boil and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes stirring occasionally until thick.
Add in the chili peppers, paprika and lobster tails and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve with steamed rice.

name: Meatballs Soup
ingredients: 1 pound ground beef or pork (I used ground lean beef)
2 bulbs or 1/2 cup green onions, chopped
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine  salt, ground pepper, onion and egg. Mix until fully incorporated.
Shape into 1 1/2" to 2" balls and roll in flour. (Makes about 18-20 pieces meatballs.)
In pan, fry the meatballs until golden. Remove from pan and drain and paper towels.
Discard excess oil in pan. Saute' garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add onions and cook until soft or translucent.
Add rice wash or water. ( Scroll up to read more about rice wash).
Add the bouillon, meatballs and fish sauce or salt to taste. Bring back to a full boil.
Add misua. Simmer until misua is cooked about 1-2 minutes.
Add green onions and turn off heat.
Enjoy.

name: Meaty Tortang Talong
instructions: Saute the garlic in cooking oil until fragrant.
Add the onion and cook until onion is translucent.
Add the ground pork. Cook until the meat turns light brown.
Add the fish sauce (patis). Cook for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Set aside and let it cool.
Once the cooked meat mixture has cooled down, add onto a bowl with 2 beaten eggs. Stir to combine and set aside.
Grill or broil the eggplants until tender, skins are charred and blisters appear. (Please see photo above). Let it cool.
Once cool, peel off the skins of the eggplant and retain its crown and stem.
In a plate with one beaten egg, gently flatten its meat with a fork.
Gently transfer the eggplant onto a pan with heated cooking oil.
Add the meat on top. Make sure it's compact and flattened into the eggplant.
Fry on medium heat. Flip the eggplant after 2-3 minutes. Cook the other side for another 2-3 minutes.
Serve with banana sauce (catsup) or ketchup and hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!​​

name: Menudo
ingredients: 1  1/2 lbs pork cut into strips or small chunks
instructions: Heat about 3 tbsp cooking oil in wok or large skillet/pan.
Pan fry the potatoes, carrots and bell pepper. Remove the vegetables from the pan then set aside.
Using the same wok or pan, add 2 tbsp cooking oil.
Stir fry garlic. Add onion and cook until translucent.
Add pork & liver. Simmer for about 5 minutes.
Add the fish sauce. Simmer for few minutes then add water.
Bring to a boil then add pork cube. Cook until the meat is tender.
Add carrots, potatoes, garbanzos, bell pepper and tomato sauce.
Simmer for about 5 minutes then add raisins. Cook until the sauce gets thick.
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve with hot steamed white rice.
Enjoy!​ ​​​

name: Misua soup with Meatballs
ingredients: green onion / spring onion, sliced or chopped
instructions: Combine pork, onions, salt, pepper and eggs.
Shape into 2" balls and roll in flour.
Fry until brown. Set aside the meatballs.
Remove excess oil from the pan. Leave at least 2 tbsp of cooking oil.
Saute garlic and onion.
Add the rice wash and let it boil.
Add the fried meatballs, fish sauce and misua.
Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the green onions.
Serve hot, and enjoy!

name: Nilagang Baboy
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs pork (ribs or belly) or beef
instructions: In a stock pot, simmer the beef shank for at least an hour or  until tender.
Remove the scum that rises above the soup. Add more hot water if necessary.
When meat is fork tender, add the onion, salt, whole peppercorn, potatoes and corn. Let stand for 5-8 minutes.
Add the cabbage, chinese cabbage and bokchoy. Season with fish sauce according to taste.
Remove from heat. Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Oven Roasted Crabs
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoons dried crushed red pepper or 1/2 tsp cajun seasoning
1 large Dungeness crab, cleaned, steamed and  cracked
instructions: Preheat oven to 500°F.
Melt butter with oil in a wok.
Stir in garlic. Cook until garlic turns golden brown.
Add crabs. Sprinkle chopped parsley and crushed pepper or cajun seasoning over crabs.
Stir to combine.
Transfer the crabs in a baking pan.
Roast crabs until heated through, turning and/or stirring once (5-6 minutes each side).
Remove from oven.
Squeeze some lemon over the roasted crabs. (optional)
Serve and enjoy!​​

name: Pakbet
ingredients: 1 medium bitter melon (Ampalaya), sliced to bite size
2 medium eggplants, sliced to bite size
instructions: In a pan or wok, saute garlic, ginger, tomatoes and onion.
Add the pork strips. Cook for 5-8 minutes or until pork turns brown in color.
Add the shrimp and shrimp paste. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add the water. Simmer until the pork is tender.
Add the squash and cook until it becomes soft.
Add the rest of the vegetables, starting from the long beans, eggplants and bitter melon.
Cook until the vegetables are done.
Add salt to taste.
Transfer to a serving bowl.
Enjoy!

name: Paksiw na Bangus
instructions: Arrange all the ingredients in a wok.
Simmer for over medium fire until the milkfish is cooked. (around 10-15 mins)
Remove from heat.
Serve and enjoy!​

name: Paksiw na Hito
instructions: Wrap each slice of catfish in banana leaves.
Arrange all the ingredients in a wok.
Simmer for over medium fire until the catish is cooked. (around 10-15 mins)
Remove the wrapped catfish from the soup.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Pesa
ingredients: 4-5 slices of fish (catfish, tilapia or lapu-lapu), cleaned
4-5 cups of rice water / rise wash
fish sauce or salt to taste
instructions: Heat a small amount of oil in a pan.
Saute ginger and onion.
Pour-in the rice water. Bring to a boil.
Add the slices of fish and peppercorns. Simmer for 10 minutes or until the fish is cooked.
Add the vegetables and cook for 2 minutes.
Add spring onions. Season with salt.
Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Picadillo
instructions: Add soy sauce and tomato sauce. Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Sauce will slightly reduced and thickened.
Add the cooked vegetables and green peas.
Cook for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve over hot white rice or add fried egg and fried banana on the side.
Enjoy.

name: Pinaputok na Tilapia
instructions: Clean the tilapia and make a slit on the side. Deepen and widen the cut along tilapia belly by using a sharp pointed knife.
Sprinkle both sides of the fish including the stomach/belly with salt. Set aside.
Mix the soy sauce, chopped onions and tomatoes in a bowl.
Fill the mixture to tilapia belly.
Prepare the banana leaves by greasing it with butter.
Wrap the fish tightly with the greased banana leaves.
Grill the fish for about 20 minutes, 10 minutes on each side.
Serve  with rice and toyomansi* sauce.

name: Pineapple Chicken
ingredients: 1 1/2 - 2 lbs chicken leg quarters, cut into serving portions
1 1/4 cups pineapple juice + 1/2 cup from reserved juice in pineapple slices in can
2-3 tbsp granulated sugar, adjust according to sweetness preference
1 can, 15 oz pineapple slices, reserve the juice
instructions: Marinate chicken pieces with salt, pepper and lemon juice. Let stand for about 20 minutes.
Heat cooking oil in  a pan. Pan fry the marinated chicken for about 2-3 minutes on each side. Do not fully cook.
Remove extra oil from the pan. Saute' garlic and cook until aromatic.
Add the fried chicken pieces  and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the pineapple juice including reserved juice from pineapple slices. Let it boil.
Add the sugar. Stir and simmer until sauce is reduced.
Add the pineapple slices. Cook for another 5 - 8 minutes.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Pine-Chicken Curry
instructions: Rub chicken with curry powder. Let stand for at 10 minutes.
Heat pan with cooking oil. Saute garlic and onion.
Add the chicken and fish sauce to taste. Cook for 5 minutes with constant stirring.
Add the water and coconut milk. Simmer for 15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked.
Add potatoes and cook for another 10 minutes.
Add the pineapple chunks. Simmer once.
Remove from heat.
Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Pork Adobo
ingredients: 1  1/2 - 2 lbs pork belly or pork shoulder, cut into small pieces
instructions: Marinate pork meat, soy sauce, bay leaves, whole peppercorns & garlic for at least 1 hour in a pan or wok. I suggest to marinate overnight. It's worth it :)
After marinating, add water and vinegar.
Simmer for 30-45 minutes or until pork is tender and sauce is almost dry.​

name: Pork Adobo with Sprite and Oyster Sauce
ingredients: 2 lbs or 1-kilo pork meat (shoulder, butt, and or pork belly)
1 head chopped garlic plus more for sauteing
instructions: In a bowl, combine pork meat, soy sauce, garlic, whole peppercorns and bay leaves. Refrigerate to marinate for at least 4 hours. Turn at least once during marination.

Transfer to a medium wok then add sprite and vinegar. Do not stir. Cover and let simmer for about 45 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove the cover and continue simmering, stirring occasionally until sauce is reduced.
