Remove the meat and remove the extra sauce. Leave some oil but do not discard the extra sauce.
Add garlic and saute' until fragrant. Bring back the meat to the wok, stir and cook for about 5 minutes.
Add the oyster sauce and extra sauce. Continue cooking for another 5 minutes.
Remove from the pan and transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve with rice and boiled eggs if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Pork Afritada
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a pan or wok.
Saute garlic & onion.
Add the pork. Simmer for 10-15 minutes or until tender.
Add the fish sauce and cook for 3 minutes.
Add water. Bring to a boil then add pork cube.
Add the potatoes. Simmer until potatoes are tender.
Add the bell pepper and tomato sauce. Simmer for 5 minutes or until the sauce gets thick.
Add salt to taste.
Remove from heat & transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve with hot steamed white rice.
Enjoy!​

name: Pork Barbeque
ingredients: 2-3 lbs pork belly or any preferred meat
instructions: Combine sauce ingredients.  (Makes about 3/4 to 1 cup)
Marinade the pork with the mixed barbeque sauce and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Cook the marinated pork over grill.
Use the remaining marinade to baste the barbecue for added flavor and to keep the meat from drying out.
Remove from grill when done.
Serve fresh from the grill.
Enjoy your yummy BARBEQUE!

name: Pork BBQ in Skewers
ingredients: corntarch slurry (2 tbsp cornstarch + 2 tbsp water)
instructions: In a medium bowl or large cup, add soy sauce, sprite/7up, banana sauce, brown sugar, lemon juice, ground pepper and garlic.  Stir well.
Thinly slice and cut the meat into serving portions. Pour over the sauce. Marinate then place in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Soak the bamboo skewers in water for at least 30 minutes before using.
Thread the marinated meat onto skewers.

Transfer the marinade into a saucepan. Bring to a simmer. Combine cornstarch and water. Stir until cornstarch is fully dissolved. Lower the heat  then add cornstarch slurry to the marinade. Stir constantly and cook until sauce thickens.
​Heat the grill over medium heat. Grill until cooked through. Occasionally brush with marinade.
Best served while warm.
Dip in spiced vinegar.
Enjoy!

name: Pork Binagoongan
ingredients: 1 lb pork belly, cut into strips
2 eggplant, sliced diagonally + 2-3 eggplants, sliced and fried for serving
instructions: Pour a small amount o oil into a hot pan.
Add the pork strips and cook until sides turn brown.
Using the same pan, sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add onions and cook until translucent.
Add tomatoes and cook until softened.
Add shirmp paste (bagoong). Simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Add the pork pieces, water and sugar. Stir.
Add vinegar. Do not stir.  Let it boil.
Add the sliced eggplants and coconut milk. Simmer until sauce is thickened and reduced.
Season with pepper to taste.
Add the chili pepper if desired.
Serve with fried eggplant and hot steamed white rice.
Enjoy.

name: Pork Chopsuey
ingredients: 1 lb pork, cut into serving size or strips
1/2 cup cauliflower, broken to bite size (optional)
2 stalks celery, cut into 2" long pieces
1/2 cup broccoli, broken to bite size (optional)
1/2 cup young corn ( I used the one in the can)
bell pepper, red or green or yellow, cut into strips
2 tbsp cornstarch dissolved in 1/4 cup water
instructions: In a pan or wok, saute garlic and onion in cooking oil.
Add pork and cook until tender.
Stir in fish sauce. Cook for few minutes.
Pour in water and simmer.
Add all the vegetables starting from snow peas, cauliflower, broccoli, cabbage, carrots then celery. Cook until tender.
Stir in young corn and bell pepper.
Add the dissolved cornstarch and soy sauce. Cook until sauce gets thick.
Serve with hot rice.
Enjoy!​​​

name: Pork Dinuguan
ingredients: 1  1/2 lbs pork loin cut into strips
3 pcs banana peppers or siling haba
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a pan or wok. Saute garlic & onion.
Add the pork. Simmer for 15 minutes or until the pork becomes tender.
Add the fish sauce and cook for 3 minutes.
Pour-in the vinegar and boil without stirring.
Add the pork blood. Stir occasionally while simmering.
Add the sugar and banana peppers and simmer for 5 minutes or until the sauce gets thick.
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving bowl.
Serve with hot steamed white rice.
Enjoy!

name: Pork Embutido
ingredients: 5-6 pieces vienna sausage or red hotdogs (cut in half lengthwise)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Mix thoroughly until well incorporated.
Spread the mixture on aluminum foil.
Arrange the sausages, hard-boiled eggs alternately on top of the flat mixture.
Shape into a roll about 5-6 inches in diameter and wrap in foil. Secure the edges.
Steam for 1 hour.
Remove from the steamer and let it cool.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
Unwrap and slice before serving with  banana ketchup.
You can microwave the sliced embutido for 1 minute. They can also be fried. It's up to you. :)
Enjoy!
Recipe makes about 4-5 rolls.

name: Pork Guisantes
ingredients: 1 medium red bell pepper, sliced or cubed
instructions: In a pan, fry potatoes, carrots and peas. Set aside.
In the same pan, saute garlic, onion and tomatoes.
Add ground pork and cook until brown.
Add fish sauce.
Add the cooked vegetables. Cook for about 3 minutes.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Best served with white steamed rice!
​Enjoy :)

name: Pork Hamonado
ingredients: 2 lbs pork belly, cut into cubes
1 cup pineapple juice reserved from from 20 oz can pineapple chunks
1/2 cup soy sauce ( I used Kikoman)
instructions: In a pan or wok, heat about 2 tbsp cooking oil.
Saute' garlic and onion.
Add pork belly. Stir and cook for about 15 minutes or until sides of meat start to brown.
Add pineapple juice and vinegar. Do not stir . Simmer for about 3 minutes.
Add water, soy sauce, peppercorns and bay leaves. Stir and bring to a boil. Lower heat and cook for about 45 minutes or until sauce is reduced.
Stir-in brown sugar and cook until sauce is thickened about 5 minutes.
Add pineapple chunks, stir and cook for 1 minute.
Serve with hot steamed rice.
Sprinkle with green onions if desired.
Enjoy.

name: Pork Ribs Paksiw
ingredients: 1/2 cup dried banana blossom or bulaklak ng saging (soaked in water)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a pot.
Simmer over low heat for 45 minutes or, until pork is tender and sauce is thickens.
Add banana blossoms and simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Serve & Enjoy!

name: Pork Sinigang
ingredients: 1-2 small pack tamarind powder (your preference on how sour you like it)
2 cups chinese cabbage (bokchoy), cut into serving size or 1/2 head cabbage, sliced into squares or use kangkong and or sitaw (it's up to you)
Sweet green chilis (siling haba) or red chili (siling labuyo)
instructions: Boil the pork in 5 cups of water until tender.
Add the tomatoes, and onion and simmer for few minutes.
Add the tamarind powder and salt to taste.
Add the vegetables. Hard ones first like sitaw, labanos and then okra and green chili.
(For me as long as I have okra, and kangkong. I am good! All up to you!) :)
Add kangkong and or bokchoy leaves (optional).
Boil for 1 minute then remove from heat.
Let stand for 5 minutes.
Serve with steamed rice.
Enjoy!

name: Relyenong Pusit
instructions: Marinate the squid in soy sauce and lemon juice for at least 15 minutes. Set aside.
While marinating...
Saute garlic, onion and tomato.
Add ground pork and cook until brown.
Add carrots and celery stalks.
Add salt and pepper. Cook for 3 minutes.
Stuff the marinated squid with the cooked mixture.
Secure the opening with toothpicks.
Dip the stuffed squid in beaten egg.
Dredge in flour.
Heat another pan with cooking oil.
Fry the squid for 10 minutes (5 minutes on each side). Do not overcook!
Serve warm.
Enjoy!

name: Roasted Chicken
ingredients: 1 whole small or medium red onion
1 whole garlic, chopped, divided into two
instructions: Place the whole chicken on a large tray and pat it dry.
Place the onion, garlic and lemongrass inside the chicken.
Marinate the skin with onion powder, ground pepper, calamansi or lemon juice, soy sauce and garlic.
Tie the chicken legs with a kitchen twine or lemon grass leaves.
Transfer to a zip bag  and marinate for at least 6 hours.
Set the turbo broiler to 350 F.
Place the marinated chicken inside the broiler and roast for 40-45 minutes turning the chicken at least every 15 minutes. Make sure to keep an eye to avoid burning the skin.
Remove from the broiler, slice and serve with your favorite dipping sauce.
Enjoy.

name: Salt & Pepper Shrimp
instructions: In a bowl, combine shrimp, salt, pepper, garlic powder, extra spicy seasoning blend and cornstarch.
Heat oil in a wok until hot.
Deep fry the shrimps in small batches until nicely pink/red and crispy, about 3-4 minutes.
Remove and drain.
In a pan, heat some oil and stir fry the deep-fried shrimp along with the garlic and green onions. Stir until well combined.
Transfer to a serving plate and serve immediately.
Enjoy!

name: Salted Egg Shrimp
ingredients: lemon-lime soda, enough to boil the shrimp
instructions: For the lemon-lime soda, you can use 7-up, sprite or 7up. If it is not available, you can just boil it in water.
When boiling the shrimp, remember to stop the cooking process when the color turns orange. Remove from heat and drain. Do not overcook or the shrimp will be hard and rubbery.
Taste test the salted egg yolks. If they are too salty, you may want to adjust the sugar in the recipe. The sugar balances the taste with the egg yolks.
Chili pepper is optional, you can omit or add more depending on your preference. You can also use hot sauce if chili pepper is not available. You can also use red pepper flakes.
This recipe serves 2-3 people. You can double or triple the recipe if desired.

name: Sarciadong Tilapia
instructions: Pan fry the Tilapia. Set aside.
In a separate pan, saute garlic, onion & tomatoes.
Add water and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the beaten egg & fish sauce. Cook for 3 minutes.
Add the Tilapia and cook for 5 minutes.
Serve hot.
Enjoy!

name: ​Sardines with Misua
ingredients: 2 cans (5.5 oz each) sardines in tomato sauce (I used Hot/Spicy flavor)
1 medium sayote / chayote, peeled and sliced diagonally into 1/4 - 1/2"
fish sauce or salt to taste
instructions: In a deep pan, heating cooking oil. Saute garlic and cook until fragrant. Add onions and cook until translucent.
Add sayote / chayote. Saute' for about 3 minutes or until half-cooked.
Add sardines with tomato sauce. Lightly stir and cook for 3 minutes.
Add water and bring to a boil. Season with fish sauce or salt then add misua. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Add green onions and season with ground pepper. Lightly stir then remove from heat.
Serve with steamed rice.
Enjoy.

name: Sarciadong Tilapia (may sabaw)
ingredients: 2 whole Tilapia or hasa-hasa or any fish that you prefer (cleaned)
instructions: Pan fry the Tilapia. Set aside.
In a separate pan, saute garlic, onion & tomatoes.
Add water and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the beaten egg & fish sauce. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add the Tilapia and cook for 5 minutes.
Serve hot. Enjoy!​

name: Seafood Ginataan
instructions: Steam all the seafoods except catfish. Set aside.
Heat the cooking oil in a pan or wok and saute garlic and onion.
Add the squash and cook until slightly tender.
Pour-in the water and let it boil.
Add the fish and cook for few minutes. Add the fish sauce.
Add the steamed seafoods and coconut milk. Simmer for 5-8 minutes.
Remove from heat and transfer to a serving bowl.
Enjoy!

name: Sesame Chicken
instructions: ​​In  a large bowl. mix together chicken, grated garlic, egg white and sesame oil. Marinate for 10-15 minutes.
Add the marinated chicken with the marinade together with all purpose flour.
Fill a deep pan with vegetable oil. Fry the breaded chicken.  Set aside.
In a wok, mix together water, vinegar, sugar and soy sauce. Stir.
Turn on heat. Simmer fir about 1 minute.
Lower heat. Add the cornstarch dissolved in water.
Simmer until sauce is thick.
Add the fried chicken pieces and toss with the sauce until fully incorporated.
Add the sesame seeds.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Sesame Green Beans
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil to blanch the green beans.
When the water comes to a boil add the green beans and let simmer for about 2 minutes.
Rinse under cold water to stop the cooking.
In a large saute pan on medium high heat saute the onion and pepper in oil.
Add the green beans, oyster sauce and soy sauce.
Stir well to combine and continue to saute about 2 to 3 minutes longer while stirring constantly.
Add the sesame oil and seeds and stir to coat.
Serve and enjoy! ​

name: Shrimp Boil / Cajun Shrimp
ingredients: 2 lbs / 1 kilo head-on and shell-on shrimp, rinsed
instructions: You can make this recipe a seafood boil by just adding other seafood variety like mussels, crabs, clams and more!
You can add more hot sauce as you wish depending on how spicy you want it.
You will definitely have extra sauce here. I suggest saving it and store in the freezer for future use.

If you can't find Cajun seasoning or you wanted to make your own, combine paprika, salt, garlic powder, black pepper, onion powder, dried oregano, cayenne and thyme. Add 2 tbsp Paprika and 1 tbsp each for the rest of the mentioned seasonings. You can adjust them to your liking.
I hope these tips help!

name: Shrimp Fried rice with Asparagus
ingredients: 1 bunch asparagus, trimmed and sliced diagonally
instructions: Heat some oil in a large pan or wok on high until hot.
Add the garlic and onion. Cook until onion is translucent.
Add the asparagus cook for 30 seconds to 1 minute, or until bright green.
Add carrots and the shrimp to the pan and cook 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, just until the shrimp start to turn pink.

Add the cooked rice. Cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes, stirring until any moisture evaporates. Add the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and sesame oil. Cook 1 minute longer, stirring to coat everything in the sauce.
Serve & enjoy! ​

name: Shrimp Rolls
ingredients: 10 pieces Asian spring roll wrappers, defrosted, cut in half diagonally (make triangles)
20 pieces raw tail-on shrimp, the larger the better, deveined and peeled
1/4 cup water + 1 tsp cornstarch (for sealing the wrapper)
instructions: Nick the shrimp (cut small incisions) several times along the inside of the "curve. This will help keep the shrimp nice and straight when frying.
Combine garlic, ginger, sesame oil, soy sauce, sweet chili sauce and cornstarch.
Marinate shrimp for 30 minutes.
Wrap each shrimp in an spring roll wrapper by placing the shrimp along the side of the triangle and rolling towards the point.
When you roll, try to make the roll tight and compact.
Brush the end of the wrapper with cornstarch paste.
Repeat wrapping until all shrimp and wraps are done.
Heat oil in wok, deep fryer or pot to 375 deg F.
Fry the wrapped shrimps until golden brown, about 3 minutes.
Remove from pan and place on paper towel to catch any excess oil.
Serve with sweet dipping sauce.
Enjoy!

name: Shrimp Sinigang
ingredients: 4-5 tbsp tamarind soup base powder mix  or 1 1/2 packets sinigang mix (adjust acordingly)
3 bunches bok choy leaves or other vegetables you like
instructions: ​In a large pot, boil water.
Add onion and tomatoes. Cover and boil for at 3 minutes.
Add the shrimp. Simmer until shrimps are cooked. Do not overcook. Shrimps cook very quickly.
Add the tamarind seasoning powder, fish sauce and chili pepper. Stir and cook for 30 seconds.
Add the vegetables. Submerge the vegetables in soup. Cover the pot and turn off the heat.
Serve with steamed white rice.
Enjoy.

name: Sinigang na Bangus
ingredients: 1 piece large Milk fish (bangus), cleaned and sliced into serving pieces
Chinese cabbage (bokchoy), cut into serving size
instructions: Bring water to a boil.
Add the tomatoes, and onion and simmer for few minutes.
Add the bangus. Simmer for about 3 minutes or until fish is half cooked.
Add the tamarind powder, fish sauce or salt to taste.
Add the labanos and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the bokchoy leaves. Cook for few seconds.
Turn off heat then add the kangkong.
Do not overcook the vegetables and the fish.
Serve immediately while the soup is hot.
Enjoy!

name: Sinigang na Bangus sa Bayabas
ingredients: 1 piece large Milkfish (bangus), cleaned and sliced into serving pieces
2 cups kangkong leaves  cut into serving size
instructions: Bring water and guava to a boil.
Simmer until water starts to thicken.
Add the tomatoes, and onion and simmer for few minutes.
Add the bangus. Simmer for 8 minutes.
Add the tamarind powder (optional) and fish sauce.
Add the kangkong leaves and simmer for 1 minute.
Season with salt to taste.
Remove from heat.
Enjoy!

name: Sinigang na Catfish or Salmon
ingredients: 2 cups kangkong leaves or Chinese cabbage (bokchoy), cut into serving size
instructions: Bring water to a boil.
Add the tomatoes, and onion and simmer for few minutes.
Add the slices of salmon. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the tamarind powderf and fish sauce or salt to taste.
Add the labanos and simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat, add the bokchoy leaves. Let stand for 5 minutes.
Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Sinigang na Hipon
ingredients: 4-5 tbsp tamarind soup base powder mix  or 1 1/2 packets sinigang mix (adjust acordingly)
3 bunches bok choy leaves or other vegetables you like
instructions: ​In a large pot, boil water.
Add onion and tomatoes. Cover and boil for at 3 minutes.
Add the shrimp. Simmer until shrimps are cooked. Do not overcook. Shrimps cook very quickly.
Add the tamarind seasoning powder, fish sauce and chili pepper. Stir and cook for 30 seconds.
Add the vegetables. Submerge the vegetables in soup. Cover the pot and turn off the heat.
Serve with steamed white rice.
Enjoy.

name: Skinless Longganisa
ingredients: 5-8 cloves garlic (add more if you prefer), crushed or finely chopped
1 tbsp all-purpose flour (can be substituted with 1/2 tbsp plain bread crumbs)
instructions: Combine all ground pork, brown sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, pepper and paprika. Mix until fully incorporated. Add garlic and flour or breadcrumbs and stir to combine.
Refrigerate for at least an hour.

Roll about 2-3 tbsp of the pork mixture in a 7"x 7" plastic food / cling wrap . Shape in to a small log about 2 1/2 to 3 inches and roll  tightly while pressing both sides. Continue rolling and secure the sides.
Freeze the Longganisa for at least 4 hours or until ready to cook.
If frozen overnight, thaw for at least 2 hours in the fridge before frying.
Unwrap and fry in batches in hot oil until fully cooked.
Serve with fried eggs and garlic or plain rice and vinegar dipping sauce.

name: Spicy Barbecue Pork Ribs
instructions: Combine all the ingredients together except the pork. (makes about 1 cup)
Marinade the pork with the mixed barbeque sauce and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Cook the marinated pork over grill.
Use the remaining marinade to baste the barbecue for added flavor and to keep the meat from drying out.
Serve fresh from the grill.
Enjoy your yummy BARBECUE!

name: Spicy Chicken Wings
ingredients: 1 tbsp siling labuyo (cayenne or chili pepper), chopped
instructions: Combine the first 5 ingredients in a pot. Boil for 15 minutes.
Remove the chicken wings from water and transfer to a lightly greased oven safe container.
Bake wings on BROIL for 15-20 minutes turning once.
Combine hot sauce and margarine. Microwave for 2 minutes or until margarine is melted. Stir.
Remove the chicken wings from the oven.
Pour-in the hot sauce mix over the chicken.
Transfer to a serving plate.
Enjoy your Spicy Chicken Wings!​

name: Spicy Ginataang Puso ng Saging
ingredients: ​​1 lb or 1/2 kilo pork belly or pork shoulder,  cut into strips
10 cups water + 2 tbsp salt for soaking
instructions: ​Trim off the stem of banana blossom. Peel and discard the outer, fibrous skin layers of banana blossom until you reach the lighter, softer core. Cut in half and slice thinly. Soak in cold water with salt for 20 minutes then squeeze to release bitter sap. Squeeze and rinse at least 3-4 times and drain well. Set aside.
In a pan or wok, heat cooking oil. Saute' the garlic until fragrant.  Add onion and cook until translucent.
Add pork and cook, stirring occasionally until color turns light brown.
Add fish sauce and continue to cook for about 5 minutes or until pork is tender.
Add the banana blossom. Stir occasionally and cook until softened and release liquid, about 5-10 minutes.
Add the coconut milk. Cover and simmer while stirring occasionally about for 10 minutes or until sauce gets thick. Add chili pepper, salt and pepper to taste. Cook for another 1-2 minutes.
Serve with hot steamed rice. Enjoy!

name: Spicy Ginataang Tilapia
ingredients: chili peppers (labuyo, banana peppers or fingerling) chopped and whole
instructions: Saute ginger, garlic and onion. Cook until onion is soft.
Add coconut milk, fish sauce, turmeric powder, ground pepper and chopped chili peppers. Let it come to a simmer.
Add the fish. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
Turn the fish to the other. Add whole chili peppers if desired then cover and cook for another 5 minutes or until the fish is cooked through.
Add the spinach or malungay or vegetable of your choice.
Cook for 1 minute then turn off heat.
Serve immediately.
Enjoy.

name: Sweet and Sour Fish
ingredients: 2 pieces  tilapia or any fish of choice, cleaned and fried
2 tbsp cornstarch dissolved in 1/4 cup water
1/2 cup pineapple juice from the can of pineapple chunks.
1/4 cup carrot, sliced or cut into strips
bell pepper, cut into cubes or strips, about 3/4 cup
3/4 - 1 cup pineapple chunks in can, juice reserved
instructions: Combine cornstarch and water. Set aside.
Combine pineapple juice, brown sugar, ketchup, water and salt. Set aside.
Heat cooking oil in a pan or wok.
Sauté garlic until fragrant then add onion and cook until soft.
Add carrots and bell pepper. Cook for about 3 minutes.
Add pineapple chunks and the prepared sauce. Let it boil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Pour in the dissolved cornstarch. Simmer until the sauce gets thick.
Ladle the sauce over the fried fish.
Enjoy!

name: Sweet & Sour Meatballs
instructions: Combine pineapple juice, brown sugar, ketchup, water and salt. Set aside.
Heat cooking oil in a pan or wok. Saute garlic & onion.
Add pineapple chunks, carrots and bell pepper.
Add the prepared sauce. Let it boil.
Pour-in the dissolve cornstarch. Simmer until the sauce gets thick.
Remove from heat.
Ladle the sauce over the meatballs or add the meatballs into the sauce like I did then remove from heat.
Transfer to a serving bowl.
Enjoy!

name: Sweet  & Sour Pork
ingredients: 1 pound pork tenderloin / top loin (cubed or cut into bite sized pieces)
1 cup pineapple chunks ( I used the one in can and reserved the juice )
1/2 green bell pepper, cut into cubes
1/2 red bell pepper, cut into cubes
1/2 yellow bell pepper, cut into cubes
instructions: ​​Mix the sweet and sour sauce ingredients well and set aside.
Beat the batter ingredients with a hand beater until smooth.
Stir pork into batter until well coated.
In a deep skillet, add in the cooking oil enough for deep-frying. Once the oil is hot, deep fry the pork pieces until they turn golden brown and crispy. Dish out and drain on paper towels.
Heat up a wok and add in some cooking oil.
Add in the chopped garlic and stir fry until light brown.
Add onion and cook until translucent.
Add bell peppers and pineapple chunks.
Stir fry until you smell the peppery aroma from the peppers.
Add in the sweet and sour sauce.
Add the dissolved cornstarch.
As soon as the sauce thickens, add the crispy fried pork pieces. Stir well with the sauce.
Serve hot with steamed white rice.

name: Sweet Baked Tilapia​
instructions: Preheat oven to 450 deg F.
Line a baking pan with foil.
Evenly distribute olive oil in the bottom of baking dish and place fillets in it.
Combine the remaining ingredients and pour over the fillets.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until it flakes easily with a fork.

name: Sweet Sesame Chicken
ingredients: 4-6 pieces chicken drumsticks or 3 chicken leg quarters
1/2 cup honey or blue agave syrup
instructions: In a small bowl, combine all sauce ingredients together. Set aside.
Make a few slits on the chicken legs. (This makes the sauce sink in the meat).
Place the chicken legs in a zip bag. Add the sauce.
Marinate the chicken for at least 30 minutes to 1 hour or overnight.
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Transfer the marinated chicken legs into the baking pan or tray lined with foil.   Lining with foil helps with easy clean up. :)
Bake for 400 deg F for 45 minutes.
Increase the temperature to 425 deg F and bake for another 15 minutes.
Spoon the caramelized sauce over the chicken and broil for 2-5 minutes on each side.
(Keep an eye on the chicken as broiling easily burns any baked item.)
Remove from oven and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Enjoy your Sweet Sesame Chicken!
Preheat oven to 450 deg F.
Line a baking pan with foil.
Evenly distribute olive oil in the bottom of baking dish and place fillets in it.
Combine the remaining ingredients and pour over the fillets.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until it flakes easily with a fork.

name: Thai Baked Salmon
instructions: Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Line baking dish with aluminum foil big enough to cover the salmon.
Grease the foil with a cooking spray.
Lay down salmon fillets and sprinkle a pinch of salt to taste.
Brush or rub the sweet chili sauce with your fingers to coat salmon with sauce evenly on top, bottom and sides.
Fold the sides of the foil over the salmon, covering completely and sealing the packet closed.
Place baking dish on the middle rack and bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and spoon the sauce on the sides over the top of the salmon.
Transfer baking dish on top rack and broil for 4 to 5 minutes or until salmon has caramelized. (Make sure to keep an eye on the salmon when broiling to avoid burning the top.)
Remove from oven and garnish with green onions if you like.
Serve immediately with steamed rice, quinoa or vegetables on the side.
I served mine with Garlic Green Beans. Garlic green beans recipe is here.
Enjoy.

name: Tinolang Tahong /Tinola
ingredients: 1 thumb size ginger root cut into strips
2 medium sayote / chayote ( cut into bite size)
instructions: In a wok or deep pan, saute the garlic, onion & ginger in cooking oil.
Add the mussels and cook for few minutes. Add patis.
Pour-in water and bring to a boil.  Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the sayote/chayote. Continue simmering until sayote/chayote is tender.
Add pepper leaves and salt to taste.
Remove from heat.
Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Tinolang Manok / Chicken Tinola
ingredients: 1-1/2 to 2 lbs chicken (cut into serving pieces)
1 thumb size ginger root cut into think strips
2 small to medium sayote/chayote or green papaya (cut into wedges)
1 cup or more fresh pepper leaves, moringa (malunggay) or spinach
instructions: In a pot or wok,  heat cooking oil. Saute' ginger and let juice come out.
Add garlic and saute until fragrant.
Add onion and cook until soft.
Add the chicken cuts and cook for 5 minutes or until the chicken colors lightly.
Add the fish sauce. Stir to combine.
Pour-in water and bring to a boil. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
Add the chicken cube and sayote/chayote. Continue simmering until sayote/chayote is tender. **If using papaya, add green papaya a little earlier since papaya is firmer than chayote.
Add the pepper leaves, spinach or malunggay.
Cover and turn off heat.
Best served with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!

name: Tofu & Kangkong in Oyster Sauce
ingredients: 1 14oz or 16oz pack of Tofu, firm or extra firm
3 tablespoons oyster sauce (add more depending on your taste)
instructions: Pressing the tofu holds its shape
Pressing avoids soggy and produces extra crispy tofu when fried
Bubbles form around the wooden spoon when oil is ready for frying
Do not let the oil reach smoking point as this produces an off burnt taste on whatever you are frying
To avoid burns from hot oil, always throw in whatever you are frying with a gentle, slow and outward toss of hand so that the oil splatters away from you.
Do not flip the tofu immediately when frying as the tofu might stick and break your tofu. Wait for it to brown and crisp before flipping.
Paper towels absorb excess oil well.

name: Tortang Giniling
instructions: Saute the garlic, tomatoes and onion in cooking oil.
Add the ground meat. Cook until the meat turns light brown.
Add the fish sauce (patis) and potatoes. Cook until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat. Let it cool for few minutes.
Heat cooking oil in another pan.
In a big bowl, combine cooked meat and beaten egg.
Spoon 2-3 tbsp of mixture and fry on medium heat.
Flip the omelette after 2 minutes.
Cook the other side for another 2 minutes.
Serve with ketchup as dipping sauce. ​
Enjoy! ​​

name: Tortang Sardinas
ingredients: 2 cans (5.5 oz) sardines, plain or flavored
instructions: In a small pan, heat about 1 tbsp cooking oil and saute garlic and onion. Cook until onion is soft. Remove from heat and set aside.
Open the cans of sardines and transfer to a bowl, break the sardines into small pieces. Do not mash. Set aside.
In  a small bowl, beat eggs. Season with salt and pepper. Add all purpose flour and whisk until smooth.
Add sardines, sauteed garlic and onion, and green onions. Stir mixture until just combined.

In a pan, heat cooking oil. Scoop about 1/3 cup sardines mixture into hot oil and pan fry over low heat until bottom turns golden, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook the other side for an additional 1 1 /2 minutes or until golden. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels.
Repeat process on remaining mixture. Recipe yields about 7 pieces sardines omelette.
Serve with ketchup. Banana ketchup is highly suggested.
Enjoy.

name: Tortang Talong
instructions: Saute the garlic & onion in cooking oil.
Add the ground pork. Cook until the meat turns light brown.
Add the fish sauce (patis) and potatoes. Cook until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat. Set aside.
Grill or broil eggplants until tender (the skins are charred and blister appears).
Once cool, peel off the skins of the eggplant and retain its crown and stem. Gently flatten its meat with a fork.
Add the beaten egg to the flattened eggplant.
Add the meat on top. Make sure it's compact and flattened into the eggplant.
Heat 2 tbsp of cooking oil in a pan.
Gently transfer the eggplant with meat into the pan.
Fry on medium heat. Flip the eggplant after 2-3 minutes. Cook the other side for another 2-3 minutes.
Serve hot. Enjoy!​​

name: Ukoy/Okoy
instructions: In a bowl, combine cornstarch, water, eggs, salt and pepper.
Add shrimps, sweet potato and bean sprouts. Blend well.
Heat the oil in a frying pan.
When hot, drop about 3 tbsp of the mixture into the hot oil and fry over medium heat until crisp and both sides are brown.
Remove from the pan and drain on paper towels.
Serve with garlic vinegar sauce.

name: Ukoy/Silverfish Omelette
instructions: In a bowl, combine all ingredients together.
Heat the oil in a frying pan.
When hot, drop about 3 tbsp of the mixture into the hot oil, flatten with a spoon and fry over medium heat until crisp and both sides are brown.
Remove from the pan and drain on paper towels.
Serve with garlic vinegar sauce.
Serve hot & crispy.
Enjoy!

name: Veggies with Quail Eggs
ingredients: 2 cups green peas & carrots ( I used the frozen one)
1/2 cup water or use the juice from the mushroom buttons
instructions: Heat cooking butter in a pan or wok.
Saute the vegetables starting from chicharo, peas & carrots. Cook for few minutes or until just half cooked.
Add the corn. Remove from wok. Set aside.
In the same wok, heat 1 tbsp cooking oil.
Saute garlic & onion.
Add the shrimp, sliced mushrooms and water. Let it simmer.
Add the cooked vegetables and cream of mushroom. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add salt to taste.
Add the quail eggs. Remove from heat.
Serve and enjoy this yummy dish!

name: Walnut Chicken
ingredients: 1 tbsp rice wine or sherry wine
1 lb chicken breast, cut into cubes
instructions: Combine soy sauce, ginger, cornstarch, wine, garlic and red pepper flakes in large bowl. Mix well.
Add chicken, toss to coat. Let stand 10 minutes to marinate.
Heat oil in a large wok or skillet. Add walnuts; stir-fry for 1 minute or until lightly browned. Set aside.
Add chicken mixture to wok; stir-fry 5-7 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center.
Add beans, water chestnuts, green onions and water; stir-fry until heated through.
Serve over rice, sprinkle with walnuts.

name: 7UP Bundt Cake
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups unsalted butter, softened at room temperature.
instructions: Preheat oven to 325F / 160C). Generously grease a 9-cup bundt pan with vegetable oil or butter. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat butter until creamy. Add sugar then beat until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add lemon juice and beat to combine.
Gradually add the flour, 1 cup at a time beating well after each addition.
Add 7Up, half or third at a time blending well after each addition.
Transfer the batter into the prepared pan. Smooth the top with a spatula.
Bake for about 60-75 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and let cool for about 10 minutes. Loosen edges with a metal spatula then invert the pan then transfer to cool completely on a wire rack.
For the glaze, sift the powdered sugar then add the juice and milk then mix well until smooth. Adjust the recipe as needed or depending on the glaze consistency that you prefer.
Using a spoon or sauce dispenser, drizzle the glaze over the cooled cake.
Enjoy!

name: Apple Pie
ingredients: (2) 9" ready made frozen deep dish pie shells
instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Let 1 crust thaw for 10-20 minutes. prick bottom and around sides thoroughly with fork.
Pour apple pie filling evenly into crust.
While second crust is still in pan and frozen, remove crimp with sharp knife.
Remove crust from pan and center frozen crust upside down on top of filled pie.
Let thaw 10-20 minutes; crimp edges together.
Cut 2-4 slits on top crust to vent it.
Brush top evenly with egg white.
Place the pie on top of a cookie sheet. (This is to avoid spills in case the filling boils while baking.)
Bake for 20 minutes and then place foil strips around the edge of the pie so it doesn't burn the edge.
Bake for another 20-25 minutes.
Wait at least 2 hours before serving.

name: Baked Churros
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium saucepan combine the butter, salt and water. Bring to a boil over medium high heat.
Remove from heat add the flour and stir with to combine. Mixture will thicken and start to resemble the texture of mashed potatoes.
Transfer the mixture into a mixing bowl. Beat with a hand mixer, adding one egg at a time, mixing well before adding another.
When all the eggs are are combined add the vanilla.
Spoon the dough into a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip. Lightly spray a cookie sheet and pipe 5-8inch rows of the dough with at least 1 inch between each churro.
Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown, and when a toothpick comes out clean.
Spray churros lightly with cooking spray, and one at a time and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar.
You can also place cinnamon sugar in a paper bag. Spray one churro lightly with cooking spray, place it in the bag and gently shake until coated. Repeat until all the churros are finished.
Enjoy your yummy churros!

name: Banana Bread
ingredients: 1- 1 1/4 cups banana (mashed), about 2-3 banana (very ripe banana is recommended)
1/2 cup melted butter or vegetable / canola oil
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease the loaf pan.
In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, salt and baking powder.
Add the rest of the ingredients, melted butter, mashed banana, eggs & vanilla.
Transfer batter to the greased loaf pan.
Place in the middle rack of the oven and bake for 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Remove from the oven. Allow to cool down before transferring to a service plate.
Enjoy!​

name: Banana Brownies
instructions: Preheat oven t 350F / 176C .
Grease a 8x8 or 10x7 baking pan with butter. Set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs. Add mashed bananas. sugar, melted butter and vanilla. Beat until well combined.
Place a sieve over the bowl then add flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt. Sift then mix the ingredients together until well combined.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Transfer the batter to the prepared baking dish, spread evenly and smooth over the top.
Bake for about 40-45 minutes or until cooked through.
Remove from the oven and let cool on wire rack.
Remove from the pan by loosening the edges first with a knife or spatula. Cut, serve and enjoy!
Brownie squares can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 4 days or in the freezer for about 3 months.

name: Banana Bundt Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
Butter or grease and flour a 9-inch tube pan or bundt pan.
Whisk flour, baking soda and salt together and set aside.
Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add the vanilla and mashed banana.
Finally, mix in half of your dry ingredients.
Add all of the sour cream.
Then add the remainder of the flour mixture.
Spread the batter in the prepared bundt pan.
Bake for 1 hour or until a tester (toothpick or skewer) inserted in the cake comes out clean. Do not over-bake. Make sure to check before the set time.
(Check the cake after about 30 minutes and if it's browning too quickly, cover loosely with a foil tent.)
Cool the cake on a rack for 10 minutes. Run a knife around the edges to free the cake, invert it on a wire rack to cool completely.
Dust with powdered sugar if desired.
Serve and Enjoy!

name: Banana Buttermilk Bread
ingredients: 1 cup mashed bananas (3 medium sized bananas)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease 1 large loaf pan.
Mix together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
Beat butter and granulated sugar in a large bowl until creamy.
Add eggs. Beating well after each addition.
Add mashed bananas, vanilla and buttermilk. Again, beating in well.
Add the flour mixture. Beat until well combined.
Transfer mixture into greased loaf pan.

name: Banana Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: In a large bowl, beat the butter on high speed until creamy.
Add granulated sugar and beat until light and fluffy.
Add brown sugar. Beat until fully combined.
Add mashed bananas. Beat until light and fluffy.
Place a sieve over the bowl and add flour, baking soda, cornstarch, and salt. Sift and stir until just combined. Do not over-mix.
Stir-in semi-sweet chocolate chips.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Scoop out dough (about 2 1/2 to 3 tbsp) on cookie sheet lined with parchment paper or baking mat. Use a cookie scoop for easy assembly and make sure to leave an inch space in between the cookies.
Top with more chocolate chips if desired.
Bake in a preheated oven at 375 F for 10-12 minutes or until tops start to turn light golden brown. Timing depends on the size of the cookies. Make sure to check before the set time.
Remove from oven and allow cookies to cool completely on pan. Slight deflation will happen while cooling and cookies will firm up.
Recipe makes about 24 cookies.
Store in an airtight container.
Enjoy.

name: Banana Coconut Muffins
ingredients: 1/4 cup sweetened coconut flakes + more for topping
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line 12 standard (1/3-cup) muffin cups with paper liners.
In a medium bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
Mix sour cream and vanilla into bananas. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat sugar and butter with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Add eggs and beat until well blended.
Add flour mixture alternately with banana-sour cream mixture beating just until blended after each addition.
Add sweetened coconut flakes. Stir until well combined.

name: Banana Cookies
ingredients: 2/3 cup unsalted butter, softened at room temperature
chocolate chip and walnuts for toppings
instructions: In a small bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon.
Cream the butter then add the sugar. Beat until light and fluffy.
Add eggs one at at time beating well after each addition.
Stir in the banana.
Slowly add the dry mixture into wet. Chill at least 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375F.
Drop about 1 tbsp sized balls of dough two inches apart on cookie sheets.
Top with nuts or chocolate chips or any toppings of choice.
Bake for about 10-12 minutes or until browned.
Cool for 2 minutes in the pan then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely.
Enjoy!
Recipe yields about 96 cookies.

name: Banana Cupcakes with Peanut Butter Frosting
instructions: 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar
1 8-ounce package cream cheese, room temperature
1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened
1/2 cup + 2 tbsp smooth peanut butter

name: Banana Custard Cake
instructions: ​Preheat oven to 325 F.
Grease the 8 x 8  pan with butter and sprinkle some flour. Remove excess flour. Set aside.
In a medium bowl, whisk egg white until foamy.
Add cream of tartar and continue beating.
Gradually add sugar. Beat until stiff.
Gradually add the meringue into the cake batter and fold together.
Transfer the mixture into the prepared pan.
Bake for 25-30 minutes. Make sure to check before 25 minutes if the cake is done as oven temperature varies.
Remove from oven and cool on wire rack. Invert to a serving plate.
Beat the custard until smooth. Spread over the top of the cake and scrape to get a smooth
Refrigerate the cake to set the custard before slicing.
Enjoy.

name: Banana Loaf Brea with Streusel
instructions: Make sure not to overmix the cake batter. Just a few strokes until everything is incorporated is what you need.

Make sure to use cold butter not melted or softened. A well-made crumb should be firm yet tender. Using melted or softened at room temperature butter will cause the topping to spread out and flatten when it bakes.
Do not overbake. You do not want a hard and dry banana bread.

Make sure to check before the set time. Oven temperature varies so I suggest to check the banana bread, not the time.  If the top stars to brown faster, you can tent it with foil. That is by placing a foil  loosely on top of the loaf.

Frequent opening of the oven while baking may affect the result because every time the oven door is opened, you lose heat. Just take peak on the oven window and you'll know. The best time to check is half-way through the baking and when the food starts to smell, you know that it's almost done and time for you to watch it.
I hope these TIPS help. Enjoy!

name: Banana Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Prepare the muffin pan lined up with paper cups.
Mix together flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
Beat butter and granulated sugar in a large bowl until creamy.
Add eggs. Beating well after each addition.
Add mashed bananas. Again, beating in well.
Gradually add flour mixture, a little at a time, alternating each addition with a little milk. Beat until well combined.
Spoon mixture into muffin pan and sprinkle crumb topping on top.

name: Banana Nut Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Prepare the muffin pan lined up with paper cups.
Mix together flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
Beat butter and granulated sugar in a large bowl until creamy.
Add eggs. Beating well after each addition.
Add mashed bananas. Again, beating in well.
Gradually add flour mixture, a little at a time, alternating each addition with a little milk. Beat until well combined.
Spoon mixture into muffin pan and sprinkle crumb topping on top.

name: Banana Muffins with Streusel Topping
instructions: Make sure not to overmix the cake batter. Just a few strokes until everything is incorporated is what you need.

Make sure to use cold butter not melted or softened. A well- made crumb should be firm yet tender. Using melted or softened at room temperature butter will cause the topping to spread out and flatten when it bakes.
Do not overbake. You do not want a hard and dry banana muffin.

If using standard size muffins, I recommend not to add all the toppings if you are trying to cut back on sugar. It's okay to add all of it when making the jumbo ones because the bottom size is huge anyway but for something small like the 3oz one, it may be too sweet for some depending on who eats it.
Make sure to check before the set time. Oven temperature varies so I suggest to check the muffins not the time.

Frequent opening of the oven while baking may affect the result because every time the oven door is opened, you lose heat. Just take peak on the oven window and you'll know. The best time to check is half-way through the baking and when the food starts to smell, you know that it's almost done and time for you to watch it.
I hope these TIPS help. Enjoy!

name: Banana Nut Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda. Set aside.
Mix together milk and lemon juice. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat together butter and sugar with an electric mixer until fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, then add mashed bananas beating until well combined.
Add the flour mixture and milk alternately into the banana mixture mixing at low speed until the batter is smooth.
Stir in walnuts.
Pour into greased loaf pan and bake 45mins - 1 hour or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.
Enjoy your Banana Nut Bread!​

name: Banana Pocket Pie
ingredients: 1 pack/2 sheets puff pastry dough, thawed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a large skillet over medium heat, combine butter, brown sugar and cinnamon.
Stir for one minute until the sugar is dissolved and the sauce begins to bubble.
Add bananas and stir to coat them in sauce. Let the bananas cook for 1 to 2 minutes.
Remove from heat and set aside.
Cut the pastry sheet into 9 equal pieces.
Brush the corners of each pastries with egg wash.
Place 1/2 tbsp of banana filling in the middle of the cut out pastry sheets.
Fold the dough over the filling and press the edges with a fork.
With a sharp knife or clean cutter, make some slashes across the top of the pastries.
Transfer the pastries into a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
Brush the top with egg wash.
Sprinkle with sugar.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve plain or top with powdered sugar and chocolate syrup.
Enjoy your yummy Banana pocket pies!

name: Banana Pull-Apart Bread
instructions: Flatten each dough into a rectangular shape about 8 x 8 inches. Roll the dough and form into a log. Slice the dough evenly into 9-10 pieces depending on how thick you want each slice. Do not cut all the way through as you want the log to stay intact. Make sure to press all sides as they tend to flatten each time the dough is being cut.
Transfer to a greased 9 x 5 loaf pan, cover and rest again for another  45 minutes to one hour or until dough is full and rounded.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350F for 18-20 minutes or until top starts to brown and inside temperature of bread is 190F. Make sure to check before the set time as oven temperature varies.
Remove from the oven and immediately brush with softened butter. Let completely cool. You can brush it again with butter before pulling a slice.
Recipe yields 2 loaf pans. Store in airtight plastic bags or wrap tightly in plastic wrap or foil and store at room temperature for up to 3 days.
Enjoy!

name: Basque Burnt Cheesecake
ingredients: Chocolate Cupcakes with Cream Cheese Frosting
instructions: Cream cheese must be softened at room temperature. If the cream cheese is too cold, it will not blend easily.
Make sure the cream cheese and sugar are completely blended, free of lumps and smooth before adding any other ingredients.
To soften cream cheese, place unwrapped cream cheese in microwave bowl and microwave n high for 10 seconds or just until softened. Add 15 seconds for each additional package of cream cheese.
*Tips from Philadelphia Cream Cheese

name: Basque Burnt UBe Cheesecake
ingredients: 12oz / 340g or 1 & 1/2 bar cream cheese, softened at room temperature
instructions: Cake Flour Substitute  (Watch my VIDEO HERE)
Measure out 1 cup all-purpose flour.
Remove 2 tbsp of all-purpose flour and place it back in your flour canister.
Replace the removed all-purpose flour with 2 tbsp cornstarch.
Sift flour 5 times.

ingredients: 1 pack/2 sheets puff pastry dough, thawed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a large skillet over medium heat, combine butter, brown sugar and cinnamon.
Stir for one minute until the sugar is dissolved and the sauce begins to bubble.
Add bananas and stir to coat them in sauce. Let the bananas cook for 1 to 2 minutes.
Remove from heat and set aside.
Cut the pastry sheet into 9 equal pieces.
Brush the corners of each pastries with egg wash.
Place 1/2 tbsp of banana filling in the middle of the cut out pastry sheets.
Fold the dough over the filling and press the edges with a fork.
With a sharp knife or clean cutter, make some slashes across the top of the pastries.
Transfer the pastries into a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
Brush the top with egg wash.
Sprinkle with sugar.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve plain or top with powdered sugar and chocolate syrup.
Enjoy your yummy Banana pocket pies!

name: Bibingka
ingredients: 1/4 cup fresh milk or evaporated milk
1/4 cup softened butter  + additional for brushing
1 salted egg, sliced or cream cheese, sliced
instructions: Combine butter and sugar together while whisking then add the eggs.
Gradually add the rice flour and baking powder.
Add the coconut milk and fresh milk. Beat well until smooth.
Line molds or round pans with pliable banana leaves (brushed with butter).
Pour mixture in the prepared molds or muffin pans.
Bake in (preheated ) oven 375 degrees F for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven.
Top with sliced salted eggs, grated cheese or cream cheese.
Bake again for 5-10 minutes or until the color of top turns medium brown.
Remove from oven. Brush some butter on top if desired.
Serve or top with grated coconut.
Enjoy!

name: Bisquick Puto Cheese
instructions: In a bowl, mix all the ingredients (except  cheese) until well combined.
Grease puto molds  or line with paper cups.
Pour or fill the mixture in the prepared molds (at least 2/3 of the mold) and top with cheese.
Prepare the steamer by bringing water to a boil over medium-high heat.
Place the molds into a steamer.
Cover with cheesecloth to avoid water drip.
Steam for 15 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Serve warm.
Enjoy! ​

name: Bitsu-Bitsu | Shakoy | Bicho Bicho
ingredients: 1 pouch or 2 1/4 tsp rapid rise yeast
instructions: Place all dry ingredients including yeast into a bowl except 1/2 cup all purpose flour. (Yeast can also be activated by following procedure on traditional method.)
Attach bowl and dough hook. Raise mixer bowl. Turn to speed 2 and mix about 15 seconds or until ingredients are combined.
Combine all liquid ingredients (whisk egg yolks first, then add milk and melted butter) then add to flour mixture and mix 1-2 minutes longer.

name: Black Forest Cake
ingredients: Maraschino Cherries with stems in syrup
shaved and grated chocolate for decoration
instructions: You can bake this cake on one 6-inch round pan if you like but make sure to bake for 15 minutes or more but do not overbake or the cake will be dry. You can also make black forest pastry by using one 8x8 square pan and bake for about 15 minutes. Slice the cake into two to make two layers. Frost and decorate as desired and cut into into 8 or 10 slices.
If available, you can add kirsch (clear brandy from fermented cherry) to the cake, cherry syrup and or frosting.  It's up to you :)
As mentioned on my procedure, do not waste the scrap cake. Make Black Forest Cups like pictured above.

To make chocolate shavings, I grated a semi-sweet chocolate bar using the large holes of a grater. Slowly run the chocolate bar into the grater. This is what I used to cover the sides of the cake. To make the shavings, I used a sharp knife and scrape the chocolate bar. This is what you see on the middle of my cake. You can also use a peeler to make chocolate curls. Store them in the fridge or freezer to keep the shape and use when ready.
If you'd like to make your own simple syrup, combine 1:1 ratio of sugar and water in a small pan. Boil for one minute then cool before use. Add kirsch to the syrup if available and desired.
I hope these tips help. If you have questions, don't hesitate to use the comment bar below.

name: Bluberry Banana Loaf Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease a 9 x 5 loaf pan and set aside.

In a saucepan, combine 1 cup blueberries and 1 tbsp sugar. Cook over medium heat until blueberries start to soften. Mash with a spoon and cook until sauce slightly thickens. Remove from heat and let it cool.
In a large bowl combine flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Stir until incorporated.
Add milk, butter, egg and vanilla. Beat or whisk together until just combined the stir in bananas. Do not over-mix.

Transfer half of the batter to the prepared pan. Add half of the blueberry mixture on top and swirl using a toothpick to combine. Add the remaining batter and top with the remaining blueberry mixture. Repeat the swirl effect.
Sprinkle some white sugar on top.
Bake in a preheated oven for 50 to 1 hour or until the middle part is no longer gooey or toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool down for 5-10 minutes. Remove from pan and transfer to a cooling rack. Slice, serve and enjoy with hot tea or coffee.

name: Blueberry Banana Muffin/Loaf
ingredients: Extra blueberries and walnuts for topping (optional) ​
instructions: Using an ice-cream scooper ensures a more evenly divided batter.
If making a loaf cake, tent with aluminum foil if the top browns too quickly.
Do not use frozen blueberries for this recipe. It will stain your batter and will turn your muffins or loaf purple.
No fresh blueberries? Use blueberry pie filling in can and just put dollops on top, then swirl into batter with a knife.

Store muffins in an airtight container or zip lock plastic bag. Place a paper towel before lining your muffins in a single layer. Cover the top of muffins with another sheet of paper towel, then seal. This can keep muffins fresh for up to 4 days.
Do not refrigerate or your muffins will dry out. Room temperature is the way to go for maximum freshness.
Muffins that need refrigeration are those that include meat or cheese in its recipe.

name: Blueberry Muffins
ingredients: 1 cup sour cream or plain yogurt
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a 12 cavity standard muffin or cupcake pan with paper liners.

In a sauce pan, combine 1 cup blueberries and 1 tbsp sugar. Cook over medium heat until berries start to soften. Mash with with a spoon and cook until berries slightly thickens. Remove from heat and let it cool.
In a medium bowl, lightly beat eggs. Add sour cream and melted butter. Mix well until smooth and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder and baking soda. Mix well.
Add egg mixture. Mix until just moistened.
Stir in 1/2 cup blueberries. Add another 1/4 cup if desired.
Divide evenly between muffin cups.
Top with berry mixture. Use a toothpick to swirl together.
Sprinkle tops with 1-2 tbsp sugar (optional)
Bake  for 30 minutes of until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Make sure to check before the set time as oven temperature varies.
Cool in pan 5 minutes; transfer to wire rack.
Enjoy warm or cooled.
Leftovers can be stored in the fridge and warmed in the microwave for 20 seconds.

name: Braided Nutella Bread
ingredients: 1 pouch or 2 1/4 tsp rapid rise yeast
egg wash for coating (beaten egg+1/2 tbsp water)
instructions: Repeat the same process with the the remaining dough.
​​Transfer to a parchment paper lined baking sheet. Cover with a kitchen towel and let it rest for 20 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350F (180C).
​Brush the braided bread with egg wash.
Bake for 15-­20 minutes until golden brown.Enjoy!
*** Always check before the set time. Set time at 15 minutes and check if top is golden brown. ​Makes about 2 pcs about 18 inches long each.​

name: Brazilian Cheese Bread
ingredients: 3 cups  tapioca starch or tapioca flour
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and grease the mini muffin / cupcake pan with oil.
In a large bowl, combine tapioca starch, salt and baking powder.
Add oil, beaten eggs, milk and stir in until the dry ingredients are well moistened.
Add the parmesan and mozzarella cheese.
Transfer into greased muffin tins.
Bake for 15-17 minutes or until top starts to lightly brown. Make sure not to over bake.
Enjoy them right out of the oven. They are best eaten when warm.
Recipe yields about 60-65 Cheese Breads.

name: Brazo de Mercedes
instructions: Sprinkle confectioners sugar on top of the baked meringue then place wax paper on the top part of the meringue followed by a similar sized baking pan or tray. The meringue should now be in the middle of two baking trays.
Flip the meringue then spread the filling evenly on top of meringue and roll into a log.
Divide the log into two. (Like what I did ont he picture above.)
Slice and serve. Enjoy!

name: Brazo de Mercedes Cupcakes
instructions: In a sauce pan, combine egg yolks, condensed milk and vanilla.
Simmer over low heat while stirring constantly until mixture becomes thick.
Remove from heat. Set aside. Let it cool.

name: Bread Pudding
ingredients: 6 slices day old-bread or about 6 cups bread
2-3 tbsp unsalted butter plus more for greasing the pan, melted
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F.
Generously grease an 8 x 8 baking pan with butter.
Sliced breads into quarters. Transfer into the prepared pan then drizzle 2-3 tbsp melted butter all over the bread. Add raisins if desired.
In large mixing bowl, combine eggs, milk, sugar, salt, vanilla, and cinnamon. Whisk until fully incorporated.
Pour over the pan with bread. Make sure the bread are soaked. (Use a small spatula or a fork to press the bread lightly to fully cover with liquid.
Bake for 45-50 minutes or until top starts to turn golden.
Slice and serve.
Best served when warm.
ENJOY!

name: Bread Rolls
ingredients: 3 cups all purpose flour or more
1 pouch or 2 1/4 tsp rapid rise yeast
instructions: Roll each part until it forms into a log. Cut each log into equal pieces.
Form small dough balls (watch my pandesal video how I formed it into dough balls) and place on baking sheet or in a well-greased pan or glass. (ugly side down).
Cover the tray or pan with a damp cloth and let it rise for 20 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Bake for 20-25 minutes.
Serve warm. Enjoy!

name: Brownie Bites
instructions: Beat brown sugar, shortening and vanilla in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended.
Beat in eggs.
Stir together flour, cocoa, salt and baking soda in small bowl.
Gradually add to shortening mixture, beating just until blended.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Cover and chill for 2 hours.
Heat oven to 375 degrees F.
Form dough into balls. Roll in sugar, then in powdered sugar, to coat completely.
Place 1-2 inches apart on baking sheet.
Bake 8-10 minutes or until brownie balls are set.
Cool 2 minutes on baking sheet.
Remove brownie balls to wire tack to cool completely.​

name: Brownies
instructions: Using a double boiler, over low heat, melt butter and chocolate chips. Continue stirring until smooth and silky. Remove from heat, add coffee powder and stir to melt. Set aside and let cool.

DIY Double Boiler:   Place a shallow heatproof bowl on top of a small or medium saucepan, fitted so that the bowl can fit in the saucepan without falling in. The idea is that the bowl will hover above the water in the pan below.)
Preheat oven to 350F. Line an 8x8 pan wit parchment paper lightly greased with oil.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs.
Add sugars and vanilla extract. Whisk well to dissolve sugars.
Add melted chocolate and mix well.
Add in flour and salt through a sieve and mix until smooth and all lumps are removed.
Pour batter into prepared baking pan.
Bake in a preheated oven for 30-35 minutes. Brownies will continue to bake once out of the oven.
Let cool before serving.
Slice to desired size. Enjoy!

name: Buko Pie
ingredients: 1 cup (2 sticks / 8 oz unsalted butter, very cold, cut into small cubes
instructions: Make some holes or slits for venting. You can use cookie cutter if you like.
Gently place onto the top of the filling in the pie.

​Trim excess. Fold the edge of the top piece of dough over and under the edge of the bottom piece of dough, pressing together. Flute edges using thumb and forefinger or press with a fork or decorate the edges like I did. (Please see photos above).
Brush with egg wash (1 beaten egg + 1 tbsp water). Just to make the top golden.  (optional)

name: Butter Mochi
ingredients: 16 oz or 1 pound glutinous rice flour, about 3 2/3 cups when measured
instructions: Preheat oven to  350 F.
Grease a 9 x 13 baking pan.
In a medium bowl, stir together eggs, milk and vanilla extract. Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine glutinous rice flour, sugar and baking powder. Make a hole at the center and  pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients. Stir until full incorporated.
Add melted butter and coconut flakes. Stir to blend.
Bake for 1 hour. Remove from oven. Cool for few minutes and slice to serve.
Best served when warm.

name: Butterscotch Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 325 F.
Line a 13 x 9 baking pan with parchment paper and grease with butter.
Combine flour, baking powder and baking soda. Set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, combine melted butter, brown sugar and glucose syrup. Beat just until combined.
Add eggs one a a time mixing until blended.
Add vanilla and continue beating for 8-10 minutes or more.  Note: Longer beating makes it more chewy. Just make sure to rest your hand mixer in between to avoid overheating.
Add the sifted flour mixture and cashew nuts. Mix until well combined.
Pour into the prepared pan.
Bake 30-35 minutes or until top is firm.
Cool and cut into bars.
Enjoy. ​​

name: Cake Pops
ingredients: candy melt or white and/or chocolate bar (I used a pack of candy melts I bought from the store)
instructions: MELT THE CHOCOLATE BAR OR CANDY MELT - use a microwave (30 seconds at at time) or a double broiler for best results.
Once the chocolate is melted and cooled to room temperature, stick the cookie or pop stick into each cake pop, and dip the balls until completely coated and smooth.
Coat the tops with a few sprinkles right after you dip the cake pops.
I served mine in a basket, filled with a styrofoam piece (so they stay put), and everyone loved them!
I also wrapped each cake pops in a clear bag with ribbon for a better presentation!

name: Caramel Bars
ingredients: 1 cup powdered milk, I used Nido
1/2 cup or more crushed peanuts or cashew nuts
instructions: Preheat oven to 325 F and line a 13 x 9 pan with parchment paper lightly greased with butter.
In  large mixing bowl, prepare the dry ingredients by sifting together flour, powdered milk, sugar, salt and baking powder. Set aside.
In a medium bowl, combine the wet ingredients starting from melted butter, vanilla, eggs and condensed milk. Whisk until well combined.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir with a spatula until fully incorporated. Do not over mix.  Stir-in half of the nuts.
Transfer the batter into the prepared pan.  Use a wet spatula to spread the batter evenly.  (Wet spatula avoids sticking into the batter).
Top with the rest of the nuts. I use cashew nuts on this recipe.

Bake for 35-40 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Sides of the caramel will start to turn golden brown in color. Do not over bake.  (Always check before the set time as oven temperature varies.) Remove from oven and cool completely before slicing.
Cut into bars and enjoy.

name: Carrot Cake
ingredients: ​Sans Rival - cashew meringue cake with buttercream frosting
Coffee Sponge Cake - soft and moist coffee flavored cake with coffee buttercream frosting
Ube Cake Roll -  soft, moist and fluffy ube  sponge cake with delicious buttercream icing
Mocha Roll  -  coffee flavored sponge cake with coffee flavored frosting
instructions: I suggest to use shortening (if available) when greasing the pans. They sticks better and doesn't clump up compared to using butter or oil.
A 13 X 9 pan  can be also be used to bake this. Add about 10 more minutes on baking time.
Make sure to check the cake before the set time as oven temperature varies.

I decorated mine by covering the half of the sides with more nuts. I also reserved some frosting and added food color (orange for the carrots and green for the leaves). Wilton 10 (round tip) to make carrots. Pipe to make head of carrot, slowly drag down to make the tail. Wilton 352 or leaf tip for the leaves. Then sprinkle some nuts on top.  Watch the video link above as your guide.
Walnuts can be substituted with pecans, almonds and hazelnuts.​
Update: 6/2/21 - If using an electric oven, bake in the middle of the rack at 325F for about 35-40 minutes.

name: Cebu Torta Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 325 F.
In a large bowl, combine all purpose flour, salt and baking powder. Set aside.
In a pan combine fresh milk and sugar. Stir and cook over low heat. until sugar dissolves.
Add star anise and cook for  about1 minute. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.
In a bowl, combine egg yolks, vegetable oil, melted butter and condensed milk. Beat until combined.
Add the milk mixture and beat until fully incorporated.
Add the liquid mixture to the flour mixture. Beat until just combined.
​Grease torta molds (brioche molds) with oil or butter.
Fill the molds with batter up to 2/3 full.
Bake for 23-25 minutes or until top is golden and toothpick inserted comes out clean. Do not over bake.
Remove from oven. Immediately brush with butter and sprinkle some sugar on top.
Cool on wire rack.
Insert toothpick on the sides of the mold to lift the cake.
Serve with hot chocolate., tea or coffee.
Recipe yields 7 Cebu Torta cakes.
Enjoy.

name: Challa Bread
ingredients: 1 pouch or 2 1/4 tsp rapid rise yeast
instructions: Divide the large piece into 3 equal portions. Roll each portion into a 16-inch long rope. Line up the ropes and pinch them together at one end. Braid the rope pieces, pinching the other end together to seal the braid.
Repeat the exact steps with the remaining dough.
Brush egg wash onto the large braid then carefully place the smaller braid on top
Coat again with egg wash and place in a baking tray with wax paper or into a lightly greased baking tray.
Cover the tray with a damp cloth and let it rise for 30-45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Bake for 25 minutes or until top of bread is golden brown.
Let the loaf cool completely before slicing.
Enjoy!

name: Cheese Bread
ingredients: 1 pouch or 2 1/4 tsp rapid rise yeast
instructions: Prepare the grated cheese or sliced cheese.
Flatten the dough with a rolling pin until it stretches into a triangular shape.
Spread some butter on top then add grated cheese then roll up. OR just add the sliced cheese on top then roll up.
Cover the dough with bread crumbs and place on lightly greased baking sheet or tray with the end at the bottom.
Cover the tray with a damp cloth and let it rise for 20-30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
Bake for 20-25 minutes. Check the bread before the set time. (Oven temperature varies.)
Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Cheese Bread with Buttermilk Crumbs
ingredients: 3/4 cup evaporated milk or fresh milk ( I used fresh whole milk )
instructions: ​Transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface. Divide the dough into 4 equal parts. Roll each part into a log and cut each log into equal pieces.
Roll the dough to form round dough balls, place on a tray and cover with damp cloth or plastic food wrap, and set aside for 15-20 minutes while working on the buttermilk coating.
In a  medium bowl, combine flour, powdered milk, and sugar. Add cold butter and combine using a pastry blender or fork until mixture is crumbly.

Flatten each dough with a rolling pin until it stretches into a triangular shape. Fill with a piece of cheese, roll up and seal the sides.  Place all shaped dough on a tray then brush each dough with evaporated milk.
Roll the dough in prepared buttermilk coating and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. (End of the bread or sim at the bottom)
Cover the tray with a damp cloth or plastic wrap and let it rise for 20-30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350F. Bake for 18-22 minutes or top starts to turn golden.
​Serve warm. Enjoy!
​Recipe yields 24-26 pieces

name: Cheese Cupcakes
ingredients: 1 cup grated cheese plus more for topping
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a small bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
In large mixing bowl. cream the butter then add sugar. Beat until light and creamy.
Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition.
Add vanilla and condensed milk. Beat until just combined.
Slowly add the flour mixture. Beat until all ingredients are incorporated.
Add the grated cheese. Mix until just combined. Do not over beat.
Divide batter equally into standard 12 cup muffin pan lined with cupcake liners.
Top with grated cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes. Do not overbake.
Remove from oven and cool on wire rack.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Cheesecake Pastries
ingredients: 1 package Pepperidge Farm® Puff Pastry Sheets, thawed
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 deg F.
Place 2/3 pastry of the 1st sheet on bottom of pan lined with parchment paper.
Combine softened cream cheese, sugar and vanilla. ( I used a hand mixer ).
Spread mixture over pastry.
Place another 2/3 pastry of the 2nd sheet over the mixture.
Spread melted butter over the top and sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar.
Bake for 20-30 minutes.
Serve warm.​ ​

name: Chewy Brownies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F and grease 13 x 9-inch baking pan.
In a medium bowl, combine flour,  sugar, unsweetened cocoa, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat eggs, vanilla extract, butter and water.
Add the flour mixture. Beat util well combined.
Stir in nuts.
Transfer mixture into the prepared baking pan. Smooth the top into an even layer.
Add more nuts on top if desired.
Bake  for 18-22 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out slightly sticky. Please check before the set time. Do not over bake.
Cool completely in pan on wire rack before cutting into bars.
Serve and enjoy :)

name: Cinnamon Buns
instructions: If using instant yeast, omit 1/2 tbsp sugar and 1/4 cup water in the recipe. Just mix the yeast with the flour. And note when adding the remaining 1 cup flour, do not add everything to make sure you don't add too much flour. Add 1/2 cup and the slowly add the rest. Also, make sure to add milk mixture while lukewarm since you will be using instant yeast that is mixed in all-purpose flour. Lukewarm milk will activate the yeast while kneading.

To avoid the hassle of omitting and watching the flour content, I suggest to bloom the yeast even if you are using instant. I find blooming or activating the yeast always gives better result than just adding it.

If you can't find a warm place in your house to prove the bread, place a tray with boiling water on the bottom rack of the oven. Place the bowl with dough covered with plastic wrap or cloth on the middle rack. Close the oven door and let the dough rise for 1-2 hours. Refill the hot water after 45 minutes and let the dough continue to rise. I find this trick better than just leaving the dough in a warm area of my house.
The dough can be cut into strips larger than what I prepared but you will need a larger muffin pan.
If you'd like to drizzle your buns with glaze,  combine  5 tbsp powdered sugar and  1 1/2 tbsp milk. Drizzle over the cinnamon buns.
To read more baking tips,. read "How to Bake BREAD with SUCCESS".

name: Cinnamon Cake
instructions: Pour on the remaining batter and smooth it with a rubber spatula.
Cover with the remaining cinnamon mixture and dribble on the melted butter.
Bake for 25-35 minutes or until a tester inserted in the cake comes out clean.
Cool the cake on a rack for 30 minutes. Run a knife around the edges to free the cake, invert it on a plate,then turn it right side up. Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.
Serve and Enjoy!

name: Cinnamon Roll
instructions: Use a dough slicer to divide the dough into 2 equal parts.
Roll each part until it forms into a log.
In a separate bowl, combine all the ingredients for the filling.
Flatten the dough with a rolling pin until it stretches into a square shape. (see picture above)
Spread some fillings then roll up.
Using a dough slicer, divide the dough with filling into equal parts.
Arrange the cut dough onto a lightly greased 9" baking tray with the end at the bottom. (see picture above)
Cover the tray with a damp cloth and let it rise for 20-30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
Bake for 20-25 minutes.
Remove from oven and top with glaze frosting.
Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Cinnamon-spiced Peach Turnover
ingredients: 1 can (12 or 15 ounces) peach slices, drained & diced
1 (7.3-ounce) package Pepperidge Farm® Puff Pastry Sheets (2 sheets), thawed
*** You may substitute 2 medium peaches, peeled, pitted and sliced, for the canned peach slices
instructions: Heat the oven to 375°F.
Beat the egg and water in a small bowl with a fork.
Stir the peaches, brown sugar, flour, vanilla extract and butter in a bowl.
Unfold the pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.  Divide or cut the pastry sheet into 4 equal squares.
Brush the corners of each pastries with egg wash.
Spoon the peach mixture lengthwise down the center of the pastry.

name: Cheese Rolls
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Beat cream cheese, sugar, egg yolk and vanilla until smooth.
Cut the pastry sheet into 9 equal pieces.
Brush the corners of each pastries with egg wash.
Place 1/2 tbsp of cream cheese filling in the middle of the cut out pastry sheets.
Fold the dough over the filling and press the edges with a fork.
With a sharp knife or clean cutter, make some slashes across the top of the pastries.
Transfer the pastries into a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
Brush the top with egg wash.
Sprinkle with sugar.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Enjoy your yummy Cream Cheese Rolls! ​

name: Choco Butternut Cake
instructions: Combine glaze ingredients and mix well.
Glaze the whole cake.
Coat the whole cake with butternut.
Chill for few minutes until it sets up​.

name: Chocolate Crinkles
instructions: Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
On a separate bowl, mix together cocoa powder, sugar and vegetable oil.
Beat in eggs, one at a time. Stir in vanilla.
Add in flour mixture. Mix until well combined.
Cover the dough and chill for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Scoop 1-2 tbsp of dough and shape into balls by using your palm.
Coat in powdered sugar then place on baking sheet lined with parchment paper or baking mat spacing them 1-2 inches apart.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes until nearly set - they should be soft when touched and should appear slightly under-baked.
Allow to cool a minute or two on the sheets before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Serve and enjoy :)

name: Chocolate Banana Bread
ingredients: 3 large ripe bananas about 1 cup when mashed
3/4 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips plus more for topping
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease a 9 x 5 loaf pan. Set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk together sugar, butter, egg and vanilla.
Add mashed banana and whisk to combine.
Place a strainer over the bowl and sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Use a spatula to mix and stir until just combined. Do not overmix.
Stir-in chocolate chips.
Scoop batter to prepared loaf pan.
Top with more chocolate chips, about 1/4 cup depending on your preference.
Bake at350 F for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out almost clean.
Remove from oven and cool completely on wire rack.
​Serve and enjoy.

name: ​Chocolate Banana Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 425 F.
In a large bowl, whisk together sugar, butter, egg and vanilla.
Add mashed banana and whisk to combine.
Place a strainer over the bowl and sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Use a spatula to mix and stir until just combined. Do not overmix.
Stir-in chocolate chips.
Line a standard 12 cup non-stick muffin pan with paper liners. Scoop and divide batter equally into 12 cups.
Top with more chocolate chips, about 5-8 pieces depending on your preference.
Bake for 5 minutes at 425 F then lower heat to 350 F and bake an additional 12-15 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out  almost clean.
Remove from oven and cool for about 10 minutes before removing from muffin tin. Cool completely on wire rack.
​Serve and enjoy.

name: Chocolate Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour two 9-inch round baking pans or one 13x9 baking pan or two square pans.
Stir together sugar, flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda and salt in large bowl.
Add eggs, milk, oil and vanilla; beat on medium speed of mixer 2 minutes.
Stir in boiling water (batter will be thin).
Pour batter into prepared pans.
Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool 10 minutes; remove from pans to wire racks. Cool completely.

name: Chocolate Cake with Choco Frosting
instructions: Combine all ingredients except butter in a  large saucepan.
Cook over low heat, stirring constantly.
Cook until thick.
Turn off heat.
Add butter and stir until butter is melted.
Cool for a bit and drizzle over the cake until cake is fully covered.
Slice, serve and enjoy.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies​
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix together flour, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in a large bowl until creamy.
Add eggs, beat well.
Gradually add flour mixture, beating well.
Stir in chocolate chips and nuts, if desired.
Drop by large spoonfuls onto ungreased pans or cookie sheet.
Bake 8-10 minutes or lightly browned.
Cool slightly. Remove from cookie sheet to wire rack.
Cool completely.
Enjoy!

name: Chocolate Coconut Bars
ingredients: 1/2 cup or 1 stick softened butter or margarine
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 F.

In a large bowl, using a pastry cutter or fingertips, combine the first four ingredients. Mix until crumbly. Pat into 13 x 9 baking dish. Bake 10 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle chocolate chips over hot crust. Return to oven about 1 minute to soften. Remove from oven and spread chocolate evenly over crust.
In medium bowl, beat eggs until pale yellow.
Beat  in sugar and vanilla.
Add flour, baking powder and salt. Beat until fully incorporated.
Stir in coconut.
Spread mixture evenly over chocolate layer.
Bake 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven and cool completely in pan.
Cut into bars. Serve and enjoy.

name: Chocolate Cupcakes with Coffee Buttercream Frosting
instructions: Recipe yields  28-30 cupcakes.
Make sure to fill each liners with 2/3 cup cake batter. If you fill at 3/4 full, it will overflow on the sides like it has a hat when you pull it from the pan.
Check the cupcakes before the set time as oven temperature varies.
Powdered sugar can be adjusted accordingly.
