Store cupcakes in an airtight container on the counter  at room temperature for up to a week but best to eat within 3-4 days.  Past that, cupcakes will dry out and taste will be a bit different than when fresh.
If stored in the refrigerator, the cupcakes dries up and won't taste fresh.
Only frost the cupcakes that you will consume.
I used 1M Wilton tip to decorate and wilton pearls.
Frosting can be refrigerated the rewhip before using. It can also be stored in the freezer, take it out to thaw then whip again.

name: Chocolate Cupcakes with Cream Cheese Frosting
instructions: Whip softened cream cheese.
Add in cool whip until nice and smooth.
Add the powdered sugar.
Beat until light and fluffy.
Add the vanilla.
Beat until right consistency.
To tint the frosting a color, add a couple drops of food coloring to the mixing bowl and beat until the frosting is completely dyed and no white is showing.
Decorate your cupcakes!  ​

name: Chocolate Cupcakes with Dulce de Leche Frosting
instructions: Recipe yields  28-30 cupcakes.
Make sure to fill each liners with 2/3 cup cake batter. If you fill at 3/4 full, it will overflow on the sides like it has a hat when you pull it from the pan.
Check the cupcakes before the set time as oven temperature varies.

Store cupcakes in an airtight container on the counter  at room temperature for up to a week but best to eat within 3-4 days.  Past that, cupcakes will dry out and taste will be a bit different than when fresh.
If stored in the refrigerator, the cupcakes dries up and won't taste fresh.
Only frost the cupcakes that you will consume.
Frosting can be refrigerated the rewhip before using. It can also be stored in the freezer, take it out to thaw then whip again.
If available, store-bought Dulce de Leche can be used or make your own. You can try my homemade Dulce de Leche.

name: Chocolate Chiffon Cake | Choco Taisan
instructions: Do not use all-purpose flour without using the cake flour substitution I recommended above. Chiffon cakes require cake flour together with the meringue in order to achieve the spongy  and airy cake texture.
Do not overbake and always check before the set time. Oven temperature varies and I highly recommend to check 5 minutes before.  Over-baking will give a dry cake and you don't want that.
There's no need to grease the pan. You can line the whole pan with parchment paper or just the bottom like I did here. I find greasing the pan, gives a deflated cake.

name: Chocolate Flan
instructions: I used a 9 cup size Bundt pan. 12 cup can also be used.
Make sure to check the water in between baking and refill with hot water as needed.
Cool completely before removing from the pan. If the flan is still hot, it will not come off from the pan and the flan will break.
Keep the chocolate flan refrigerated until ready to serve.

name: Classic Ensaymada
ingredients: 3 tbsp unsalted butter, melted plus more for coating
instructions: Using a stand mixer  for kneading produces a much smoother dough.
All-purpose flour can be substituted but bread flour gives a much softer dough.
You can make your own bread flour by measuring out 1 cup all-purpose flour, remove 1 1/2 tsp then add 1 1/2 tsp of vital wheat gluten  then whisk or sift to combine.
Make sure not to add to much extra flour when kneading or else your bread will become hard and dry.
You can use active yeast but you need to bloom it by combing 1/4 cup lukewarm water, active yeast and 1/2 tbsp sugar. Let it sit for about 5-10 minutes.

name: Coconut Bread Sticks
ingredients: 3 cups bread flour plus 4-5 tbsp extra
instructions: For the yeast, make sure that the water is lukewarm, about 115-130F.  If the water is too cold or too hot, the yeast will die and won't bloom.  If that's the case, discard the yeast and make a  new one. Always check the yeast's expiration date and I suggest to invest on a  food thermometer. It's worth it :).

In this recipe, I used instant yeast and still activate it. Why? I just like the result. The dough rises perfectly than just mixing it with the ingredients. I also find that rising is faster when I bloom it.

I baked this bread for about 18 minutes.  Make sure to check before the set time as oven temperature varies. Your bread could be done in 15 minutes. Bread's standard  temperature if using a thermometer is about 190F.
I made 8 large coconut bread sticks. You can make 16 pieces if you like. You just have to cut the dough thinner.
If you have questions or have tried this recipe, comment box is available below.

name: Coffee Buns
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups + 4 tbsp or more all-purpose flour, divided
2 tbsp milk, warm or at room temperature
8 pieces small diced cold butter for filling
instructions: Making round dough balls with smooth top, before flattening before adding the butter (for filling), gives a nice smooth top and makes a nice easy round shape.
Make sure that the edges are fully sealed or else the butter will leak at the bottom.
Make sure to give enough space for the 2nd rising. If possible use two medium trays with 4 buns on each tray or 1 large tray.
Top of the baked bun should be crispy like a shell but not burnt. Make sure to check your oven before the set time as oven temperature varies.

name: Coffee Cake Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Coat your muffin pan well with nonstick cooking spray.
Whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, nutmeg, and cinnamon.
In a separate, large bowl, combine oil, sugar, egg and milk.
Add dry ingredients and stir to combine.
Pour and divide the batter into prepared muffin pan (about 3/4 full).
Bake for 15-20 minutes.
Run a knife around the sides of the muffin and shake them out of the pan while still hot.
Melt the butter in a bowl.
Combine the white sugar with the cinnamon in another bowl.
Dip the head of the muffins in butter, then roll into the sugar/cinnamon mix.
Serve and enjoy!
*** Makes about 12 regular muffins or 24 mini muffins​

name: Coffee Sponge Cake
ingredients: 1 tbsp instant coffee powder dissolved in 1/4 cup hot water
instructions: Adjust the coffee content if desired.
Eggs must be room temperature.
Do not overbake. Make sure to check before the set time as oven temperature varies.
For the frosting, make sure the coffee has cooled down before adding to the butter.

name: Coconut Macaroons
instructions: ​Preheat oven to 350F.
Line mini cupcake pan with mini cupcake liners.
In a large bowl, beat the eggs. Add sugar and butter. Beat until sugar is dissolved.
Add condensed milk and vanilla extract. Beat until mixture is smooth and well combined.
Stir-in desiccated coconut.
Scoop about 2 tbsp mixture into the prepared pan. Press lightly with the back of the spoon or fork to flatten the top. This will give a nice smooth top and prevents spaces at the bottom.
Bake in a preheated oven for 15-18 minutes or until top is golden.
Remove from oven and brush with melted butter. Transfer to a wire rack and cool completely.
Store in an airtight container.
Recipe yields 36 macaroons.
Enjoy!

name: Corn Bread Bibingka
ingredients: 1 (14.75 oz / 418 g) can cream style corn
melted butter and sugar for topping
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.

Line an 8x8 baking pan with banana leaves (make them pliable by passing the banana leaf lightly into a low flame. If banana leaf is not available, grease the bottom and sides of the baking pan with butter.
In a bowl, whisk together rice flour, cornmeal, salt, and baking powder. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat eggs until fluffy. Add sugar and melted butter; continue whisking until foamy.
Add the dry ingredients and coconut milk to the egg mixture. Mix until all ingredients are thoroughly incorporated.  Stir-in cream corn then pour batter mixture into the prepared pan.

Bake in a preheated oven for 40-45 minutes or until top starts to brown. Remove from oven, brush top with melted butter and sprinkle with sugar.  Return pan to the oven and bake for another 10 minutes.
Serve and enjoy!​​

name: Cream Cheese-Filled Banana Bread
ingredients: 1 whole egg + 1 egg yolk,  divided, room temperature
instructions: If the top starts to brown faster than the center is cooking, lower the bread to the bottom of the oven to keep the tops from getting too brown, too fast. Or you can lightly rest a little foil on top of the bread to keep the top from getting too brown. Place a foil on top after 45 minutes and continue baking for another 10 minutes.
Baking times will vary based on moisture content of bananas, cream cheese, climate, and oven variances. You need to bake this moist banana bread until done — watch your bread, not the clock.

name: Cream Puffs
ingredients: High heat is very critical to get these cream puffs rise so make sure that your oven is preheated.
To fill with cream, you can poke a hole and pipe the filling inside or cut the top off like I did and place the top back after they are filled with the cream.
Do not dust with powdered sugar until ready to serve or it will just melt.
To store, you can place the filled puffs in an airtight container up to 2-3 days. You can also freeze them for several weeks.
If you are not a chocolate fan, leave it plain or decorate with some raspberries or strawberries for color.
instructions: High heat is very critical to get these cream puffs rise so make sure that your oven is preheated.
To fill with cream, you can poke a hole and pipe the filling inside or cut the top off like I did and place the top back after they are filled with the cream.
Do not dust with powdered sugar until ready to serve.
To store, you can place the filled puffs in an airtight container up to 2-3 days. You can also freeze them for several weeks.
If you are not a chocolate fan, leave it plain or decorate with some raspberries or strawberries for color.
Preheat oven to 325 deg F.
Line cookie sheet with parchment paper or foil.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Stir until well combined.
Drop dough by rounded tablespoons, 1 inch apart, on prepared cookie sheets.
Bake until set and lightly golden, about 25 minutes.
Cool cookies on cookie sheets for 1 minute.
Transfer cookies to racks to cool completely.
Enjoy!

name: Crema de Fruta
instructions: Put back one layer of cake into the baking pan.
Spread half of the cream filling over the cake.
Top with the other cake.
Spread the rest of the cream filling.
Arrange fruit cocktail decoratively over the cream filling.
Cover with gelatin.
Chill until set.
Enjoy :)​

name: Custard Cake
instructions: In a bowl, whisk egg whites until frothy. Add cream of tartar and beat until foamy. Add 1/8 cup of sugar while beating on high speed until still stiff. Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine all the liquid ingredients (orange juice, lemon extract, egg yolks and vegetable oil).

name: Easy Banana Bread
instructions: If the tops start to brown faster than the center is cooking, lower the bread to the bottom of the oven to keep the tops from getting too brown, too fast. Or you can lightly rest a little foil on top of the bread to keep the tops from getting too brown. I placed a foil on top after 45 minutes and continued baking for another 10 minutes.

name: Easy Banana Muffins
ingredients: 4 very ripe bananas , about 2 cups when mashed
instructions: Preheat oven to 350ºF.
Mix together flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Set aside.
In mixing bowl, combine together bananas, sugar, egg, oil and vanilla.
Add flour mixture and mix at low speed just until combined. Do not  over mix.
Add  the milk, mix just until blended. Do not over mix.
Place baking cups into muffin pan.
Divide the batter equally into muffin pan. Recipe yields 18 muffins.
Bake for 22-25 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean when inserted in center of muffin.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Egg Custard Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Thaw pie crust for about 5 minutes. Poke crust several times with toothpick.
In a bowl, combine eggs, milk and vanilla. Gradually add the sugar while whisking.
Add cornstarch the cornstarch and whisk until all ingredients and incorporated. Set aside
Beat the egg white until soft peak.
Fold the beaten egg white into the filling mixture.
Pour the mixture into the prepared crust.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Bring down temperature to 325 deg F and bake for 30-35 minutes or until the custard is just set and the top turns brown.  The center should be a little wobbly.
Remove from the oven.
Cool the pie in room temperature for an hour, then place in the refrigerator to cool down further. The pie is best served cold.
Enjoy!

name: Egg Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a bowl, mix the cornstarch, sugar, and egg yolks. Stir in the milk and vanilla into the mixture.
Beat the egg white until soft peak.
Add the beaten egg white into the filling mixture.
Add the mixture into the prepared crust.
Bake for 20 minutes. Bring down temperature to 275 deg F and bake for 1 hour or until the custard is just set and the top turns brown.  The center should be a little wobbly.
Remove from the oven.
Cool the pie in room temperature for an hour, then place in the refrigerator to cool down further. The pie is best served cold.
Enjoy!

name: Egg Tarts
instructions: Divide the flattened pastry in to four equal squares.
Drape one piece of puff pastry and press over each muffin pan.
Press the sides with a fork by slightly stretching it to the top. This way it can handle more custard filling.
Pour custard filling into each pastry mold.
Bake for 18-20 minutes or until the center of the custard slightly giggles when moved. You don't want it to set completely.
Wait for few minutes before removing them from the muffin pan.
I used the rounded tip of a knife to lift it from the pan. Then, I transferred mine on a mini muffin paper cups.
Yum! Enjoy your egg tarts!

name: Ensaymada Cupcakes
ingredients: 3/4 cup fresh milk + 1 tbsp white vinegar or lemon juice to make buttermilk
1/4 cup softened butter + 1/4 cup granulated sugar for topping
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F /  180 C.
Place 12 cupcake liners in a cupcake pan.
Combine milk and vinegar.  Set aside for 10-15 minutes to curdle.
Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar together. Beat until light and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time beating after each addition.
Add oil and vanilla. Beat until color turns pale yellow and fully combined.
Add the buttermilk mixture. Stir until well combined.
Add the flour mixture.  Whisk or use a spatula and mix until just combined. Do not over-mix.
Fill each cupcake liner with the batter up to 3/4 full.
Bake for 20-22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove from pan and cool completely cool on a wire rack.
Combine butter and sugar for topping. Spread over the cooled cupcakes. Top with grated cheddar cheese.
Serve with coffee or tea.

name: Filipino Egg Pie
ingredients: 9" or 10" pie crust ( store-bought or homemade​
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
If using a ready made pie crust, please follow packaging instructions.
In a bowl, combine eggs, milk and vanilla. Gradually add the sugar while whisking.
Add cornstarch the cornstarch and whisk until all ingredients and incorporated. Set aside
Beat the egg white until soft peak.
Fold the beaten egg white into the filling mixture.
Pour the mixture into the prepared crust.
Bake for 20 minutes.  Bring down temperature to 325 F and bake for 30-35 minutes or until the custard is just set and the top turns brown.  The center should be a little wobbly.
Remove from the oven.
Cool the pie in room temperature for an hour, then place in the refrigerator to cool down further. The pie is best served cold.
Enjoy!

name: Floating Island
ingredients: 16 oz ube / purple yam root, boiled and mashed or grated
1 can (12 oz/ 354 ml) + 3/4 cup evaporated milk
instructions: ​Avoid opening and closing the oven door. Meringue will deflate from sudden change in temperature. Use the oven light (if available) to check if meringue is ready.

For a successful meringue, make sure not to drop even a streak of water to it. Also remove excess egg yolks if there are any. Egg whites must be room temperature before whisking. Cream of tartar is essential. Do not substitute or omit and make sure it is not old or expired.
Humidity in your room would affect the meringue as well.

name: Frosted Brownies
ingredients: 1/2 cup chopped mixed nuts (walnuts and/or peanuts)
instructions: Beat butter in medium bowl.
Add powdered sugar and cocoa alternately with milk, beating to spreading consistency.
Stir in vanilla until smooth.
Spread the icing on the brownies while the brownies are still slightly warm.
Top with chopped peanuts.
Enjoy your yummy brownies!

name: Garlic Parmesan Bread
ingredients: 1 pouch or 2 1/4 tsp rapid rise yeast
4  1/2 cups all purpose flour or more
instructions: After rising, punch down the dough and transfer onto a lightly floured surface.
Use a dough slicer to divide the dough into 4 equal parts.
Roll each part until it forms into a log. Cut each log into equal pieces.
Roll out each piece of dough into a long rope, about 12 inches, then twist and seal the end.
Place dough twist onto prepared baking sheet and repeat with the rest of dough.
Cover the tray or pan with a damp cloth and let it rise for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Bake for 13-15 minutes.​
Remove from oven and brush melted butter over the warm bread. Sprinkle tops with Garlic Bread Seasoning!
Serve immediately.
Enjoy!

name: Ham & Cheese Rolls
ingredients: 3/4 cups evaporated milk or fresh milk
instructions: Place all dry ingredients including yeast into a bowl except 1 cup all purpose flour.
Attach bowl and dough hook. Raise mixer bowl. Turn to speed 2 and mix about 15 seconds or until ingredients are combined.
Combine all liquid ingredients (whisk egg yolks while adding the milk and melted butter) then add to flour mixture and mix 1-2 minutes longer.

name: Kababayan Bread​
instructions: No evaporated milk? You can use 1 cup fresh/whole milk.
If you want it sweeter, you can add 1/4 cup more granulated sugar.
Make sure not to omit the vegetable shortening mixed with flour because this is the key to achieve the domed shape.
If you are using a darker pan, expect the sides to be somewhat darker. I used a lighter colored pan that's why my muffins have even color from top to base.
Generously grease the pan but do not overly do it. If it's too thick, the sides will be too thick as well and will have a rough texture.
Recipe yields about 16 muffins.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine dry ingredients - flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
In another mixing bowl, combine eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla extract. Whisk until smooth.
Add this mixture into the dry ingredients.
Grease the muffin pans with butter or baking spray.
Transfer the mixture into the greased muffin pans using an ice cream scoop or spoon until half-full.
Bake for 15-18 minutes or until brown.
Brush with melted butter and sprinkle with sugar (if desired).
Remove from muffin pans and cool on wire racks.
Enjoy!

name: Kahlua Cake
ingredients: 1 (15.5 oz) package chocolate cake mix. (I used super moist devils food cake mix)
instructions: Set oven to 350°F.
Generously grease and flour a bundt pan. ( I use Baker's Joy baking spray with flour).
In a large mixing bowl combine all ingredients except for the chocolate chips.
Stir chocolate chips.
Pour into greased bundt pan.
Bake for 55-60 minutes.
Cool in a pan for 10 minutes.
Turn out onto a cooling rack and cool completely.
Start the glaze by whisking together the powdered sugar and Kahlua until smooth, adding in more Kahlua until desired consistency is achieved.
Pour the glaze over the top of the cake.
*** If you do not want to top it with glaze, you can just sprinkle some powdered sugar over the top of the cake.

name: Kit Kat Cake
instructions: Melt butter.
Stir in cocoa.
Alternately add powdered sugar and milk, beating to spreading consistency.
Add small amount additional milk, if needed.
Stir in vanilla.

name: Korean Egg Bread
ingredients: 5 eggs, room temperature (1 egg for the batter and 4 eggs for topping
shredded cheese, I used mozzarella cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 390 F.
Grease a mini loaf pan. I used an 8 cavity mini loaf pan and greased only 4 cavities. (​Cavity size: 3.5 x 2.4 x 1.2 inch)
In a medium bowl, whisk together milk, melted butter, vanilla and one egg.
Place a sieve on top of the bowl and add flour, sugar baking powder and salt.
Sift then whisk until all ingredients are fully incorporated.
Divide the mixture evenly into 4 cavities of greased muffin pan.
Add some shredded cheese.
Add egg on top of each one.
Bake for  15-20 minutes or until set and golden brown.
Best served when warm.
Enjoy :)

name: Korean Cream Cheese Garlic Bread
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups + 4 tbsp or more all-purpose flour, divided
2 tbsp milk, warm or at room temperature
instructions: In a medium mixing bowl, combine garlic butter ingredients.

Dip the bread filled with cream cheese into the garlic butter mixture. You can dip the whole bread if you want it saturated with garlic butter or dip the bread excluding the bottom. You can do this by holding the bread from the bottom, turn upside-down then dip into the mixture.

Place the bread into a pan lined with parchment paper. Sprinkle the top with bread crumbs or parmesan cheese. I used parmesan cheese for this recipe. This topping is optional. but if available, use it. The bread taste better :)
Bake again at 350F for 12-15 minutes or until top starts to become crispy.  Let cool for few minutes.
Recipe yields 4 large Korean Cream Cheese Garlic Bread.

name: Jam Filled Doughnuts
ingredients: 1 pouch or 2 1/4 tsp rapid rise yeast
instructions: Transfer to a greased baking sheet.
Cover and allow to rise again for 20-30 minutes.
Heat a deep pan with cooking oil enough for deep frying.
Add the shaped dough one by one into the oil. Cook until evenly browned, turning as necessary. This takes just a few seconds on each side so never leave it unattended.
Fry 3 pieces at a time to keep the oil temperature constant.
Drain on paper towels.
Fit a pastry bag with a small tip and fill with jam.
Using a straw, poke a small hole in the side of the doughnut .
Pipe the jam inside.
Dust with confectioner's sugar or super fine sugar while still slightly warm.
Enjoy your delicious Jam filled doughnuts! ​

name: Japanese Cheesecake
instructions: I used large eggs and separated them while they are cold. They will be room temp by the time you finished preparing the cream cheese mixture.
If castor or superfine sugar is not available, you can grind them using a blender or a food processor and lightly pulse it. Do not use powdered sugar. We just need superfine.
Critical: *Folding technique - is gently combining meringue into the batter by using a rubber spatula and folding the mixture over on top of itself.
Do not open the oven door while cake is cooling down.

name: Japanese Cheesecake (New Version)
instructions: ​Pour the mixture into the prepared cake pan and tap the pan on the counter to release air bubbles.
Place the pan in a larger pan add boiling water about 1" high up the sides of the pan.

Bake for 30 minutes. Lower the heat to 325 F for another 30 minutes. Turn off the oven, remove the large tray with water and leave the cake inside the oven for another 30 minutes. Cake will shrink a little bit but that is normal.
Remove from oven. Cool completely. Cake should pull on the sides on it's own. Invert the cake and remove the liner.
Dust with powdered sugar. I used a cake stencil on this one.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Langka Cheesecake Bars
instructions: A 6x6 square pan can also be used if you want a taller cheesecake bar.
Fresh jackfruit can be used. In a medium pan, add 1 cup langka, 1/2 cup water and 1/4 cup sugar. Cook until langka is soft and sugar has caramelized.

If Langka Flavor is not available, it can be omitted. You can add a small amount of food color if desired to achieve the yellow cake. But I suggest to add as it provides great flavor and color to this dessert.
Step or bullet#6 can be skipped. You can directly add the langka as a topping. I added langka flavor because it gives  the topping a light swirling color effect as well.
Make sure to check your oven before the set time. Oven temperature varies. This dessert is done as soon as cheesecake topping has just set. Do not overbake or the cake will be dry.
Store the cheesecake bars in an air tight container. They can last for up to 5 days chilled in the fridge.

name: Lemon Buttermilk Pound Cake
ingredients: 1 stick or 1/2 cup unsalted butter (room temperature)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Butter or grease and flour a 9-inch tube pan.
Sift the flour, baking powder and salt together and set aside.
Cream the butter and sugar together until light.
Beat in the eggs one at a time and add lemon zest.
In a measuring cup or small bowl, combine vanilla, buttermilk and vegetable oil.
Alternately add the flour mixture and the buttermilk mixture to the butter mixture, ending with a final addition of dry ingredients. Stir only until no streaks of flour remain.
Pour into prepared pan.Bake for 50-55 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool the cake on a rack for 30 minutes.
Run a knife around the edges to free the cake, invert it on a plate, then turn it right side up.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.
Serve and Enjoy!​

name: Lemon  Cheesecake
ingredients: 2 (8 oz) packages cream cheese, room temp
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
Line an 8 inch square or round baking pan with foil greased with cooking spray.
In a bowl, combine crushed graham crackers and melted butter.
Transfer the mixture to the prepared pan. Press the mixture firmly into an even layer. Set aside.
In another bowl, combine cream cheese, sugar, lemon juice, lemon zest vanilla extract and sugar. Beat together until well combined.
Add the eggs one at a time and beat between each addition.
Pour the cheesecake mixture onto prepared pan with crust. Spread into an even layer.
Bake for 25 minutes or until center is set.
Remove from oven and cool completely.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight.
Remove from the fridge and slice to serve.
Serve or top with whip cream or powdered sugar, or your favorite fruit.

name: Lengua de Gato
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
​Using a whisk or hand mixer, cream the butter.
Gradually add sugar and continue beating until light and fluffy.
Add egg whites and vanilla. Beat until fully incorporated.
Gradually add the flour. Beat on low speed until well combined.
Transfer to a piping bag with a round piping tip. You can also use a zip bag with one corner or tip trimmed to make a hole.
Prepare a tray lined with parchment paper or silicone mat. Pipe the batter about 2 inches long with a space in between cookies.
Bake for 10-13 minutes or until cookies are dry and sides starts to brown slightly.
Remove from oven and transfer the cookies on a wire rack to cool completely. Recipe yields about 50 pieces.
Store in an airtight container.
Enjoy.

name: Light Fruit Cake
ingredients: 1  to 1 1/4 cups dried fruits or fruit cake mix
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F and line a loaf pan with parchment paper greased with oil or butter.
Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat the butter until creamy.
Gradually add the sugar and beat until light and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir-in vanilla.
Add flour mixture in three portions adding milk in between. Beat until fully incorporated.
Combine dried fruits and 2 tbsp flour. Stir into the batter.
Transfer into the prepared pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Make sure to check before the set time as oven temperature varies.
Remove from oven and transfer to a wire rack to cool for a little bit.
Slice, serve and enjoy.

name: Madeleines
ingredients: 1 tsp vanilla extract or 1 1/2 tsp orange zest
instructions: In a medium bowl, lightly whisk the eggs.
Add sugar and beat until fully incorporated.
Stir-in vanilla or orange zest.
Place a sieve on top of the bowl  and sift together flour, baking powder and salt.
Stir or or beat gently until smooth.
Cover the bowl and refrigerate the batter for at least an hour or overnight.
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Grease the madeleine pan with oil or butter and dust with flour discarding excess flour from the pan.
Scoop about 2 tbsp of batter on each mold. Do not worry about spreading them. The batter will spread on their own.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until sides are lightly browned or when top of cake springs back when pressed.
Allow to cool and dust with powdered sugar if desired.

name: Magic Custard Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 325F / 160C. Line a square (8x8) pan with parchment paper and set aside.
Beat the egg yolks and sugar until well combined and are light and frothy.
Add the melted butter, lemon juice and lemon zest. Whisk until fully incorporated.
Add flour whisking well  on medium speed.
Gradually add milk and continue beating on low-medium speed to combine all ingredients.  Set aside.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form then gradually fold into the egg yolk mixture.  Do not overmix.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake in a preheated oven for about 45 minutes or until the cake is golden.
Allow to cool before serving.
This lemony cake magically separates into layers when baked. A delicious custard at the bottom and cake on top.
When making lemon zest, just grate the outermost part of the rind. Do not grate the white part because that's bitter.
Beat the egg whites until stiff or when you have glossy peaks that stand straight. Mixture won't move if you tilt the bowl.
You can easily line  your baking pan with baking paper. Just cut about 11-12 inches baking paper then make four cuts from the paper's edge right up to the corners of the pan.

name: Mamon
instructions: In a bowl, whisk egg whites until frothy.
Add cream of tartar.
Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar while beating in high speed until still stiff. Set aside.

name: Mamon | Filipino Sponge Cake
instructions: Oven temperature varies. Make sure to check the mamon in the oven before the set time. Do not over-bake.
Using ungreased molds give a fluffier Mamon. I find greasing the molds end up having a denser and flat cake.

Placing them upside-down on a cooling rack immediately after removing from the oven, keeps the mamon from deflating. Make sure to line the rack with parchment paper. It's okay for them to have a mark when you peel the paper, you will top it with cheese anyway.
Cool completely before removing from the molds so you can easily unmold them.

name: Mamon Cupcakes
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Prepare the lightly greased muffin pan or lined with paper cups.
Mix together flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.

name: Mango Cheesecake Bars
instructions: A 6x6 square pan can also be used if you want a taller cheesecake bar.

I used store-bought mango jam in a bottle but you can also make your own by combining ripe mangoes and sugar ( add according to your liking) and cook until mangoes are very soft (mushy) and caramelizes.
Mango flavor is optional but I suggest to add as it adds flavor and great color.

Make sure to check your oven before the set time. Oven temperature varies. This dessert is done as soon as cheesecake topping has just set.  Do not let it crack or else the cake will be dry. In short do not overbake.
When cutting, drip the knife on hot water and wipe with paper towels. This will avoid the cheesecake from sticking onto the knife.

Store the Ube Cheesecake Bars in an air tight container. They can last for up to 5 or more days chilled in the fridge. Each bar can be warmed again in the microwave for about 10-12 seconds. The cake will be soft again.

name: Marbled Banana Bread
instructions: Make sure to use overripe bananas. The ones with spots are sweeter and mushier which makes the best banana bread.

The fastest and easiest way to melt the chocolate is using a microwave. If you don't have one, you can use a double boiler. Just heat water in a sauce pan, place a glass bowl on top (not touching the water), add the chocolate and stir until fully melted. Remove from heat, let cool then add the reserved cake batter. You can use any baking chocolate you like.
Do not overbake this cake. Always check before the set time as oven temperature varies. Watch the bread not the time.

name: Marbled Vanilla Cupcakes
ingredients: 1/2 cup + 1 tsp whole milk, room temperature, divided
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F/180C. Prepare the lightly greased muffin pan or line with paper cups.
Mix together flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
In a separate bowl, beat the butter until creamy.
Add the sugar and beat until light and fluffy, about 3-5 minutes on high speed.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Beat in the vanilla extract.
Add the flour mixture (in three additions) and milk (in two additions), beginning and ending with the flour. Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.
Scoop about 2 tbsp cake batter then add cocoa powder and milk. Stir until smooth. Transfer the mixture into a piping bag.
Fill the muffin cups with the cake batter, smooth the top then pipe some chocolate mixture. Use a toothpick to make some swirls.
Bake for about 18 -20 minutes or just until set and a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean.
Let cool in pan for about 5 minutes then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Recipe yields 12 cupcakes.
​Enjoy!

name: Meringue Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 200 degrees F. Line cookie sheet with parchment papers or silicone mats.
Beat egg whites on low-medium speed until frothy.
Add the cream of tartar and beat until soft peaks form.
Gradually add the sugar giving each addition a minute to fully incorporate before adding the next bit.
Continue beating until the sugar dissolves and the mixture holds very stiff peaks.
Beat in vanilla.
Divide the meringue and add a very tiny drop of food coloring to make pastel colored cookies.
Transfer the meringue to a piping bag.
Pipe using star tip leaving a little room between each one.
Bake for 1 1/2 hours. Make sure to turn the pan halfway through so that the cookies bake evenly.
Turn off the oven and leave the cookies in the oven for 15-20 minutes.
Remove from oven and let it cool.
Remove cookies from parchment paper.
Store in an air tight container.
​Enjoy!

name: Mini Banana Bread Loaves
ingredients: Add more toppings if you like. It tends to look like there are less toppings after baking as the cake expands and the topping separates.
Sugar can be adjusted according to your preference. If you will be adding all chocolates on top, you can add 1/2 cup of sugar instead of 3/4 cup.
instructions: Add more toppings if you like. It tends to like there are less toppings after baking as the cake expands and the topping separates.
Sugar can be adjusted according to your preference. If you will be adding all chocolates on top, you can add 1/2 cup of sugar instead of 3/4 cup.
Baking times will vary based on moisture content of bananas, climate, and oven variances. You need to bake this until done — watch your bread, not the clock.
Recipe yields 8 pieces. Feel free to double the recipe if you'd like to make 16 Mini Banana Loaves.
If you have extra overripe bananas, wrap them individually (skin on) with plastic food wrap and freeze. Just thaw when ready to use.

name: Mango Cake
ingredients: 1/2 cup + 1/4 cup +2 tbsp + granulated sugar, divided
instructions: This cake can also be steamed for about the same time as baked. Make sure to cover with foil to avoid water drip and steam over medium-low heat.
If cream of tartar is not available, you can substitute equal amount of lemon juice or vinegar.
You can substitute all-purpose cream for whipping cream though whipping cream tastes better. Make sure to refrigerate first before using.
Sugar can be adjusted on the mango puree and frosting that it if you want the cake sweeter.
Make your own mango juice by diluting the pureed mango with a small amount of water.

name: Mocha Cake
instructions: Beat the egg whites until frothy.
Add the salt, 1 tbsp sugar and 1 tbsp instant coffee powder.
Beat at  medium speed until soft peak. Set aside.
In a sauce pan, combine dissolved coffee and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Bring to a boil over moderate heat (no need to stir).
Boil for 2-3 minutes.
Remove from heat and slowly pour hot syrup into whites, beating constantly until meringue is cool to the touch.

name: Mocha Roll
instructions: Before proceeding, make sure meringue has cooled down.
Add softened butter (1 tbsp at a time), beating well after each addition until mixture is smooth.
***Mixture may look curdled before all of the butter is added but will come back together by the time beating is finished.​

name: Oatmeal Peanut Butter Banana Bar
ingredients: 2 cups rolled oats / old fashioned oats
1 cup mashed banana, about 2-3 medium bananas
1/3 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips plus more for topping (optional)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F/176C.
Line an 8x8 square baking dish or pan with parchment then grease with oil or butter. Set aside.
In a medium bowl, combine oats, banana and peanut butter. Stir until well combined then stir in chocolate chips if desired.
Transfer the mixture into the prepared pan then spread evenly. Top with more chocolate chips if desired.
Bake in a preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until  the top is golden and firm in the center.
Remove from the oven and let cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes then remove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack.
Slice, serve, and enjoy.
Store in an airtight container.

name: Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
instructions: Heat oven to 350 deg F.
Combine flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. Mix well. Set aside.
Beat together margarine and sugars until creamy.
Add eggs and vanilla; beat well.
Add combined flour.
Stir in oats and raisins. Mix well.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 10-13 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet; remove to wire rack.

name: Orange Muffins
ingredients: 1/4 cup orange juice (I used freshly squeezed with pulp)
instructions: Bake for 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted on center comes out clean and muffin tops are golden brown.
While orange muffins are baking, prepare the Orange Glaze.
In a small bowl, whisk the glaze ingredients till sugar is completely dissolved and you get a thick, but pouring consistency.
When muffins are done, remove from oven and cool in pan for 5 minutes. Transfer muffins to a wire rack.
While muffins are still  a bit warm, pour the orange glaze over them.
Allow glaze to set fully before serving.
Enjoy! ​​

name: Orange Muffins
ingredients: 1 cup sour cream or plain yogurt
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
In a separate small bowl, mix together oil, sour cream, egg and orange juice.
Add this to the dry ingredients and mix together until just combined. (I used wire whisk). Do not over-mix. Batter will be thick and spongy. Stir-in orange zest.
Divide the batter equally between the 12 cupcake liners. Gently tap the pan on the counter top to settle the batter.​
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted on center comes out clean and muffin tops are golden brown. Remove from oven and cool for 5 minutes.
While cooling, prepare the orange glaze. In a small bowl, whisk together powdered sugar and orange juice until sugar is completely dissolved and you get a smooth, thick, but pouring consistency.
Transfer muffins to a wire rack with tray at the bottom. Pour the orange glaze over a bit warm muffins.
Allow glaze to set fully before serving.
Enjoy!

name: Over-the Top Sundae Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Blend cake mix, milk, eggs and oil.
Transfer to a lightly greased 13x9-inch pan.
Bake for 30-40 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove from the oven. Cool completely.
Spread softened ice cream on top of cooled cake.
Freeze for 2 hours or overnight.
Just before serving, top with desired fruits and drizzle with chocolate fudge.
Enjoy!

name: Pandan Cupcakes
ingredients: 1 cup / 8oz / 227g sour cream or substitute with plain yogurt
1 cup / 200g sugar (adjust to 2/3 cup if desired)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F / 176 C. Line a muffin tin with 12 cupcake liners. Set aside.
In a bowl, sift flour, salt and baking powder. Add in sugar. Stir to combine.
Beat eggs then add to dry ingredients. Add sour cream, oil and pandan extract. Stir until well incorporated.
Scoop the batter into each cups, dividing equally into 12 paper cups filling about 3/4 full.
Bake for about 35 minutes or until top starts to brown and until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in wire rack.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Pan De Coco
ingredients: 1 pouch or 2 1/4 tsp rapid rise or active yeast yeast
instructions: Use a dough slicer to divide the dough into 4 equal parts.
Roll each part until it forms into a log. Cut each log into equal pieces.
Flatten the dough with a rolling pin until it stretches into a round shape. (see picture above)
Place about 1 tbsp of filling in the middle of the flattened dough.
Gather sides of round, pinch together and twist.
Place all the shaped dough (pinched side down) on a lightly greased baking sheet or tray lined with parchment paper.
Cover the tray with a damp cloth and let it rise for 20-30 minutes.
Pre-heat oven to 325 degrees F.
Bake the shaped dough for 20-25 minutes.
Serve warm.
Enjoy!
Note: You can poke the top of the bread with fork and brush with egg wash before baking if desired. ​ (1 egg + 1/2 tbsp water = egg wash)

name: Pan De Coco New Version
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine all filling ingredients together. Set aside.

Transfer to a floured surface or onto a silicone mat. Divide the dough in half and roll each part into a log. Cut the log into equal pieces Form each piece into a ball to smoothen then flatten using a rolling pin.
Scoop about 1 tbsp of coconut filling in the middle of the flattened dough. Gather the sides and pinch together to seal. Lightly roll the dough (pinched side down) to smoothen.
Place all the shaped dough into a baking pan lined with parchment paper. Cover and let rise for another 30-45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350F / 176C.
Combine egg wash ingredients together and set aside.
Poke the top of each dough with a fork then brush with egg wash.
Bake for 20-22 minutes or until top is golden.
Serve warm. Enjoy!
Recipe yields about 17-20 pieces Pan de Coco.

name: Pandesal
ingredients: extra flour as needed and for kneading
instructions: When measuring flour, fluff up the flour in the bag or canister, spoon the flour into the measuring cup then scrape a knife or metal spatula across the top of the measuring cup to lever the flour.
If using active yeast, combine 1/4 lukewarm water, yeast and 1/2 tbsp sugar. Let bloom for about 5-10 minutes.
While kneading, I added about 1-2 tbsp flour. Do not add too much flour or else the dough will be too heavy and  bread will be hard, dry and crumbly.

You can rise the dough inside the oven by placing a pan or bowl of water on the bottom rack then place the bowl with dough in the middle rack. Make sure that the oven is turned off, oven's door is shut and water is refilled half-way through.
Make sure to check before the set time as oven temperature varies. Watch the bread not the time.
If you want the top a little bit toasted, bake for 22 minutes otherwise 19 minutes is perfect.
Recipe yields about 18 pieces Pandesal.

name: Pan De Siosa
ingredients: 3 tbsp + 1/2 cup unsalted softened butter, divided
instructions: I experimented on the two pans. One is greased and the other is not. I really don't see any difference with the result. Grease or not, will not be a big deal.
If you noticed on the photo, one pan has 8 pieces and the other has 9. I suggest to only put 8 as it gives more room for the dough to rise which means you get bigger and taller rolls.

One pan has only buttercream and some sugar sprinkled on top and the other has added cheese on top. Personally, I prefer the one with cheese. I used queso brand for the cheese but you can use any Filipino brands like Magnolia or Eden.

If using instant yeast, omit 1/2 tbsp sugar and 1/4 cup water in the recipe. Just mix the yeast with the flour. And note when adding the remaining 1 cup flour, do not add everything to make sure you don't add too much flour. Add 1/2 cup and the slowly add the rest. Also, make sure to add milk mixture while lukewarm since you will be using instant  yeast that is mixed in all-purpose flour. Lukewarm milk will activate the yeast while kneading.

To avoid the hassle of omitting and watching the flour content, I suggest to bloom the yeast even if you are using instant. I find blooming or activating the yeast always gives better result than just adding it.
To ream more baking tips,. read "How to Bake BREAD with SUCCESS"

name: Parmesan Cheese Bread
instructions: Heat the oven to 350°F.
Lightly grease the mini muffin tin.
Mix all the dry ingredients together except cheese.
Add oil, beaten eggs, milk and stir in till the dry ingredients are well moistened.
Add the Parmesan cheese.
Put into greased muffin tins.
Bake for 15-18 minutes or until golden brown. Make sure not to over bake.
Enjoy them right out of the oven.

name: Pasti Crinkles
instructions: ​​Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Sift and set aside.
On a separate bowl, Sift together cocoa powder, granulated sugar and brown sugar.
Add vegetable oil and vanilla.
Add eggs, one at a time.
Add in flour mixture. Mix until well combined.
Cover the dough and chill or freeze for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Preheat oven to 325 deg F.
Scoop 1/2 or 1 tbsp of dough and shape into balls by using your palm. ​
Coat in powdered sugar then place on baking sheet greased or lined with parchment paper spacing them 2-inches apart.

Bake for 6 to 8 minutes or until nearly set - they should be soft when touched and should appear slightly under-baked. (Always check before the set time as oven temp varies.) Smaller crinkles will need less time in the oven.
Allow to cool a minute or two on the sheets before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Pipe pastillas filling at the bottom of the cookie and place another cookie on top of the filling.​
Serve and enjoy :)

name: Peach Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Lightly grease an 9 inch glass baking dish or pan.
Combine melted butter and brown sugar. Pour over into the the dish.
Arrange peach slices on the base of the baking dish.
Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
Beat softened butter and the sugar using electric beater until creamy.
Continue beating while adding the eggs gradually.
Add the vanilla extract and sour cream.
Fold in the flour mixture into the butter mixture until well combined.
Transfer the mixture over the peaches and smooth the surface.
Bake for 30 minutes or until toothpick or skewer inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Remove from the oven. Cool for few minutes.
Invert the cake onto a flat plate.
Serve warm at room temperature.
Enjoy!​

name: Peach Puffs
ingredients: 1 can (12 or 15 ounces) peach slices, drained and diced
1/2 of a 17.3-ounce packagePepperidge Farm® Puff Pastry Sheets (1 sheet), thawed
*** You may substitute 4 medium peaches, peeled, pitted and sliced, for the canned peach slices
instructions: Heat the oven to 400°F.
Beat the egg and water in a small bowl with a fork.
Stir the diced peaches, brown sugar, flour, vanilla extract and butter in a bowl.
Unfold the pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.  Roll the pastry sheet into a 14x12-inch rectangle.  Divide/cut the pastry sheet into 9 square pieces.
Brush the muffin pan or individual muffin cups with butter.
Drape one piece of puff pastry over each muffin cups.
Spoon the peach mixture into the pastry.
Fold all sides on top of the mixture.
Brush the pastry with the egg mixture.
Sprinkle with sugar.
Bake for 15 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown.
Brush with butter after baking.
Let the pastry cool on a wire rack for 20 minutes.
​Serve and enjoy.

name: Peach Strudel
ingredients: 1 can (12 or 15 ounces) peach slices, drained
1/2 of a 17.3-ounce packagePepperidge Farm® Puff Pastry Sheets (1 sheet), thawed
*** You may substitute 4 medium peaches, peeled, pitted and sliced, for the canned peach slices
instructions: Heat the oven to 400°F.
Beat the egg and water in a small bowl with a fork.
Stir the peaches, brown sugar, flour, vanilla extract and butter in a bowl.
Unfold the pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.  Roll the pastry sheet into a 14x12-inch rectangle.
Spoon the peach mixture lengthwise down the center of the pastry.  Cut slits 1 inch apart from the 2 sides of the pastry rectangle to within 1/2 inch of the peach mixture.
Starting at one end, fold the pastry strips over the peach mixture, alternating sides, to cover the peach mixture.
Brush the pastry with the egg mixture.
Sprinkle with sugar.
Place the pastry onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 25 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown.
Brush with butter after baking.
Let the pastry cool on a wire rack for 20 minutes.

name: Peanut Butter Banana Brownies
instructions: It is best to use overripe bananas with brown spots on its peel. The more spots the better because they are sweeter.
To make the peanut butter easy to swirl, microwave for about 15 seconds.
After cooling in pan, you can slice and serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator fist.
To slice, use a hot knife. That is by dipping the blade in hot water for few minutes then dry the blade. Make sure to warm the blade each time you cut.
I hope these TIPS help.

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
ingredients: 1 1/3 cups milk chocolate toffee bits, divided
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Mix together flour, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat shortening, peanut butter, vanilla, sugar and milk until well blended.
Add egg; beat just until well blended.
Add the flour mixture; gradually beat into peanut butter mixture.
Stir in 1 cup toffee bits, reserve remaining for topping.
Drop by tablespoons about 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Top with reserved toffee bits.
Bake 7-8 minutes or until set.
DO NOT OVER BAKE.
Cool 2 minutes. Remove to wire rack. Cool completely.

name: Peanut Butter Cheesecake Brownies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F. Line a 13 x 9 baking pan with greased parchment paper (bottom and sides).

In alarge microwavable bowl, combine unsweetened chocolate and butter. Microwave on high heat for 2 minutes or until butter is melted. Stir until chocolate is completely melted and mixture is well blended.
Add 1-3/4 cups sugar, mix well.
Stir in 4 eggs then and flour. Mix well.
Pour into prepared pan.
Beat cream cheese until creamy.
Add 1/2 cup sugar and beat until smooth.
Add egg and continue beating until well combined.
Add peanut butter and mix until blended.
Drop spoonful of mixture over brownie batter. Swirl gently with a knife.
Bake 40-45 minutes. Do not overbake. Make sure to check before the set time as oven temperature varies. Mine was done in 40 minutes.
Cool completely.
Slice into bars. I made 28 pieces total.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Perfect Brownies
instructions: Using a double boiler, over low heat, melt butter and chocolate chips. Continue stirring until smooth and silky. Remove from heat, add coffee powder and stir to melt. Set aside and let cool.

DIY Double Boiler:   Place a shallow heatproof bowl on top of a small or medium saucepan, fitted so that the bowl can fit in the saucepan without falling in. The idea is that the bowl will hover above the water in the pan below.)
Preheat oven to 350F. Line an 8x8 pan wit parchment paper lightly greased with oil.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs.
Add sugars and vanilla extract. Whisk well to dissolve sugars.
Add melted chocolate and mix well.
Add in flour and salt through a sieve and mix until smooth and all lumps are removed.
Pour batter into prepared baking pan.
Bake in a preheated oven for 30-35 minutes. Brownies will continue to bake once out of the oven.
Let cool before serving.
Slice to desired size. Enjoy!

name: Pianono
ingredients: caster or superfine sugar for dusting
instructions: Preheat oven at 375°F.
Beat the egg whites with an electric hand mixer. Add cream of tartar and mix until stiff.
Slowly add the sugar one tbsp at a time beating well after each addition.
Beat the egg yolks and add them to the egg whites at a slow speed.
Fold in the flour one tablespoon at a time.
Pour the mixture gently into the prepared jelly roll pan, lined with wax paper.
Bake in the oven for about 15 minutes or until the center of the cake is slightly springy.
Remove from oven and let the cake cool.
On a work surface sprinkle the wax paper evenly with caster sugar.
Turn the pan onto the sugared wax paper, then carefully remove the tin.
Remove the wax paper from the cake.
Spread the margarine over the cake, sprinkle with sugar over the margarine.
With the longest side facing you, roll up the cake away from you.
Dust it with sugar and slice crosswise.
Enjoy!

name: Pianono (Filipino Swiss Roll)
instructions: Measure out 1 cup all-purpose flour.
Remove 2 tbsp of all-purpose flour and place it back in your flour canister.
Replace the removed all-purpose flour with 2 tbsp cornstarch.
Sift flour 5 times.

name: Pineapple Coconut Cupcake
ingredients: I used a can of pineapple tidbits and cut them into small cubes. You can also use crushed pineapple if you want. Drained and juice was reserved for the glaze. If using fresh pineapple, you can substitute the pineapple juice with lemon juice or totally omit and add a small amount of milk instead.

If you cannot find or if the sweetened coconut flakes are not available, you can use sweetened shredded coconut instead. If using unsweetened, adjust the amount of sugar in the cake batter. Instead of using 1/2 cup, make it 2/3 cup.
instructions: Make sure to watch the VIDEO above and don't forget to Subscribe :)
Preheat oven to 350 F /  176 C.
​In a large bowl, beat the butter until creamy.
Add sugar and beat until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Place a sieve over the bowl and sift together the all-purpose flour and baking powder. Using a spatula, stir until just combined. Make sure to scrape the sides of the bowl.
Stir-in pineapple and coconut flakes.
Divide the batter equally between the 12 cupcake liners. Gently tap the pan on the counter top to settle the batter.​
Bake for about 25 minutes or until toothpick inserted on center comes out clean and muffin tops are golden brown. (Make sure to check before the set time as oven temperature varies.)
Remove from oven and cool in pan for 5 minutes.
​Transfer cupcakes to a wire rack with tray at the bottom and cool completely.
While cooling, prepare the glaze by combining powdered sugar, milk and pineapple juice.  Stir until smooth.
Pour glaze over the cupcakes. You can use a spoon or sauce dispenser. Allow glaze to set fully before serving.
Enjoy!

name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened at room temperature
1 can, 20oz pineapple slices in pineapple juice (reserve 1/2 cup juice)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease the sides of a 9.5" baking pan.
In a heated proof bowl, melt butter then add brown sugar. Stir well to combine.  Pour onto a pan and spread evenly.
Arrange 8 pineapple slices on the base of the pan and 2 pieces (sliced in half) onto the sides.  Add maraschino cherries on each holes. Set aside.
Place a sieve on a small bowl then add flour, 1/4 cup sugar, baking powder, and salt. Sift, stir and set aside.

In a large bowl, beat the butter until creamy.  Add the 1/2 cup sugar and beat until light and fluffy (3-5 minutes). Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Beat in the vanilla and pineapple juice.

Add half of the flour mixture and stir or beat on low speed to combine. Add the remaining flour and continue stirring until just combined.  Do not over mix. Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.
Pour the batter over the prepared pan with pineapples and cherries.
Bake for about 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool completely.
Using a spatula, loosen the sides of the cake. Place a 10" plate or cake board on top of the cake and invert.  Pan will slide off very easily.
Slice, serve and enjoy.

name: Pinoy Cheese Cupcakes
ingredients: 1/2 cup grated cheese plus more for topping
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 deg F.
Combine all purpose flour and baking powder. Set aside.
In a bowl, cream butter and sugar together using a mixer.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add vanilla and beat to blend.
Mix in flour, alternating with the milk, starting and ending with the flour.
Fold in the grated cheese and mix just until well incorporated.
Pour batter into prepared pan lined with paper cups until 2/3 full.
Bake for 15 minutes, top with grated cheese, then bake again for 10 minutes or until sides and cheese topping are slightly brown.
Cool on wire rack.

name: Pizza Bread
ingredients: French rolls or any left over bread that you have, cut in half
pepperoni slices or any toppings of your choice.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Halve the french rolls and top them with pasta sauce, mozzarella cheese and pepperoni slices or toppings of your choice (e.g. ham & pineapple).
Bake 10 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly and melted.

name: Pizza Dough
ingredients: 30 ml or 2 tbsp olive oil or vegetable oil
instructions: Using oil instead of butter makes the process easier to stretch out the dough, adds flavor and prevents the dough from drying up while baking.
Using a stand mixer  for kneading produces a much smoother dough.
All-purpose flour can be substituted but bread flour gives a much softer dough.
You can make your own bread flour by measuring out 1 cup all-purpose flour, remove 1 1/2 tsp then add 1 1/2 tsp of vital wheat gluten  then whisk or sift to combine.
Never overload the pizza with toppings. It will weigh down your light and fluffy crust and keep it from baking properly.
Make sure to check the pizza not the time as oven temperature varies. I use gas oven and place the pizza in the middle rack.
I baked mine for only 12 minutes. If you want a crispy crust continue baking until desired dough texture.
Recipe yields two 8-10" or 1 large 14oz pizza.

name: Pound Cake
instructions: Grease two 9x5 loaf pan. Preheat ovens at 350F.
Sift together the flour and baking powder.
Cream butter, sugar, and salt until the mixture is smooth and light in color.
Add in eggs one at a time. Mix until well combined.
Add the sifted dry ingredients, mixing on low speed until just blended.
Pour batter into loaf pan. Bake about 40-50 minutes, until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Cool the cakes in the pans for a few minutes, then transfer to racks to cool completely.
Enjoy your yummy Pound Cake!

name: Pudding Muffins ala Pande Tsalap
ingredients: 3 cups bread cut into small pieces
instructions: This recipe can be baked without a liner using a muffin or cupcake pan. Greasing is not required.
If red wine is not available, you can substitute it with 1 tsp vanilla.
Mango jam can be replaced with apricot, orange or fruit jam of choice. Mango was chosen for this recipe to resemble the one from the television series.
You can use loaf bread of plain hamburger ban (no sesame seeds) or any plain bread.

name: Pumpkin Cake Roll
ingredients: 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon or 1 tsp pumpkin spice
instructions: If pumpkin spice is available, omit the cinnamon powder and add 1/2- 1 tsp pumpkin spice instead. This will give a more pumpkin flavor to your cake.
I used the store-bought Pumpkin Puree in can. If not available, cut the squash or pumpkin (with skin removed) in small pieces then steam until very soft and mash or use a blender to puree.
Make sure the parchment paper is tightly fitted on your baking pan to ensure the cake is nice and even.
Put enough powdered sugar on the towel when rolling up so it will not stick.
Make sure to roll the cake as soon as it comes out of the oven. The longer it sits, the harder it is to roll.
Store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Pumpkin Streusel Muffins
ingredients: 2 tsp pumpkin spice or Cinnamon powder
1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted and cooled
instructions: Cinnamon powder is the best substitute for pumpkin spice but if you can find one, I suggest to use it for a more pumpkin flavor to your muffins. If you can't and will be using cinnamon, add some nutmeg and ground ginger as well.
I used the store-bought pumpkin puree in can. If not available, cut the squash or pumpkin (with skin removed) in small pieces then steam until very soft and mash or use a blender to puree.

When the muffins bake and increase in size, there will be spaces between the clumps of the streusel. Before baking, you can either press the streusel over the batter then add more if you like or you can bake the extra toppings for few minutes or until golden brown then sprinkle on the extra toppings to fill up the extra spaces.
Add nuts to streusel if you like.
Recipe yields 12 muffins. Best eaten the same day.

name: Red Velvet Cake
ingredients: 1/2 cup sour cream or plain yogurt
instructions: In a medium bowl, beat the whipping cream until thick. Set aside.
In a small bowl beat the cream cheese until soft and creamy. Add powdered sugar and beat until smooth. Add to whipped cream. Fold  or beat on low speed until well combined.
Top the first cake with whipped cream and spread evenly. Place the 2nd cake on top then frost the whole cake with whipped cream. Cover the sides with cake crumbs.
Decorate as desired. Using a 2D tip, I piped the top with 12 rosettes  and cover the top of the cake with some cake crumbs.

name: Red Velvet Cheesecake Bars
instructions: A 6x6 square pan can also be used if you want a taller cheesecake bar.
Make sure to check your oven before the set time. Oven temperature varies. This dessert is done as soon as THE cheesecake topping has just set. Do not overbake or the cake will be dry.

Store the Ube Cheesecake Bars in an air tight container. They can last for up to 5 or more days chilled in the fridge. Each bar can be reheated in the microwave for about 10-12 seconds. The cake will be soft again.

name: Red Velvet Crinkles
instructions: I made an experiment on this batch by dividing the batter into three. the first one was chilled for 6 hours, the 2nd one was placed in the freezer for 45 minutes and the 3rd one was immediately used. The dough was too sticky that it absorbs too much powdered sugar, very soft and flattens even before baking. The powdered sugar melted so had to double coat them which resulted to an overly sweet and flat cookies.
The dough placed in the freezer or chilled is much easier to work on.
I suggest rolling them all at once then coat with powdered sugar.
Shape dough balls by batch leaving the remaining batter in the chiller then continue with the remaining dough.
Chilled dough has better texture. Soft, moist and thick!
1/2 tbsp cookies will only take about 9 minutes to bake, and 1 tbsp takes about 10 minutes. Do not overbake!
Recipe yields about 40 cookies depending on the size.
Only add cream cheese to cookies that you will immediately consume.
Cookies can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 4 days, refrigerate to extend the shelf life for few more days or freeze for a couple of months. ​

name: Red Velvet Cupcakes
instructions: Place all the ingredients except but the vanilla into the top of a double boiler with fast-boiling water below.
Take your handheld electric mixer and beat the mixture until the icing has stiff peaks.
Remove the double boiler from heat, add the vanilla extract and keep on beating until it is thick, glossy.
You can add drops of food coloring if you like.
Spread it onto cakes with a metal spatula or pipe it onto cupcakes.

name: Red Velvet Cupcakes with Cream Cheese Frosting
ingredients: Make sure to sift the dry ingredients together so that they are well incorporated. I also find that cocoa powder contains little chocolate balls that you'll catch on the sifter. Do not toss that but instead use your hand, a spoon or spatula to press it against the sieve to make fine crumbs.

When mixing the dry ingredients with the cake batter, make sure to beat on the lowest speed setting. The goal here is to lightly incorporate the ingredients together. When just combined, use a spatula to scrape the sides of bowl and fold until the batter is smooth. Overbeating makes the cake dry and you don't want that.
instructions: Make sure to sift the dry ingredients together so that they are well incorporated. I also find that cocoa powder contains little chocolate balls that you'll catch on the sifter. Do not toss that but instead use your hand, a spoon or spatula to press it against the sieve to make fine crumbs.

When mixing the dry ingredients with the cake batter, make sure to beat on the lowest speed setting. The goal here is to lightly incorporate the ingredients together. When just combined, use a spatula to scrape the sides of bowl and fold until the batter is smooth. Overbeating makes the cake dry and you don't want that.

Check the cupcakes before the set time. Oven temperature varies but do not open the oven in the middle of the baking time. Say like for this one to bake at 18-22 minutes, check at 17 minutes and insert a toothpick in middle if it comes out clean.  If not, use the time recommended and adjust as needed. Do not overbake.
For the frosting, you can add 1/2 cup more powdered sugar if you want a thicker and sweeter frosting. You can taste test and adjust according to your liking.

name: Sans Rival
ingredients: 1 cup ground roasted and unsalted cashews
instructions: What is soft ball stage and how to test? Soft-Ball Stage is a cooking term meaning that a sugar syrup being heated has reached 112 – 116 C (234 – 240 F.) It is a test of how hot a sugar syrup is, and of how much water is left in it. To test, using a clean spoon, carefully take a little of the syrup and drop it into the bowl of cold water. Leave to cool for a moment then pick up the ball of syrup. If it's pliable, sticky and can be moulded in your fingers easily, it has reached the soft ball stage.       ​​​​​

Be careful when separating the eggs. Avoid a small streak of egg yolks or water mixed into the egg whites. The mixing bowl needs to be totally dry as well. If not,  the egg whites will take forever to beat causing a failed meringue.
Unsalted butter and margarine is being used in this recipe. You can omit the margarine and use pure butter instead.
​If you draw the circles using a regular pen, make sure to place the parchment paper upside-down (ink down). Use edible pen if you have one.
You can use chopped pistachios to cover the cake if you like.
I hope these tips help you make this cake successfully. If you have questions or have tried this recipe, comment section is available below.

name: Silvanas
ingredients: 1 cup butter, softened at room temperature
instructions: Preheat oven to 300 F.
Beat egg whites. Add cream of tartar and continue beating until frothy.
Gradually add granulated sugar. Beat until soft peaks form.
Add vanilla extract and continue beating until stiff.
Gradually add the  ground cashew in 3 parts. Fold until well combined.
Transfer meringue into a piping bag with the tip cut off.  Pipe into silicone mat or parchment paper making circle or oval shapes. Smooth out the top to remove peaks.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cookies are cooked through if they can be easily be detached from the pan.
In a medium bowl, add softened butter and powdered sugar. Beat until fully combined. Add milk and beat until pale and fluffy.

Spread buttercream on a meringue cookie and place another cookie on top of the buttercream. Press lightly to evenly distribute the buttercream filling. Coat all the sides with more buttercream then roll in biscuit crumbs until well coated. Refrigerate for few minutes before serving. Enjoy.

name: Sour Cream Banana Bundt Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Butter or grease and flour a 9-inch tube pan.
Whisk flour, baking soda and salt together and set aside.
Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add the vanilla and mashed banana.
Finally, mix in half of your dry ingredients.
Add all of the sour cream.
Then add the remainder of the flour mixture.
Spread the batter in the prepared bundt pan.
Bake for 60-65 minutes or until a tester inserted in the cake comes out clean.
(Check the cake after about 30 minutes and if it's browning too quickly, cover loosely with a foil tent.)
Cool the cake on a rack for 10 minutes. Run a knife around the edges to free the cake, invert it on a plate, then turn it right side up. Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.
Serve and Enjoy!

name: Sour Cream Pound Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar together.
Add the sour cream and mix until incorporated.
Sift the baking soda and flour together.
Add to the creamed mixture alternating with eggs, beating in each egg 1 at a time.
Add vanilla.
Pour the mixture into a greased and floured loaf pan.
Bake for 40 minutes to 1 hour or until toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Best served warm. Enjoy! ​​

name: Spanish Bread
ingredients: 1 pouch or 2 1/4 tsp rapid rise yeast
3 egg yolks (Save your egg whites and make Meringue Cookies)
3/4 cups evaporated milk or fresh milk ( I used fresh whole milk )
instructions: After an hour, transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface.
Use a dough slicer to divide the dough into 4 equal parts.
Roll each part until it forms into a log. Cut each log into equal pieces.
Flatten the dough with a rolling pin until it stretches into a triangular shape.
Spread some filling then roll up.
Cover the dough with bread crumbs and place on lightly greased baking sheet or pan lined with parchment paper (End of the bread  or sim at the bottom please.)
Cover the tray with a damp cloth and let it rise for 20-30 minutes.Cover the tray with a damp cloth and let it rise for 20-30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
Bake for 20-25 minutes.
Serve warm.
Enjoy!​ (If you have made this bread or have questions about it, please let me know what you think by writing a comment below.)

name: Spanish Bread
instructions: If using instant yeast, omit the first step and just add it to the dry ingredients.  My secret tip. Use instant yeast and bloom it. I always get a good rise. when I do this. Just make sure you have the right water temperature to get a perfect bloomed yeast.
Using a stand mixer  for kneading produces a much smoother dough.
All-purpose flour can be substituted but bread flour gives a much softer dough.
You can make your own bread flour by measuring out 1 cup all-purpose flour, remove 1 1/2 tsp then add 1 1/2 tsp of vital wheat gluten  then whisk or sift to combine.
Make sure not to add to much extra flour when kneading or else your bread will become hard and dry.
Make sure to cover the dough that you are not working with to avoid drying.

name: Sponge Cake
instructions: After mixing the flour with warm milk with oil, make sure to let the mixture cooled down before adding the egg yolks. You don't want a scrambled egg in your mixture right?

Folding the meringue to the cake batter has to be done properly. Fold a small portion, about a third or less of the meringue into the batter. Fold using a spatula or whisk, by using a flipping motion. Do not stir. You can also use a whisk like I did on the video but you do it lightly or gently and treat your whisk like a spatula. Fold until the foam is just incorporated. Do not over-mix.

I say optional for the cream of tartar because I've made in again without it to experiment and I did not see a difference with the result. But If you have it, might as well use it. Cream of tartar helps stabilize the egg whites.
If you read my blog fully, I mentioned above what to top it with e.g. frosting recipes.
Enjoy this recipe and I hope this tips helps you successfully make this cake.

name: Star Bread
ingredients: 1 pouch or 2 1/4 tsp rapid rise yeast
instructions: After rising, punch down the dough and transfer onto a lightly floured surface.
Use a dough slicer to divide the dough into 2 equal parts.
Roll each part until it forms into a log. Cut each log into equal pieces.
Form small dough balls and place on baking sheet or in a well-greased pan or glass. (ugly side down).
Cover the tray or pan with a damp cloth and let it rise for 20 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
While waiting for the oven to heat up, use kitchen scissors and cut an X-shape on top of the dough to make a star-like shape.
Brush with melted butter and dip the top part  in sugar.
Bake for 18-20 minutes.
Serve immediately.
Enjoy!

name: Sweet Cheese Rolls | Cheese Buns
instructions: Place the rolled dough (end or sim at the bottom) onto a lightly greased pan or lined with parchment paper.
Cover and let rise for another 30 minutes. Dough should expand more.
Lightly brush with milk the bake in a preheated oven at 350 F for about 20 minutes or until top is golden.
Immediately lightly brush with butter while still warm.
Cool completely then spread a good amount of butter on top and sprinkles some sugar.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Sweet Potato Muffins
ingredients: 1-1/4 cups sweet potato/yam, boiled and mashed
instructions: You can either use the sweet potato (orange in color) or the lighter/pale in color like the one I used.  You can boil or steam them.
Make sure NOT to overbeat the batter to achieve a soft and moist muffins.

Make sure to check before the set time as oven temperature varies. If you will be using the paper liners, they can be done in 20 minutes but using a stand-alone cups could take a little bit longer.  Mine took about 24-25 minutes.
Also, stand-alone cups are a taller than a regular liner so my recipe yielded 12 muffins. It may yield about 15 muffins if using a standard cupcake liners.
You can totally omit the nuts or you can replace it with cashew, peanuts, almonds, pecans or any nuts of choice.
I only added 1/2 tsp cinnamon powder as I am not really a fan of it but it taste good if you have just a little bit. You can either omit or add another 1/2 tsp if you like.
These muffins are best eaten when freshly baked. The nuts has some crunch to it and the muffins are very soft and moist.
Leftover muffins can be stored  in an airtight container at room temperature for to 3 days then refrigerate up to 1 week or freeze up to 1 month.
Reheat leftover muffins in the microwave for about 12 seconds/piece.

name: Taisan Loaf Cake
ingredients: sugar and grated cheddar cheese for topping
instructions: In medium bowl, add egg yolks and 1/4 cup sugar. Whisk until color turns pale yellow. Add vanilla, milk and oil. Whisk until combined and sugar  is fully dissolved.
In a large mixing bowl, sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Stir to combine, Make a well at the center and pour the liquid ingredients.  Whisk until just combined. Do not over mix.
In a separate bowl, using a hand mixer, beat the egg whites until frothy. Add the cream of tartar and continue beating until foamy. Gradually add the 1/2 cup sugar and beat until stiff peak forms.
Gradually add the meringue into the batter and fold until fully incorporated. Do not over mix.
Divide the batter equally into two ungreased loaf pans with bottom lined with parchment paper.
Tap the pan with batter to remove air bubbles.

Bake in a preheated oven at 350 F for 30-35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and cool completely before removing from the pan. Loosen the edges using a spatula and invert to remove the parchment paper.
Spread melted butter on top and sprinkle with white sugar. Top with grated cheese.
Slice and enjoy.
Recipe yields 2 loaf pans. ( Size: 9x5)

name: Tapioca Parmesan Cheese Bites
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Combine egg, milk, oil, tapioca flour, and salt in a big bowl and beat until smooth.
Add cheeses and beat for another minute.
Pour batter into a non-stick or lightly greased mini muffin tin filling each well about 3/4 full.
Bake for 13-15 minutes until golden.
Remove from oven and cool for a few minutes before removing from pan.
Best served when warm. Enjoy!

name: Traditional Ensaymada
ingredients: 1 pouch or 2 1/4 tsp rapid rise yeast
instructions: After rising, punch down the dough and transfer onto a lightly floured surface.
Use a dough slicer to divide the dough into 2 equal parts.
Roll each part until it forms into a log. Cut each log into equal pieces.​
Flatten the cut dough, roll into a rope and make a spiral shape.
Arrange in a tray and cover with a damp cloth or plastic wrap and let it rise for 20 minutes.
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
Bake for 15-20 minutes.
Brush with melted butter as soon as it comes out of the oven. It will keep the ensaymada moist.
Place on cooling rack. When cooled down, brush the top with margarine and coat the top with sugar or dunk it in sugar.
Serve immediately.
Enjoy! See below photos for more serving options.

name: Tres Leches Cake
instructions: ​In a small bowl, combine evaporated milk, condensed milk and 1/4 cup whole fresh milk.
Gently pour the milk mixture over the cake.
Refrigerate the cake for at least 12 hours or overnight to fully soak the cake.
In a medium bowl, beat heavy cream, 2 tbsp sugar and vanilla until  stiff peaks.
Smooth over the top of the cake.
Sprinkle with ground cinnamon and top with strawberry or other fruits that you like (if desired).
Enjoy.

name: Tres Leches Cake (New)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F. Lightly grease 13 X 9-inch baking pan.
In a bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, combine egg yolks and 2/3 cup sugar. Mix until yolks are pale yellow. Add fresh milk and vanilla extract. Stir until well combined. Add egg yolk mixture to flour mixture and stir until just combined. Do not over mix. Set aside.
Beat together the egg whites and 3 tbsp sugar until stiff peaks are formed. Fold the egg white mixture into the batter just until combined. Transfer to the prepared pan. Smooth into even layer.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean. Remove from the oven and cool completely. Using a fork, toothpick or skewer, poke holes all over the top of the cake.
​In a small bowl, combine evaporated milk, condensed milk and 1/4 cup whole fresh milk.
Gently pour the milk mixture over the cake. Refrigerate the cake for at least 12 hours or overnight to fully soak the cake.
In a medium bowl, beat whipping cream, 2 tbsp sugar and vanilla until stiff peaks. Smooth over the top of the cake.
Sprinkle with ground cinnamon and top with strawberry or other fruits that you like (if desired). Enjoy.

name: Ube Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
Grease a 13 x 9 pan with oil or butter.
In a mixing bowl, combine flour, yeast and sugar. Stir until combined.
Add milk, lukewarm water,  melted butter and ube extract.
