In a separate bowl, combine wet ingredients. Stir until fully incorporated.
Add the flour mixture and mix until it forms a dough.
Scoop about 1 1/2 tbsp of dough and shape to form a ball using your hands greased with oil.
Coat with sesame seeds.
Deep fry until golden. Make sure the dough is cooked through.
Serve alone or dip in chocolate syrup if desired.
Enjoy.

name: Cabbage Soup
ingredients: 1 small napa cabbage, sliced about 4-5 cups
instructions: Heat about 2 tbsp cooking oil in a deep pan or wok.
Saute' garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add onion. Cook until onion is soft and translucent.
Add pork. Saute with the garlic and onion. Cook until pork turns light brown or no longer pink. Stir occasionally and season with salt and pepper.
Add water. Lightly stir and bring to a boil.
Add pork cube and soy sauce. Stir to combine and continue simmering.
Add cabbage. Cook for about 3-4 minutes.
Add parsley and green onions. Cook for an additional 2 minutes. Season with additional salt and pepper if desired.
Serve and enjoy.​
Makes about 4-6 servings.

name: Calamares
ingredients: bread crumbs ( for best result use Krispers- see photo below)
instructions: Slice the squid into rings.
Combine sliced squids, salt and pepper. Let stand for 15 minutes.
Dredge the squid in flour then dip in beaten egg and roll over breadcrumbs.
Heat cooking oil in a pot.
When the oil is hot enough, fry the squid rings until the color turns light brown. Do not overcook!
Remove from oil and drain in paper towel or use a strainer.
Serve hot. Enjoy!!!

name: Cheesy Hawaiian Quesadilla
instructions: Arrange ham on half of each tortilla.
Sprinkle with equal amounts of pineapple and shredded cheese.
Fold in half.
Heat a large nonstick pan or skillet on medium heat.
Add the quesadilla. Heat for 3 minutes; turn over. Heat 3 minutes or until golden brown.
Repeat with remaining quesadilla.
Serve warm.

name: Cherry Tomato Salad
ingredients: 1/2 cup chicken strips, cooked in butter
3 cups cherry tomatoes, halved if large
instructions: If adding chicken, slice the chicken in strips. Season with salt and pepper. Fry in  skillet with butter. Set aside.
Slice the cherry tomatoes in half (if large). Place them in a large bowl and season with salt and pepper.
In another bowl, whisk the buttermilk, sour cream, shallot/onion and garlic. Season with pepper.
Add the cooked chicken strips.
Drizzle the dressing over the tomatoes and toss.
Season with basil.

name: Chicken Sandwich
ingredients: 1 large chicken breast or 3 cups, cooked and finely shredded
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except bread.
Mix well.
Chill several hours.
Line slice bread with lettuce.
Top each with chicken mixture and top with another slice bread.
Serve and enjoy :)

name: Chinese Green Beans
ingredients: 1 tbsp peanut oil or 1 tbsp sesame oil
instructions: Heat peanut oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Saute' in the garlic.
Add the green beans; cook and stir until the green beans begin to soften, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the sugar, oyster sauce, and soy sauce.
Continue cooking and stirring for several minutes until the beans have attained the desired degree of tenderness.

name: Corned Beef Empanada
instructions: You can potatoes in your corned beef if you like. Pan fry the potatoes first before sauteing the corned beef then add the fried potatoes before adding salt and pepper.
Left over corned beef can also be paired with garlic rice and fried eggs.  Best served for breakfast.
Also, to use them all up, you can make 2 more batch of the crust.
For Fried Empanada,  do not overcrowd the pan. Fry 3-4 small empanada so the oil temperature doesn't drop. Overcrowding will make the empanada oily and you don not want that in your pastry.

name: Corn Maja
ingredients: 1/2 cup sugar or more if you prefer it sweet.
Grated Cheese for topping or LATIK
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a pot.
Make sure every ingredients are well combined.
Turn on to low heat.
Continue stirring until it becomes thick and when it comes to a point that it is hard to mix or stir.
Transfer to a serving container.
Top with grated cheese or LATIK.
Let the temperature cool down.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or serve right away.
Enjoy!

name: Corn on the Cob
ingredients: Corn on the cob, yellow or white​
instructions: Shuck fresh corn.
Wrap each corn in damp cloth or damp paper towel.
Microwave for 3 minutes per ear of corn. (For 2 ears, 6 minutes.)
(You can also boil the corn for 5 minutes).
Remove from microwave and open carefully. Be careful with the steam.
Top with margarine, paprika, salt and pepper.
Enjoy!

name: Cream Cheese
instructions: In a medium saucepan. Bring water to a boil.
Set the heat to medium then add powdered milk. Stir until milk has fully dissolved.
Bring to a low simmer.
Add vinegar one at a time until milk curdles.
Remove from heat then transfer the mixture through a cheesecloth with strainer and bowl underneath.
Let it rest for about 10-15 minutes or until liquid has been fully drained. Do not squeeze.
Transfer the curdled milk to a blender or food processor then blend for about 1 minute. Add salt and continue blending until smooth.
If mixture is too dry, add some whey (liquid from the mixture), about 1 tsp at a time. Since I did not squeeze my cheese, I didn't add any whey.
Now, you can use this when making any recipes that require cream cheese.
This recipe yields about 3/4 cup cream cheese.

name: Creamy Corn Maja
instructions: Do not use coconut milk when making latik especially using the canned one. Some brands have added water that it won't produce the latik that you like. Please use coconut cream. It is much thicker and makes a lot. I akways use 15 oz can MaePloy brand. Arroy D is also another brand that I suggest if Maeploy is not available.
A lot of stirring is required to make the mixture thick. If you stop stirring, some mixture will harden at the bottom and will stick. Make sure that the heat is on medium-low to avoid burning.
You can also add another 1/2 can of coconut cream of whole corn if you like.

Sugar can always be adjusted according to you preference.  I remember the first time I made this using whole milk, I sued 1/2 cup of sugar. This time I used 2% milk and added 3/4 cup. They both work well.
​Store in the refrigerator and consume within 3-5 days. A small slice can be warmed up in the microwave for about 20-30 seconds.

name: Crispy Cheese Dog Bread Rolls
instructions: ​Slice hot dogs and cheese in half. Set aside.
Trim edges of slice bread and flatten with a rolling pin.
Spread the flattened bread with a thin layer of condensed milk.
Add the cheese and hot dog. Fold and roll tightly.
In a medium bowl, beat eggs.
Dip each rolled breads in beaten eggs until evenly coated.
Roll in breadcrumbs.
Heat cooking oil in a pan. I suggest to deep fry the bread rolls and not pan-fry. (Please read my blog above about the difference between the two).
Deep fry until all sides are crispy and golden.
Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve while warm.
Enjoy.

name: Crispy Fried Dilis (Smelt)
instructions: Rub salt and garlic powder all over the smelts. Let it stay for 10 minutes.
Combine flour, cornstarch and ground pepper. Mix well.
Coat fish with flour mixture.
In a pan, heat cooking oil.
Fry in medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes or until it turns crispy.
Remove fish from heat and drain excess cooking oil.
Place in a serving plate and serve hot with spiced vinegar for dipping.

name: Crispy Maruya Balls
instructions: Combine batter ingredients. Mix until well combined.
Scoop about 1 tbsp mixture and roll into flour.
Flatten to make round shape and add the filling in the middle.
Gather the sides together and seal. Coat again with flour.
Coat with beaten egg then roll in bread crumbs.
Fry until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels.
Sprinkle with some powdered sugar if desired.
Serve immediately.
Enjoy.

name: Crispy Peach Mango Pie
ingredients: 1 cup mangoes, cut into small cubes (about 1 large mango)
1 cup peaches, cubed, fresh or from 1 can, syrup drained
instructions: In a medium pan, combine mangoes and peaches. Cook over medium heat for about 8-10 minutes or until juice comes out.
Stir-in sugar and continue cooking until soft and slightly mushy and has caramelized.
In a small bowl, combine cornstarch and water. Add to the mixture and cook for another minute of two or until mixture is thick. Remove from heat and cool completely.
Trim edges of sliced bread. Flatten with a rolling pin.
Brush all sides of flattened bread with beaten egg.
Add about 1 1/2 - 2 tbsp peach mango filling. Roll and seal sides using a fork.
Dip in beaten eggs until evenly coated.
Roll in breadcrumbs.
Heat cooking oil in a pan.
Fry until all sides are crispy and golden.
Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve while warm. Enjoy.
Recipe yields about 12-15 pies.

name: Crispy Tuna Pie
instructions: Trim edges of sliced breads. Flatten with a rolling pin.
In a small bowl, combine tuna, salt, pepper, mayonnaise, carrots, pickle relish and shredded cheese.
In another bowl, beat eggs.
Brush all sides of flattened bread with egg.
Add desired amount of tuna filling. Roll and seal sides using a fork.
Dip in beaten eggs until evenly coated.
Roll in breadcrumbs.
Heat cooking oil in a pan.
Fry until all sides are crispy and golden.
Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve while warm.
Enjoy.

name: Crunchy Egg Fingers
instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, salt and pepper. Do not overbeat.
Grease a square pan or container. I used a 6 x 6 glass container.
Transfer the mixture into the prepared pan.
Steam for 15-20 minutes or until firm.
Let it cool and slice into serving size. I divided mine into 16 servings.
Prepare flour, beaten egg and bread crumbs in different containers.
Coat with flour, dip on beaten egg and roll in bread crumbs.
Fry until golden about 1 1/2 to 2 minutes. Drain on paper towels.
Serve  immediately with ketchup or any dipping sauce you prefer.
Enjoy.

name: Crunchy Hot Dog Rolls
instructions: Pat dry the hot dogs and insert wooden skewers on each hot dog. Set aside.
In a medium bowl, combine pancake mix, egg, oil and water.
Transfer the batter to a tall glass and dip the hot dogs on a stick into the batter until well coated, then roll it into bread crumbs.
Preheat oil in a deep saucepan over medium heat. Fry 2 to 3 hot dogs at a time until golden brown for about 2-3 minutes. Drain on paper towels.
Best served with mayonnaise, ketchup and mustard.
Enjoy!

name: Dumplings
ingredients: 1/2 lb ground beef or ground meat you prefer
2 tbsp oyster sauce, get a good brand. Some are too salty. I prefer Kikoman.
instructions: Combine all the ingredients together except the wrapper.

Wrap the meat mixture in gyoza wrapper by placing about 1 tbsp of mixture into the center of each wrapper. Using your finger, rub the edges of the wrappers with water then fold the dough over the middle and pinch while folding sides with other thumb and index finger.
If dumpling press is available, just place the wrapper on the center of the press. Add a small of filling, rub some water on the edgers then fold to press.
To cook, heat a small amount of cooking oil in a pan.
Add the dumplings in a single layer and cook for about 2-3 minutes or until golden and crisp.

name: Fish Ball Sauce
ingredients: 1 tsp hot sauce or siling labuyo (optional) ​
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a saucepan.
Cook over low heat while stirring continuously until thick.
Transfer to a bowl or tall bottle.
Heat cooking oil in a pan.
Fry the fish balls until golden.
Drizzle fish balls with sauce or use a skewer.
Enjoy your delicious homemade sauce.

name: Fish Tacos
ingredients: 1/2 lb tilapia fillet, cut into 1-inch piece
instructions: Juice 2 of the limes into a bowl.
Stir mayonnaise and chili powder into juice.
Transfer half of the sauce to another bowl; toss fish in it.
Set aside remaining sauce.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
In a shallow dish combine flour and salt.
Toss fish in flour mixture.
Fry the breaded fish for about 3 minutes or until fish flakes easily.
Drain fish on paper towels.
Warm the tortillas in paper towels by heating in microwave for 30 secs.
Top tortillas with fish, cabbage and carrots.
Drizzle with remaining lime sauce.
Enjoy your fish tacos!

name: Fish Tacos
ingredients: 1-2 slices fish fillet, sliced into bite small pieces
instructions: Combine egg, water and salt. Set aside.

name: Fresh Shrimp Spring Rolls
ingredients: 9-18 pieces cooked shrimps, peeled, deveined and sliced in half lengthwise.
1 cucumber, seeded and sliced into 2 inches length
2-3 bundles vermicelli noodles, cooked according to packaging directions
instructions: In a small bowl, combine all ingredients except peanut butter and peanuts. Stir until sugar is fully dissolved.
Add peanut butter and mix until mixture is smooth.
Top with chopped peanuts. Add more if desired.

name: Fried Tofu
ingredients: 1 package firm or extra firm tofu
cornstarch or all purple flour for coating
instructions: Open your package of tofu, drain, and squeeze out as much moisture as possible.
Cut the tofu into uniform chunks.
Dredge your tofu pieces lightly in corn starch, making sure to dust off any excess.
Heat cooking oil in a deep pan.
Fry the tofu until light brown.
Remove "done" pieces to drain on a paper towel.
Serve while hot and crispy!

name: Garlic Bokchoy​
ingredients: 5-6 bundles baby bok choy (chinese cabbage), hard part trimmed
instructions: Wash the bok choy and arrange them on the steamer.
Steam for 10 minutes or until the leaves turn dark green in color and the stems look transparent but still slightly crunchy.
Transfer the bok choy to a serving plate.

name: Garlic Green Beans
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil to blanch the green beans.
When the water comes to a boil add the green beans and let simmer for about 2 minutes.
Rinse under cold water to stop the cooking.
Drain and set aside.
​In large skillet, saute' garlic in butter.
Add the green beans, salt and pepper.
Cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes while stirring occasionally.
Serve with your favorite fish or meat.
Enjoy.

name: Ginataang Bayabas
ingredients: 5-7 small - medium ripe but firm guavas, sliced and seeded (makes about 3 cups)
instructions: Heat coconut milk in a sauce pan.
Add sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Add sliced guava and salt.
Stir and cover. Let it boil.
Cook until guavas are soft.
Remove from heat.
Add coconut cream
Add sago/tapioca pearls (optional)
Serve and enjoy.

name: Grilled Jumbo Shrimps
ingredients: 1 lb jumbo shrimps, head off, deveined
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl.
Marinate the shrimps.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes to 1 hour.
Preheat a gas grill on medium to high heat.
Grill for about 3 minutes on each side or until cook throughout.
Serve immediately.
Enjoy!​​

name: Hawaiian Quesadilla
ingredients: 12 pieces or more cooked ham, cooked, sliced (I used thin round honey ham)
1/2 cup or more shredded cheddar cheese
instructions: Arrange ham on half of each tortilla.
​Sprinkles with cheddar cheese.
Add pineapple tidbits.
Sprinkles with mozzarella cheese.
Fold each tortilla in half to create a "half  moon" and press lightly.
Heat a skillet  or nonstick pan over low-medium heat. You can spray or coat with oil if you like but I prefer without.
Lightly brown each quesadilla for 2-3 minutes per side or until cheese is melted.
Repeat with remaining quesadilla.
Cut into wedges or serve as it is.
Enjoy.

name: Kwek-Kwek
ingredients: 1/4 tsp annatto powder + 1/4 cup warm water
instructions: 1/2 cup vinegar, (best if we use apple cider)
2 tbsp water
1 tsp sugar
1/4 tsp salt or more
1/8 teaspoon pepper
1/2 of small red onion, diced

name: Kutsinta
ingredients: 3/4 cup brown sugar (add 1/4 cup if you prefer it sweet)
​Annatto extract: 2 tsp Atsuete or annato seeds & 3 tsp hot water
instructions: Add just enough water in the steamer (about 1 inch height inch from the rim).
Make sure the water in the steamer is boiling when adding the individual molds with mixture into the steamer.
Steam on medium heat.
Do not over steam. A very small amount of liquid on top is fine. You can discard that extra small amount of water. Over steaming makes the Kutsinta hard and firm at the bottom.
Unmold with a knife with a round tip that is brushed with butter to avoid sticking.
Do not add grated coconut on top if you will not consume them right away.
Grated coconut must be stored in the fridge.
Left over Kutsinta can be stored at room temperature for up 2 days or you can refrigerate and warm them up.
Recipe yields 13 pieces.

name: Lemon Pepper Wings
instructions: Boil wings in a large pot of water for about 12-15 minutes.
While wings boil, mix lemon juice, pepper, and olive oil in a separate large bowl.
After boiling remove wings from water and toss them in with lemon mixture. Make sure to thoroughly coat wings.
Place wing in a pan lined with foil and sprinkle both sides with lemon pepper seasoning salt to suit taste.
Broil wings in oven for about 5-10 minutes per side (depending on your oven) until nicely browned and crisp.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Lettuce Wrap
ingredients: 1 lb ground beef, pork or chicken
green, red, yellow bell pepper, strips
instructions: Saute garlic in heated cooking oil.
Add onions and cook until translucent.
Add ground meat. Cook until tender.
Add soy sauce, stir and cook for few minutes. Add ground pepper.
Add the bell pepper and chili pepper.
Remove from heat.
Spoon onto lettuce leaves.
Roll up tightly.
Enjoy! ​

name: Lumpiang Gulay
ingredients: 1/2 cup green beans, cut into 1/2" length
instructions: Saute garlic and onion.
Add the pork strips. Cook until color turns light brown.
Add the green beans and carrots and bean sprouts. Cook for 3-5 minutes.
Add salt to taste. Remove from heat. Cool down before wrapping.
Prepare the spring roll / lumpia wrapper.
Spoon about 2 tbsp of filling near one corner of each wrapper. Fold the sides and tuck both ends and roll. Brush ends with water and seal.
Deep fry until all sides are golden brown.
Serve immediately.
​Enjoy!

name: Lumpiang Shanghai (Spring Roll)
instructions: Combine all ingredients together except the wrapper. Blend well.
Wrap the meat using the spring roll / lumpia wrapper.
Spoon about 2 tbsp of filling near one corner of each wrapper. Fold the sides and tuck both ends and roll. Brush ends with water and seal.
Deep fry until all sides are golden brown.
Serve with sweet and sour sauce.
Enjoy!

name: Lumpiang Sariwa
ingredients: 1/2 lb pork (belly, butt or shoulder), cut into thin strips
1/2 cup green beans (Baguio beans), sliced diagonally
3/4 cup extra firm tofu, sliced into thin strips
ground or crushed peanuts for garnishing
instructions: In a medium bowl, Whisk eggs. Add water and oil. Whisk or beat until combined.
Add flour, cornstarch and salt. Whisk or beat until mixture is well incorporated. Strain mixture through a sieve to make a smooth batter.
Prepare a pan lightly greased with oil.
Pour about 1/3 cup mixture in the middle. Lift the pan while pouring and swirl the pan to spread the batter thinly and evenly. Cook over low heat until mixture is dry, about 2 minutes.

name: Lumpiang Togue
ingredients: 1/2 lb pork belly, sliced into strips or diced
spring roll wrappers, separate into individual sheets
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a pan or skillet.
Saute' garlic then add onion. Cook until onion is translucent.
Add pork and cook until lightly browned.
Season with fish sauce and cook for 1 minute.
Add water and simmer for about 5-7 minutes or until pork is tender.
Add carrots and green beans. Cook for about 3 minutes or until half cooked.
Add bean sprouts and cook for another 1 minute.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Remove from pan and cool completely before wrapping.
Lay wrapper (diamond shaped) and spoon vegetable filling into the wrapper.
Fold the sides, tuck both ends inward and roll tightly into a log.
Brush the pointed edge with water and seal.
Deep fry until golden and crispy.
Drain on paper towels or wire rack.
Serve with vinegar sauce.
Enjoy.

name: Mixed Green Chicken Salad
ingredients: Seasoned chicken breast, grilled or boiled
instructions: Combine all ingredients together.
Add your favorite salad dressing.
I used Raspberry Balsamic Vinaigrette for the dressing.
You can always play with your salad and add any kind of greens and toppings you like.
Enjoy your healthy meal! ​​

name: Monte Cristo Sandwich
instructions: Whisk together egg and water.
Sift flour, baking powder and sugar and whisk into the egg mixture. Set aside in the refrigerator.
Top a slice bread bread ham, cheese and another piece of ham the top with 1 more slice of bread.
Cut sandwiches in half and put in a toothpick to hold the sandwich together.
Heat cooking oil in a deep pan.
Take the batter out of the fridge and dunk the quartered pieces into the batter. Make sure to evenly coat the sandwich with batter.
Deep fry the coated sandwich until golden.
Drain on paper towels.
Dust with powdered sugar.
Serve immediately.
Enjoy.

name: Parmesan Roasted Brussels Sprouts
ingredients: 1 pound brussels sprouts, trimmed and sliced in half
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 F.
Add all your the half and trimmed sprouts in a bowl.
Season them with olive oil, parmesan cheese, garlic salt and pepper.
Toss them really well and spread on your prepared baking sheet or roasting pan lined with foil.  (Tip: Foil for easy clean up :)
Place them in a one single layer.
Roast about 20-25 minutes or until browned but not charred.​
This recipe is done in few minutes and it tastes delicious!
If you have tried this recipe or if you have questions about this recipe, please write a comment below. You can also try my other recipes suggested below or click here for a quick recipe guide.
Thank you and enjoy this recipe.

name: Paradadas / Corned Beef Pandesal
ingredients: 3/4 cup corned beef ( I used Palm brand)
instructions: Whisk the egg. Set aside.
Heat a very small amount of cooking oil in a pan.
Saute onion.
Add corned beef.
Cook for 3-5 minutes.
Remove from pan.
Fill the pandesal with corned beef.
Coat in scrambled egg.
In a another pan, heat a very small amount of cooking oil.
Fry the coated pandesal turning each side until egg is cooked.
Remove from the pan.
Drain on paper towel to remove excess excess oil.
Serve warm. Enjoy! ​

name: Pork and Crab Siomai
ingredients: 250 grams crab sticks meat, about 3 to 3 1/2 cups when chopped
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Scoop about 1 tbsp of mixture, shape like a ball, dip in egg and roll in siomai wrapper until fully covered.
Grease the steamer pan lightly with oil to avoid sticking.
Steam for 15-20 minutes.
Serve with dipping sauce.

name: Pork Siomai
instructions: Combine all the ingredients together except the wrapper.
Wrap the meat in wanton wrapper by placing about 1 tbsp of meat in the center of the wrapper then press all the sides to the middle leaving an open space on top.  (See pictures)
Place all the wrapped meat in the steamer.
Steam for 20-25 minutes.
Serve with dipping sauce.
Serve while warm.
You can also deep fry your Siomai until golden brown. Please see photo below :)
Enjoy!​

name: Potstickers
ingredients: 1/2 lb ground beef or ground meat you prefer
instructions: Mix salt with flour and then add water.
Knead for 6-8 minutes or until smooth.
Shape to a round ball, covered and set aside to rest for 1 hour or longer time.
Shape it into a large circle. Cut the circle in halves and shape each half into a long log around 3cm in diameter.
Then divide the long log into small dumpling dough pieces.
Dust with cornstarch so they will not stick together.
Press each dough into a round disc.
Use a rolling pin to create a round shape. (Rotate the wrapper when moving your rolling pin).
Repeat the same process with the other dough slices.

name: Puff Dougnuts (No Yeast)
ingredients: 1/8 tsp or a pinch of salt
canola or vegetable oil for frying
instructions: In a sauce pan, add water, butter and sugar. Stir to combine. Turn on heat to medium and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add the flour. Stir until mixture forms a dough. Transfer to a bowl and let cool. To speed up the process, you can use a hand mixer beat on low or constantly stir with a spatula.
Once the dough has completely cooled down, add eggs one a time, beating well after each addition.
Add lemon juice and salt. Beat until batter is smooth.
Drop a teaspoonful full or 1/2 tbsp of batter into hot oil over medium-high heat with oil's temperature about 375 F. (Doughnuts will double in size while frying).
Deep-fry until all sides and lightly browned.
Drain on paper towels.
Roll in sugar.
Serve immediately.
Enjoy.

name: Puto Cheese Muffins
ingredients: cheese for toppings, slice or grated
instructions: Combine all the dry ingredients in a large bowl.
Add the wet ingredients. Stir until fully incorporated.
Pour over cupcake molds lined with baking cupcake liners. (about 3/4 full).
Add sliced or grated cheese on top (before or in between steaming time). Please see below for added tips.
Steam for  about 12 minutes or until toothpick inserted  in the middle comes out clean.
Remove from steamer and let it cool.
Serve and enjoy with coffee or tea.
Enjoy.

name: Puto Flan
instructions: Recipe yields about 24-28 pieces Puto Flan .
I used a large Puto Molds (3 inches / #308).
Do not grease the entire mold. Only grease about 1/3 of the mold where you will fill with the flan. Your Puto cake may deflate if you grease the upper sides of the molds.
After steaming the flan. I also tried adding the cake batter immediately and it still worked fine. So, you can wait for few minutes or add it right away.  It's up to you or whatever works for you.
I hope these tips help! Enjoy!

name: Putong Bigas
ingredients: Special Puto Cupcakes with Salted Egg
instructions: Rinse the rice with water until water runs clear. Add water and soak the rice for at least 6 hours or overnight.
Drain the water and reserve 1 cup.

Transfer the soaked rice to a blender. Add 1 cup reserved water and 1/4 cup sugar. Blend for about 3-5 minutes. Scrape the sides of the blender then add the cooked rice (leftover cold rice). Continue blending until mixture is smooth.
Pass through a sieve then strain.
Add 3/4 cup sugar and salt. Stir until sugar and salt are fully dissolved.
Add baking powder and mix until just combined. Do not over mix.
Rest the batter for 15-30 minutes.
Heat water in a steamer. Prepare the molds by lightly greasing with oil or butter.
Fill the molds with batter about 3/4 full. Transfer the cups with batter in a steamer pan.

Steam for about 20-22 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the center comes out almost clean. (Some dry crumbs are normal.) - Make sure the steamer lid is covered with a cloth to avoid water dripping from the lid.
You can remove them immediately from molds or let cool first. It's up to you.
Top with grated cheese or serve with fresh grated coconut if you like.
Recipe yields about 20 pieces.

name: Puto with Cheese
instructions: Do not skip the step of straining the batter. Straining will give you a smooth texture.
Do not grease the molds. The grease will let the mixture slide off the sides of the mold which results to  uneven shape and flat top.
Only add 1-2 inches of water in the pot and make sure to boil the water first before placing the puto in the steamer  then start the time from there.
Steaming over medium-low heat  produces the best result. Turn the dial to #2 or #3.
Make sure to cover the lid with cloth to avoid water drip and ensure that the lid is air-tight to avoid the steam from escaping the steamer.
Avoid constantly opening the steamer. You can check 5 minutes before the set time. Test one and see if you can easily remove from the mold.
I hope these tips help. Enjoy! :)

name: Puto Pizza
instructions: Prepare  individual cupcake or muffins pans or puto molds and line with cupcake liners.
Fill 1/2 of the mold with puto batter. Add ham, cheese and pineapple then fill with puto batter again up to 2/3 full. Add  a small amount of pizza sauce, ham, cheese, pineapple and bell pepper.
Place a cheesecloth in the steamer lid to avoid water drips.
Steam for 10-12 minutes. Do not over steam.
Muffin is ready when toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Roasted Carros & Peppers
ingredients: 6-8 pieces Sweet Baby Bell Peppers or 2 large Bell Peppers, cut into strips
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F.
Prepare a sheet pan lined with foil or a baking dish large enough to fit all of the carrots and peppers in a single layer.
Place carrots and bell peppers in a large bowl.
Toss with olive oil, salt, pepper, & thyme.
Spread an even layer of your vegetables in the prepared pan or baking dish.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Serve and enjoy! ​

name: Roasted Vegetables
ingredients: 3-4 cups Vegetables of your choice, sliced  (cauliflowers, carrots, bell peppers)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F.
Prepare a sheet pan lined with foil or a baking dish large enough to fit all the vegetables in a single layer.
Place veggies n a large mixing bowl.
Toss with olive oil, salt, pepper, rosemary & thyme.
Spread an even layer of your vegetables in the prepared pan or baking dish.
Bake for 20-30 minutes.
Serve and enjoy! ​

name: Salmon Spread
instructions: Drain water from the salmon in can.
Mix all ingredients in a small bowl.
Best eaten with crackers.
Top your crackers with prepared salmon spread.
Add mint leaf. (optional)
Serve with your favorite drinks.
This is perfect for wine or cocktail.​

name: Special Puto (Filipino Muffins)
ingredients: cheese for topping and or salted egg for topping
instructions: Beat the egg whites and cream of tartar. Beat until it foams up.
Gradually add sugar (1/4 cup) and beat until stiff.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, sugar (1/2 cup), baking powder and water.

Carefully fold-in the egg white mixture to the flour mixture. ( "Folding" is a more gentle mixing technique than "stirring" and "mixing". Carefully cut through the mixture with the edge of a rubber spatula, working in a gentle figure of eight and moving the bowl as you go.)
Transfer the batter to muffin pans or molds lined with cupcake liner and fill up to 2/3 full.
Add cheese and/or salted egg on top.
Place a cheesecloth in the steamer lid to avoid water drips.
Steam for 10-12 minutes. Do not over steam.
Muffin is ready when toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Special Puto Sponge Cake
ingredients: grated cheddar cheese and salted egg for topping
instructions: Beat the egg whites until frothy.
Add cream of tartar and beat until it foams up.
Gradually add sugar (1/4 cup) and beat until stiff. Set aside.
In a separate bowl, sift together flour, sugar (1/2 cup), baking powder and salt.
Add water and stir until smooth.

Carefully fold-in the egg white mixture (meringue) to the flour mixture. ( "Folding" is a more gentle mixing technique than "stirring" and "mixing". Carefully cut through the mixture with the edge of a rubber spatula, working in a gentle figure of eight.)
Transfer the batter to an 8" pan lined with ungreased parchment paper.
Add grated cheese and salted egg on top.
Prepare the steamer by boiling the water. Place the cake pan on the steamer pan. Wrap the steamer lid with clean cloth to avoid water drips
Steam over medium heat for 18-20 minutes. Do not over-steam. Cake is ready when toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Slice, serve and enjoy.

name: Special Puto Pandan Cake
ingredients: 1/2 tsp or more buko pandan flavor
instructions: As mentioned above, you can use plain water or make your own pandan water. Just adjust the pandan flavor if you are not  using pandan leaf.
I used Eden brand for the grated cheese.

Make sure not to overmix the cake and follow the folding technique. ("Folding" is a more gentle mixing technique than "stirring" and "mixing". Carefully cut through the mixture with the edge of a rubber spatula, working in a gentle figure of eight.). Overmixing will cause the cake to deflate or your cake will be too heavy or compact. ​

​After steaming, let cool for few minutes, remove from pan, peel off the parchment paper and transfer to a wire rack. If you leave it in the pan, the bottom will be soaking wet and you do not want that.

name: Spicy Chicken Wings
ingredients: 1 tbsp siling labuyo (cayenne or chili pepper), chopped
instructions: Combine the first 5 ingredients in a pot. Boil for 15 minutes.
Remove the chicken wings from water and transfer to a lightly greased oven safe container.
Bake wings on BROIL for 15-20 minutes turning once.
Combine hot sauce and margarine. Microwave for 2 minutes or until margarine is melted. Stir.
Remove the chicken wings from the oven.
Pour-in the hot sauce mix over the chicken.
Transfer to a serving plate.
Enjoy your Spicy Chicken Wings!​

name: Strawberry French Toast Roll Ups
ingredients: 3-4 pieces strawberries, cut into small cubes
2 tsp powdered sugar + more for dusting
instructions: In a small bowl, combine cream cheese and powdered sugar.
In  another bowl, stir together strawberries and granulated sugar.
Trim edges of sliced breads and flatten with a rolling pin. (You can also use anything round like a wine bottle or glass container to use as a rolling pin.)
Spread the flattened bread with desired amount of cream cheese.  Scoop about 1 tbsp of sweetened strawberries. Fold and seal to make a roll.
In a medium bowl, make an egg wash. Combine egg, milk and cinnamon. Stir to combine. Dip the roll into the egg wash.
In a frying pan, heat 1- to 2 tbsp butter . Fry the rolls until sides are golden. Drain on paper towels.
Dust with powdered sugar if desired. Best served when warm.
Recipe yields 6-8 Strawberry French Toasts.
Enjoy.

name: Suman Cassava
ingredients: 3 cups grated cassava ( I used frozen grated cassava)
instructions: Mix all the ingredients together until well combined.
Scoop about 3-4 tbsp of the mixture and place it on top of the banana leaves.
Fold or roll to enclose the mixture then fold each end.
Transfer the wrapped mixture into the steamer.
Steam for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

name: Suman Cassava with Macapuno
ingredients: 3 cups grated cassava, I used frozen 2 packs of (16 oz each), thawed and drained
banana leaves (for wrapping), cut into about 8 x 6 inches
instructions: Mix all the ingredients together until well combined.
Wash the banana leaves with water and pat dry. Make the banana leaf pliable by passing them lightly on top of your stove with low flame. Cut the leaves into 6 x 8 ".
Scoop about 4 tbsp or 1/4 cup of the mixture and place it on top of the banana leaves.
Fold or roll to enclose the mixture then fold each end.
Transfer the wrapped mixture into the steamer with about 1 inch high of boiling water.
Steam for 45 minutes.
Recipe yields 12-18 pieces.
Serve warm or cold.
​Enjoy.

name: Taho
ingredients: 1 package silken tofu or extra soft tofu
instructions: Transfer the tofu in glass, cup or bowl. Microwave the extra soft tofu for 1 - 1 1/2 minutes.
Remove from the microwave.
Add enough arnibal to sweeten. Add sago and lightly stir.
Serve warm.
Enjoy!  ​

name: Tofu & Kangkong in Oyster Sauce
ingredients: 1 14oz or 16oz pack of Tofu, firm or extra firm
3 tablespoons oyster sauce (add more depending on your taste)
instructions: Pressing the tofu holds its shape
Pressing avoids soggy and produces extra crispy tofu when fried
Bubbles form around the wooden spoon when oil is ready for frying
Do not let the oil reach smoking point as this produces an off burnt taste on whatever you are frying
To avoid burns from hot oil, always throw in whatever you are frying with a gentle, slow and outward toss of hand so that the oil splatters away from you.
Do not flip the tofu immediately when frying as the tofu might stick and break your tofu. Wait for it to brown and crisp before flipping.
Paper towels absorb excess oil well.

name: Tuna Avocado Lettuce Wrap
ingredients: 1 can , 5 oz tuna in water, fully drained
2 tbsp mayonnaise, (light mayo can be used)
instructions: In a small bowl, combine avocado, cilantro and lemon juice.  Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir until fully incorporated.
In another bowl, combine drained tuna, carrots, cucumber, mayonnaise and pickle relish. Add the avocado mixture and stir until just combined.
Arrange fresh lettuce on a plate and scoop desired amount of tuna salad.
Lettuce can be rolled if desired.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Tuna Lumpia
ingredients: 1/4 tsp white or black ground pepper
beaten egg or water for sealing edges
instructions: I suggest to seal the edges using beaten egg. It seals better than just using water. This will prevent the rolls opening while frying. If egg is not available, use water but make sure that edges are sealed and rest on it's seam after rolling.

Make sure that the oil is hot enough before dropping the lumpia. Use a food thermometer. Temperature must be around 375 F. A wooden chopstick or wooden cooking utensil can also be used to check if bubbles start to form around it.  If oil's temperature is not hot enough, the lumpia will absorb too much oil.
Do not overcrowd the pan when frying or else the oil's temperature will drop and again, the lumpia will absorb so much oil.
Make sure to cover the lumpia wrapper  and the lumpia you just rolled with moist towel or plastic wrap to retain moisture.

name: Tuna Sandwich
ingredients: 2 cans (5 oz.) Chunk or Albacore tuna, drained
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except bread.
Mix well.
Chill several hours.
Line 4 slices bread with lettuce.
Top each with 1/4 tuna mixture and top with remaining bread.
​Enjoy :)

name: Ube Hopia
instructions: ​Gather all sides and seal.
Place the dough into a round cookie cutter.
Press to shape by using your fingers or palm of your hand.
Remove from the cookie cutter and transfer to a tray lined with parchment paper.
Brush with egg wash.
Bake at 400 F for about 15-20 minutes or until top is golden.
Remove from oven.
Serve warm.
Enjoy.

name: Ube Maja
ingredients: 3/4 cup ube jam/ halaya - store bought or homemade
instructions: In  a large mixing bowl, combine cream corn, evaporated  milk, coconut milk, condensed milk, fresh milk and cornstarch. Stir until cornstarch is dissolved.  Mixture makes about 7 1/2  cups.
Pour 4 cups of mixture into a large pan. Cook over low heat. Stir until mixture becomes thick and hard to stir. Remove from pan and transfer to a pan or tray.

Using a another large pan, combine the rest of the mixture (about 3 1/2 cups), ube jam/ halaya and ube extract. Stir until mixture becomes thick and hard to stir. Transfer mixture on top of the first maja.
Smooth the top with a spatula greased with oil. Cool the mixture for few minutes.
Top with grated cheese.
Can be served warm or cold.

name: Ube Puto with Cheese
ingredients: Ube Graham de Leche in a Cup
instructions: Grease puto molds or line with paper cups.
Prepare the steamer by bringing water to a boil over medium heat.
​In a medium bowl, stir together pancake mix and sugar. Set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla extract and butter.
Gradually add the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients. Stir until fully incorporated.
Stir-in ube jam and ube extract.
Pour or fill the mixture in the prepared molds (at least 2/3) and top with sliced cheese.
Place the molds into a steamer.
Cover the top withcheesecloth to avoid water drips.
Steam for 15 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Best served when warm. ​

name: Ukoy/Okoy
ingredients: 1 cup small  or medium shrimps (cleaned, whiskers trimmed off)
instructions: In a bowl, combine cornstarch, water, eggs, salt and pepper.
Add onion, togue, sweet potato strips, carrot strips and shrimps. Blend well.
Heat the oil in a frying pan.
When hot, drop about 3 tbsp of the mixture into the hot oil and fry over medium heat until crisp and both sides are brown.
Remove from the pan and drain on paper towels.
Serve with garlic vinegar sauce.
Serve hot & crispy.
Don't forget the rice.
Enjoy!

name: Vietnamese Spring Rolls
ingredients: 30-35 pieces cooked shrimps, peeled, deveined and sliced in half lengthwise.
cucumber, seeded and sliced into 2 inches length
vermicelli noodles, cooked according to packaging direction   (I cooked 3 bundles of noodles using the brand below)
Sweetened chili sauce or sweet and sour sauce for dipping
instructions: Take one piece of rice paper at a time.
Dip it into warm water for 5 seconds.
Place it on a plate.
Add ingredients. Please see photo above.
Wrap it up to roll.
Serve with dipping sauce.

name: Almond Jelly
ingredients: 28 grams unflavored gelatin powder ( I used Knox)
30 oz can fruit cocktail in syrup
instructions: Combine 1 cup water and gelatin powder. Stir until powder is dissolved. Set aside. Note: I used Knox gelatin. The mixture turned into solid and that's ok.
In a large saucepan,  combine 2 cups water and sugar. Stir until sugar is fully dissolved. Cook over medium and bring to a light boil.
Lower heat and add dissolved gelatin. Stir until gelatin is fully dissolved. You can bring the heat to medium and bring again to a light boil. Remove from heat.
Slowly add milk and almond extract while stirring until well incorporated.

Pour the mixture into a large glass pan or pans. I didn't fill the pan fully but instead used two pans and only filled up to an inch high. Let the mixture cool completely. Refrigerate to set then cut into small cubes.
Transfer all the almond jelly cubes into a large bowl and add the whole can of fruit cocktail with syrup. Stir until combined.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Avocado Ice Cream
ingredients: 3-4 ripe avocados, peeled and pitted, about 2 1/2 cups when sliced
2  (12.8- ounce) cans table cream / all purpose cream or 2 1/2 cups heavy whipping cream, chilled
instructions: Add avocados and lemon juice into a blender. Blend until completely smooth. (If a blender is not available, you can mash the avocado with a fork and add the lemon juice and mix until really smooth.)
In a large mixing bowl, add the cream. Whip on medium-high speed until thick.
Add the condensed milk and whip together.
Add the pureed avocado mixture and beat just until just combined then gently fold together with a rubber spatula until completely combined and there are no white streaks.
Pour the ice cream mixture into a standard loaf pan, cover with plastic wrap, press against the ice cream and freeze until completely firm, about 6 hours.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Banana Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: In a large bowl, beat the butter on high speed until creamy.
Add granulated sugar and beat until light and fluffy.
Add brown sugar. Beat until fully combined.
Add mashed bananas. Beat until light and fluffy.
Place a sieve over the bowl and add flour, baking soda, cornstarch, and salt. Sift and stir until just combined. Do not over-mix.
Stir-in semi-sweet chocolate chips.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Scoop out dough (about 2 1/2 to 3 tbsp) on cookie sheet lined with parchment paper or baking mat. Use a cookie scoop for easy assembly and make sure to leave an inch space in between the cookies.
Top with more chocolate chips if desired.
Bake in a preheated oven at 375 F for 10-12 minutes or until tops start to turn light golden brown. Timing depends on the size of the cookies. Make sure to check before the set time.
Remove from oven and allow cookies to cool completely on pan. Slight deflation will happen while cooling and cookies will firm up.
Recipe makes about 24 cookies.
Store in an airtight container.
Enjoy.

name: Banana Cue
ingredients: cooking oil enough for deep frying
instructions: Preheat oil in work or frying pan.
Peel bananas.
Coat with brown sugar.
Add them into hot oil.
Add more brown sugar.
Make sure the sugar sticks to the banana by mixing them constantly.
When cooked, take them one by one and let the oil drip or you can place them on a strainer.
Serve on bar-b-q sticks with about 1-2 bananas per stick (optional)
Enjoy!​
Note: Another way of cooking is by preheating oil, add brown sugar, add peeled bananas then continue to stir until the sugar sticks to the banana. Add more sugar if desired while frying.

name: Banana Leche Flan
ingredients: 7oz or half can of 14oz condensed milk
4 large overripe bananas, about 2 cups when mashed well
instructions: When caramelizing the sugar, make sure to use a non-stick pan. Melt over medium heat while stirring occasionally. Do not over stir. Stir just enough to spread the sugar that hasn't melted. When half of the sugar has melted, lower the heat and continue caramelizing the sugar until amber in color.
Make sure to use overripe bananas.  Yes, overripe with dark spots. They are sweeter and can be mashed really well.
You can use the whole 14oz can of condensed milk if you like it sweet.
A blender can also be used to combine all the ingredients. If it foams up, make sure to remove or discard the foam before transferring to the pan.

​If you don't have a steamer, this can be baked at 375F/190C (pan placed on a larger pan with hot water, one-inch high the sides of the small pan) for about 45 minutes to 1 hour or until toothpick inserted comes out clean.

name: Banana Rhuma
ingredients: 10 pieces saba banana, sliced into 4 pieces
instructions: Wrap sliced banana in lumpia wrapper. Seal the end with water.
Heat cooking oil in a pan. Fry the wrapped bananas. Set aside.
​Melt margarine in a wok or pan.
Add langka. Cook for about 1-2 minutes.
Add cinnamon powder, banana flavor and rum. Cook for another 2 minutes.
Add pineapple juice and brown sugar. Cook until sugar caramelizes.
Add sesame seeds.
Add the fried banana rolls and toss until evenly coated.
Remove from pan.
Combine cinnamon milk powder ingredients. Dust into the cooked banana rolls.
Enjoy!

name: Black Sambo
instructions: In a large bowl, add the cocoa powder and hot water. Stir until smooth.
Add 2 more cups water, evaporated milk and condensed milk. Mix until well combined then whisk in gelatin powder until fully dissolved.
Transfer the mixture into a pot. Turn on heat to medium and cook the mixture until steaming hot (not boiling).
Remove from heat and pour in small dessert cups or containers of choice. Let It cool.
In another pot, combine water, all purpose cream, condensed milk and vanilla. Mix until well combined then add the gelatin powder. Mix until fully dissolved.

Turn on heat to medium and cook the mixture until steaming hot (not boiling).  Remove from heat and transfer  mixture to cups or containers with chocolate layer. Let it cool to set then refrigerate before serving.
Top with whipped cream if desired and dust with cocoa powder.
​Enjoy.

name: ​Creamy Black Sambo
ingredients: 4 envelopes ( 7 grams each) gelatin powder ( I used Knox)
2 small cans (225ml each) nestle table cream
instructions: If using other gelatin brand, please make sure to check the label for instructions. Gelatin brands vary on dilution requirements.
You can substitute whipping cream for the table cream. All-purpose cream may work as well, I just haven't tried.
Make sure that the 1st layer (white) has already set before pouring the 2nd layer (chocolate).

I added my 2nd layer while it's a bit warm. If you totally cool it down, it might separate  from the first layer but also do not add while it's really warm or else you will have white mixture floating on your chocolate mixture.

name: Binatog
instructions: Boil hominy in a pot until kernels burst open, (including the liquid and add 1 cup water) about 10 to 15 minutes.  When cooking with dried hominy, soak dried kernels overnight in water. Rinse, place in a pot, and cover with water. Simmer for a few hours until kernels burst open.
Drain the water and place the boiled hominy in a serving plate.
Mix the boiled white corn kernels, butter, coconut, and sugar in a bowl.
Add more sugar to taste.
Enjoy!

name: Boston Cream Doughnuts
instructions: If you are using instant yeast,  just mix it with the flour and make sure not to omit the water.
Prepare the pastry cream before making the dough or while the dough is rising. The cream needs time to cool down and placed in the fridge to set for at least 2 hours.
Adding warm milk to egg yolks when making the cream before adding to the pan ensures the eggs don't cook too quickly. This process gives a smooth and creamy custard.
I fitted my piping bag with Wilton #230 to pipe the cream. The god thing about this slim tip is you can can insert it all the way inside the doughnut.
Don't add too much milk on the glaze or it will be too runny. Start with 2 tbsp then add  1/2 tbsp at a time until desired consistency is achieved. I only added 3 tbsp.
Occasionally stir the glaze to when dipping the doughnuts make sure it doesn't thicken. If it does, 1 tsp of milk can be added to make it smooth and somewhat runny again.
Recipe yields about 20 donuts.
Dough scraps can also be used to make twisted donuts. I dint fill it with cream but just rolled them in sugar. Yes, I made twisted sugar donuts. My favorite!
Donuts are best eaten the same day. Leftover requires refrigeration.

name: Brigadeiro
ingredients: Make sure to use a non-stick pan.

Cook until thick. Do not rush. If it pulls away from the pan or if you run a spatula across the mixture and they keep separated, then that's ready. If the mixture is too soft, it won't keep its shape and will flatten a little bit.
instructions: You can omit refrigerating the mixture before rolling but I find it easier and less sticky to roll if chilled for at least an hour. Just to make it firm.

Cook until thick. Do not rush. If it pulls away from the pan or if you run a spatula across the mixture and they keep separated, then that's ready. If the mixture is too soft, it won't hold its shape.
Chocolate sprinkles is the most common candy coating to use but I highly recommend to use other colors or chopped nuts as well.
These will keep in a container at room temperature for about 3 days.
Recipe yields about 20 pieces.

name: Buchi
instructions: Mix the flour, salt and water together in a bowl. Knead together just enough to form into a dough.
Divide the ball into small pieces and shape it into a ball then flatten the middle of the dough with your thumb. Spoon 1 tablespoon of sweet red bean paste into the middle of the dough.
Wrap the dough around the bean paste. Pinch the edges together to seal and roll it until the shape is round.
Roll the shaped dough over the sesame seeds.
Heat the cooking oil in a deep pan. (350 deg F)
Fry the balls in batches in the hot oil until golden brown.
Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Buko Pandan Salad
ingredients: 2 packages (16 oz) frozen or 3 cups shredded coconut
1 1/2- 2 cups coconut gel ( nata de coco)
2 cans green gulaman jelly (store bought), sliced in cubes or use 1 piece green agar-agar (gulaman) or 25 grams green unflavored gelatin powder
1/2 tbsp (if using 1 piece agar-agar) + 1 tsp buko pandan essence
instructions: Cook small sago as instructed in the package. Set aside.
If using green gulaman in a can, remove from can and slice into cubes.

If using 1 piece agar-agar (gulaman), combine 2 3/4 cups water and 1 piece agar-agar. Soak for 30 minutes. Boil until it melts then add sugar and 1 tbsp pandan extract. Cook for 10-15 minutes. Cool to set and cut into cubes.
If using the gelatin powder, follow packaging directions. Make sure to add pandan extract for flavor.

Combine all ingredients in a bowl starting from shredded coconut (If using frozen, make sure to add the buko juice that comes in the package), gulaman, nata de coco, table cream, condensed milk & cooked sago. Mix well.
Refrigerate before serving.

name: Buko Salad
ingredients: 2 1/2- 3 cups fresh shredded coconut  or 3 (16 oz) package frozen shredded coconut, thawed
1 bottle (12 oz) kaong (sugar palm fruit in syrup), drained
1 bottle (12 oz) nata de coco ( coconut gel)
instructions: ​Drain fruit cocktail, kaong, pineapple, nata de coco and shredded coconut in a strainer. (I drained coconut because I used the frozen one).
Combine all ingredients in a big bowl. Mix until fully incorporated.
Chill for 4 hours or more.
Enjoy!
(Place in the freezer if it's not going to be served right away.)

name: Buko Salad
ingredients: 3 packages of 16 oz frozen shredded coconut, thawed
instructions: Drain fruit cocktail, kaong, pineapple, nata de coco and shredded coconut in a strainer. (I drained coconut because I used the frozen one).
Combine all ingredients in a big bowl.
Mix until fully blended.
Chill for 4 hours and serve.
Enjoy!
(Place in the freezer if it's not going to be served right away.)​

name: Butter Mochi
ingredients: 16 oz or 1 pound glutinous rice flour, about 3 2/3 cups when measured
instructions: Preheat oven to  350 F.
Grease a 9 x 13 baking pan.
In a medium bowl, stir together eggs, milk and vanilla extract. Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine glutinous rice flour, sugar and baking powder. Make a hole at the center and  pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients. Stir until full incorporated.
Add melted butter and coconut flakes. Stir to blend.
Bake for 1 hour. Remove from oven. Cool for few minutes and slice to serve.
Best served when warm.

name: Cakesicle / Cake Popsicle
ingredients: 4 oz cream cheese or buttercream frosting
instructions: I used leftover chocolate cupcakes for this recipe ang use white chocolate for the shell.

I used cream cheese instead of frosting. Why? Because the candy coating is already sweet and I find the buttercream frosting sweet as well, so I thought of mixing the cake with something light instead.
You can use baking chocolate bars, almond bark, chocolate chips or candy melts.
When unmolding, be careful to avoid cracks on the cake or hard candy shells. Do not pull the cake but push the popsicle sticks instead.

If you do not have a microwave oven, you can use a double boiler when melting the chocolate. Just boil some water in a saucepan then place a glass bowl with chocolate over the  saucepan then stir the chocolate until melted. Make sure to use a potholder when handling the glass bowl.
This recipe can produce about 12 or more Cakesicles using small silicone popscile molds.

name: Candied White Beans
ingredients: After coating with powdered sugar, place them on a tray or any container but leave them uncovered. You can eat them right away but leftovers can be allowed to air dry. It will give more ample time for the sugar to completely dry out. If you cover the container and or place them immediately in small bags, because of lack of air, the sugar will melt and the beans will become moist.

I mentioned earlier about the beans being so soft while cooking in syrup. I notice the beans after drying out and coating with powdered sugar, they will start to harden a bit. So, it is good that your beans are fully cooked. Like I said not mushy but very soft.
Make sure to watch the video attached below.
instructions: Soak beans in water overnight. Drain and rinse.
Prepare the steamer by boiling water. Add the soaked beans in steamer pan and steam for 45 minutes. Remove from steamer and set aside.
In a large pan or wok, combine water and sugar. Turn on to medium-high heat and continue stirring until sugar is completely dissolved.
Add the steamed beans. Cover and let boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 75-90 minutes or one hour and 15 minutes to one and a half hour or until beans are soft. Stir occasionally.

Turn off heat and let stand or rest in pan or wok for 10-15 minutes. Using a sieve, drain excess syrup and transfer the beans to a rack lined with paper towels. Spread the beans and let dry and cool completely.
Once completely dry, coat with powdered or icing sugar. You can use a sieve to do this for easy coating.

Once coated, they can be eaten immediately. Any leftover can be stored uncovered. This will allow the sugar to dry out more. When completely dry, you can place them in polypropylene (clear food grade bags) if desired.
If you happen to skip my blog above, I suggest to scroll up and check my tips. Enjoy!
Printable recipe below :)

name: Caramel Bars
ingredients: 1 cup powdered milk, I used Nido
1/2 cup or more crushed peanuts or cashew nuts
instructions: Preheat oven to 325 F and line a 13 x 9 pan with parchment paper lightly greased with butter.
In  large mixing bowl, prepare the dry ingredients by sifting together flour, powdered milk, sugar, salt and baking powder. Set aside.
In a medium bowl, combine the wet ingredients starting from melted butter, vanilla, eggs and condensed milk. Whisk until well combined.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir with a spatula until fully incorporated. Do not over mix.  Stir-in half of the nuts.
Transfer the batter into the prepared pan.  Use a wet spatula to spread the batter evenly.  (Wet spatula avoids sticking into the batter).
Top with the rest of the nuts. I use cashew nuts on this recipe.

Bake for 35-40 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Sides of the caramel will start to turn golden brown in color. Do not over bake.  (Always check before the set time as oven temperature varies.) Remove from oven and cool completely before slicing.
Cut into bars and enjoy.

name: Caramel Bread Pudding
instructions: In a small pan, combine sugar and water. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Turn on heat to low. Caramelize until golden in color. Transfer to a 9x 6 loaf pan or heated proof containers. Set aside.
Trim edges of bread slices. Cut into small pieces. Transfer to a blender and pulse to make crumbs.
Add evaporated milk, condensed milk, eggs and vanilla. Blend until smooth.
Strain mixture then transfer to prepared pan with caramelized sugar.
Remove air bubbles on top (optional)
Cover with foil.
Steam for 45-50 minutes or bake at 375 F for 1 hour (loaf pan placed on a roasting pan with water).
Remove from steamer or oven. Let it cool and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
Invert, tap the bottom of the pan to loosen then lift the pan.
Slice to serve.

name: Caramel Cloud Cake
instructions: Preheat oven at 300 F.
In a pot, caramelize 1/2 cup sugar over medium-low heat. Stir occasionally until sugar is fully melted and color turns amber or golden.
Transfer the caramelized sugar in a pan. I used bundt pan. Make sure the bottom of the pan is evenly coated. Set aside to cool down.
In a large mixing bowl, beat egg whites and cream of tartar until frothy.
Gradually add 1/3 cup sugar while beating on high speed. Beat until stiff peak.
Transfer into the prepared bundt pan with caramelized sugar.
Prepare a larger pan with about an inch of  water. Place the bundt pan over the pan with water.
Bake for for 20 to 25 minutes or until top of meringue turns golden brown.
Remove from oven and cool down a bit.
To unmold, place a plate on top of the pan and invert.
Slice and serve.
​Enjoy.

name: Cassava Cake​
ingredients: 2 packs (16 oz each)  grated cassava, about 4 cups
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Prepare a baking pan and grease with butter. Set aside.
Combine all ingredients in a deep bowl. Make sure every ingredients are well combined.
Transfer to the greased 13 x 9 baking pan.
Bake for 40-45 minutes or until lightly set.
Combine the topping ingredients.
Pour-in over to the top of the baked cassava.
Bake for another 15-25 minutes.
Remove from oven.
Serve warm.
Enjoy! ​​ ​

name: Cassava Cake with Macapuno
instructions: I used 2 (16oz) frozen grated cassava for this recipe. It saves a lot of time. All I need to do is thaw them. If you will be using raw cassava, grate them and lightly squeeze and discard the juice. Do not fully squeeze or they will be dry. We need the moisture from the cassava.
If macapuno is not available, you can just omit.
I used 11 x 8 pan but you can actually use any size you like. Just make sure to adjust the baking time.
You can also line the pan with banana leaf if desired.  If not available, just make sure to generously grease the pan with butter to avoid sticking.
It is best eaten when warm. Leftover needs refrigeration and store in airtight container. Just microwave to reheat.

name: Cassava Flan
ingredients: 2 cups cassava, grated ( I used frozen ready-made cassava in a pack but fresh can be used by grating and squeezing some juice)
1/2 of 1 can coconut milk ( about 3/4 cup)
7 & 1/2 tbsp sugar (2 & 1/2 tbsp each llanera mold)
instructions: Spoon 2 1/2 tbsp sugar in a flan mold or lyanera. (Prepare 3 molds). Caramelize over low heat until sugar turns to light golden brown. Using a thong, swirl the caramel evenly on the flat side of the mold. Remove from heat and cool completely.

name: Cathedral Window Gelatin
instructions: In a bowl, dissolve each flavored gelatin in 2 cups water. Transfer to a sauce pan and cook over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Transfer to containers and cool to set. Cut into cubes. Set aside.

name: Cheesecake (3 Ingredients)
instructions: An 8-inch Springform pan can also be used. Just make sure to wrap the bottom with foil to avoid leaking.

Make sure the cream cheese is softened at room temperature. If cream cheese is too cold, it won't blend well with the other ingredients.  To quickly soften, microwave for about 10 seconds and it's ready to use. If you are not in a hurry, just leave the cream cheese on the counter top for about 30 minutes.

This cheesecake can also be steamed.  Cover the pan with foil or wrap the steamer lid with cloth to avoid water drip. Steam for 45-50 minutes then leave to cool inside the steamer with lid partially opened for about 30 minutes.
Leaving the cake inside the oven to cool down for a bit will avoid the cake from deflating. Just slightly open the oven door and place a towel or  an oven mitt to keep it ajar.
The top of the cake is very fragile so be gentle when removing from the pan to avoid cracks.
Cool completely before removing from pan and before dusting with powdered sugar.
Store in the refrigerator in an airtight container and consume within 5 days.

name: Cheesecake Cookie Bars
instructions: ​Preheat oven to 350F / 176C. Line an 8 x 8 or 9 x 9 pan with parchment paper greased with oil or butter.
In a medium bowl, stir together flour, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, cream the butter. Add granulated sugar and brown sugar. Beat until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla. Beat until well incorporated.
Add flour mixture in two additions. Beat until well combined.  Stir-in semi-sweet chocolate chips.
Add 2/3 of cookie dough and press firmly against the bottom of the prepared pan. Set aside.
In a small bowl. beat cream cheese until creamy.
Add sugar and beat until well combined.
Add egg and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Pour over prepared pan with cookie dough. Spread evenly.
Add remaining cookie dough by tablespoons or crumble on top of the cheesecake mixture.
Bake in a preheated oven for 40 minutes or until top starts to turn golden.
Cool completely then chill before serving.
Cut into bars. Store in the refrigerator. Enjoy!

name: Cheesecake Flan
ingredients: 1 package, 8 oz cream cheese, room temperature
instructions: You want a nice golden caramel so do not burn the sugar or it will taste bitter.
Make sure that the caramel has already cooled down before transferring the cheesecake mixture.
Cover with foil to avoid burning the top. (Only during the first 45 minutes of baking time.
Oven temperature varies. Always check before the set time.
Skimming off the foam on top of the mixture or straining will avoid bubbles in your flan.
Mine took about 75 minutes to bake and it was perfect :)
This can also be steamed for one hour or until toothpick test comes out clean. Make sure to cover the plan tightly with foil the entire time while steaming.
Recipe makes about 8-12 servings.
Enjoy.

name: Chocolate Bombs
ingredients: Semi-sweet chocolate chips or any chocolate bar of choice or almond bark, I used about 1 cup of chocolate chips to make 6 chocolate bombs
chocolate milk powder or cocoa powder, I used Milo chocolate powder mix
instructions: You can also microwave the chocolate in increments of  20-30 seconds. Do not overdo it or else the chocolate will be dry. Melting it on a heated proof bowl over a pan with boiling water (double boiler) gives a good result and I highly suggest to use that. ​
Make sure to wipe or clean the molds diligently as any residue will affect the result e.g. the chocolate sphere will not be as shiny or they will have holes.

Evenly coat the spheres from bottom to the sides paying attention to the edges.  If coating on the edges are too thin, they will crack when you release it from the mold.  You can do a first coat, freeze, then coat a thin layer again. Either way, it works.

If your chocolate bomb was molded too thick, the steaming hot milk will have a hard time melting it in a mug. You'll miss the fun part. The chocolate bomb will still melt because of the hot milk but you have force it with a spoon. You don't want that.

When melting the 2nd half's edges or rim over the hot pan, do not re-use the part with melted chocolate already. If you do this, it will ruin your 2nd sphere and will have to repeat the process. Use the clean area of the pan.

If you will decorate with white chocolate like how I did, melt the chocolate like how you melted the chocolate for the sphere. Transfer to a piping bag then cut the tip to make a very small hole. Immediately decorate with sprinkles. You don't want the white chocolate to dry up and the sprinkles won't stick.
Consume the chocolate bombs within 24 hours for best results or store a room temperature for up to 5 days.
I hope all these tips helps you make these amazing Chocolate Bombs.

name: Chocolate Butter Mochi
ingredients: 1 pack (16oz / 1 pound or 4 cups) glutinous rice flour
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F/176C.
Generously grease a 13x9 baking pan with oil or butter.  Set aside.

In a microwave-safe bowl, combine chocolate chips and butter.  Microwave on high at 30-second intervals. Stir until melted.  You can also melt the chocolate chips using a double boiler method by boiling a small amount of water in a saucepan. Place a heat-proof bowl on top of the saucepan (bottom of the bowl should not be touching the water) then add the chocolate chips and butter. Stir until smooth and fully melted. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.
In a medium bowl, combine milk, eggs, coconut milk and vanilla. Set aside.

In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder and cocoa powder.  Make a well at the center then pour the liquid mixture. Stir until well incorporated. Add the melted chocolate and whisk well to combine or until mixture is smooth.
Pour mixture over the prepared pan.
Bake for 1 hour or  1 hour and 15 minutes or until mixture is set.  Remove from oven and let cool for few minutes then slice to serve.
Best served when warm.

name: Chocolate Butternut Cookies
instructions: If blender is not available to make the coating, combine all the ingredients in a bowl and use gloves after adding the food color. Manually mix with your hands to blend completely. You can also use a zip bag to do this if gloves are not available.
Greasing your hands during shaping avoids the batter from sticking and easy rolling. It also makes the butternut to stick to the dough balls during coating.
I suggest to take half only of the refrigerated batter and place the rest inside the fridge when shaping. This will keep the batter from melting while working with the other batter.

To avoid flat cookies, refrigeration is required. 4 hours at least but overnight is way better. To speed uop the process and if you are really in a hurry, you can freeze the mixture for at least 1 hour.
Do not over-bake.  The cookies should still be soft when touched and should appear slightly under-baked. They will continue to bake during cooling.
Store the cookies in an airtight container.

ingredients: 2 packs (16 oz each)  grated cassava, about 4 cups
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Prepare a baking pan and grease with butter. Set aside.
Combine all ingredients in a deep bowl. Make sure every ingredients are well combined.
Transfer to the greased 13 x 9 baking pan.
Bake for 40-45 minutes or until lightly set.
Combine the topping ingredients.
Pour-in over to the top of the baked cassava.
Bake for another 15-25 minutes.
Remove from oven.
Serve warm.
Enjoy! ​​ ​

name: Chocolate Crinkles
ingredients: 1 cup Cocoa Powder - I used Hershey's
instructions: Remove about 1/4 of the dough from the refrigerator at a time to work with and let remaining chill.
​They should be soft when touched and should appear slightly under-baked.
You can store cookies in an airtight container. ​

name: Chocolate-Dipped Ice Cream Bars
ingredients: 1 cup powdered milk ( I used Nido)
3 tbsp vegetable, canola or coconut oil, adjust as needed
instructions: The best way to thin chocolate that's perfect for dipping is to add fat. The exact amount of oil depends on the thickness of your chocolate and  your desired consistency. Just add 1 tbsp at a time and check the chocolate's consistency is thin enough. You want a light, glossy and flowing chocolate.
Make sure that the chocolate has totally cooled down before using.  Simple reason, the ice cream will melt of course.
If your chocolate has sat for awhile, please stir again before using and stir each time you will dip the ice cream. This way, you'll get a smooth coating.
To store, keep the Chocolate Dipped  Ice Cream bars in the freezer. Use a zip bag or wrap individually with foil.

name: Churros
instructions: In a sauce pan, combine water, butter, sugar and salt.  Stir and cook over medium heat. Once boiling, lower the heat.
Add all purpose flour. Stir until liquid is fully absorbed and the mixture is smooth and forms a dough.
Remove from heat and transfer to a mixing bowl. Cool for about 5 minutes.
Gradually add eggs. Mixing after each addition.  Stir until fully combined.
Transfer the dough into a piping bag fitted with a star tip.
Heat cooking oil in medium pan.
Pipe the dough to make logs (about 3-4 inches long). Fry until color turns golden brown on both sides.
Drain on paper towels.
In a bowl or plate, combine sugar and cinnamon.  Roll warm churros in cinnamon-sugar mixture to coat.
Serve warm and enjoy.

ingredients: 2 packs (16 oz each)  grated cassava, about 4 cups
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Prepare a baking pan and grease with butter. Set aside.
Combine all ingredients in a deep bowl. Make sure every ingredients are well combined.
Transfer to the greased 13 x 9 baking pan.
Bake for 40-45 minutes or until lightly set.
Combine the topping ingredients.
Pour-in over to the top of the baked cassava.
Bake for another 15-25 minutes.
Remove from oven.
Serve warm.
Enjoy! ​​ ​

name: Cream Cheese Flan
instructions: ***You want a nice golden caramel so do not
burn the sugar or it will taste bitter.
***Make sure that the caramel has already cooled down before transferring the cheesecake mixture.
***Cover with foil to avoid burning the top. (Only during half-way of baking time).
***Oven temperature varies. Set your oven to 50 minutes first and then test with a toothpick.
***Skimming off the foam on top of the mixture will avoid bubbles in your flan.
Mine took 75 minutes to bake and it was perfect :)
This can also be steamed for one hour or until toothpick test comes out clean.
Recipe makes about 8-12 servings.

name: Coconut Macaroons
instructions: ​Preheat oven to 350F.
Line mini cupcake pan with mini cupcake liners.
In a large bowl, beat the eggs. Add sugar and butter. Beat until sugar is dissolved.
Add condensed milk and vanilla extract. Beat until mixture is smooth and well combined.
Stir-in desiccated coconut.
Scoop about 2 tbsp mixture into the prepared pan. Press lightly with the back of the spoon or fork to flatten the top. This will give a nice smooth top and prevents spaces at the bottom.
Bake in a preheated oven for 15-18 minutes or until top is golden.
Remove from oven and brush with melted butter. Transfer to a wire rack and cool completely.
Store in an airtight container.
Recipe yields 36 macaroons.
Enjoy!

name: Coconut Mandarin Popsicle
ingredients: Canned Mandarin Oranges - drained or fresh
13 ounce can Coconut Milk or use Coconut milk in carton
instructions: Place several slices of Mandarin Oranges into each popsicle container.
Shake the coconut milk and slowly pour it into each mold.
Freeze overnight.​
Note: You can add some sugar or honey but I prefer mine low in calories.

name: Coffee Jelly
ingredients: 1 cup whipping cream or all purpose cream
instructions: ​In a large sauce pan, combine gelatin, water and sugar. Stir until sugar and gelatin is dissolved.
Stir-in coffee 2 1/2 tbsp coffee powder.
Turn on the stove to medium heat. Stir occasionally until mixture starts to boil. Turn off heat and transfer mixture into heated proof containers. Let it cool completely before slicing into cubes.
In large bowl, combine evaporated milk, condensed milk, whipping cream or all purpose cream and 1 tsp coffee powder. Stir until well combined.
Add the cubed coffee flavored gelatin and stir to combine.
Add cooked sago (tapioca pearls), if desired.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Corn Maja
ingredients: 1/2 cup sugar or more if you prefer it sweet.
Grated Cheese for topping or LATIK
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a pot.
Make sure every ingredients are well combined.
Turn on to low heat.
Continue stirring until it becomes thick and when it comes to a point that it is hard to mix or stir.
Transfer to a serving container.
Top with grated cheese or LATIK.
Let the temperature cool down.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or serve right away.
Enjoy!

name: Creamy Corn Maja
instructions: Do not use coconut milk when making latik especially using the canned one. Some brands have added water that it won't produce the latik that you like. Please use coconut cream. It is much thicker and makes a lot. I akways use 15 oz can MaePloy brand. Arroy D is also another brand that I suggest if Maeploy is not available.
A lot of stirring is required to make the mixture thick. If you stop stirring, some mixture will harden at the bottom and will stick. Make sure that the heat is on medium-low to avoid burning.
You can also add another 1/2 can of coconut cream of whole corn if you like.

Sugar can always be adjusted according to you preference.  I remember the first time I made this using whole milk, I sued 1/2 cup of sugar. This time I used 2% milk and added 3/4 cup. They both work well.
​Store in the refrigerator and consume within 3-5 days. A small slice can be warmed up in the microwave for about 20-30 seconds.

name: Crema De Fruta
ingredients: fruit cocktail and/or peaches, pineapples, etc.​​​
instructions: Combine flour, sugar, water, evaporated milk, egg yolks and butter in a saucepan until well mixed.
Simmer in low heat while stirring constantly until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat.
Arrange the first layer of graham crackers in an 8 x 8 square pan.
Spread the prepared mixture over the graham crackers.
Top the mixture with another layer of graham crackers. Repeat until 3 to 4 layers depending on your size preference.
Top with fruit cocktail and/or peaches.

Cook the gelatin as instructed in the label and pour it over the graham and fruit layer. For the Ladies Choice brand of clear gelatin, Combine 1/2 cup water and 1 /2 tbsp gelatin powder in a sauce pan. Stir until powder is dissolved. Let it boil. Remove from heat.
Pour the gelatin over the top of the cake.
Let it cool and refrigerate.
Best served when chilled.
Slice and enjoy.

name: Creme Brulee
instructions: Preheat oven to 300 F.
Separate egg yolks from whites.
In a large mixing bowl, beat together egg yolks with the sugar until mixture is a pale yellow.
Add whipping cream and vanilla. Beat on low until well blended.
Strain the mixture to get rid of bubbles.
Pour the mixture through a strainer into your ramekins to get rid of any leftover bubbles. Pour up to  a 1/4 inch from top of ramekin.
Place the filled ramekins into a large pan and fill the pan with hot water about halfway up the sides of ramekins.
Bake until set about 55-60 minutes depending on the size of ramekins. The ramekins I used were 4 inches x 2 1/4. It is small but tall.
Remove pan from oven and leave in the water bath until cooled.
Remove ramekins from water bath, wipe water off and place in refrigerator to chill at least 2 hours.
Prior to serving, remove from refrigerator and sprinkle about 2 tsp sugar over each custard top. (Make a nice even layer). Melt the sugar using a torch until a burnt caramel is made.

name: Crepe
instructions: In a bowl, combine the crepe ingredients.
Continue beating until the mixture is thin and smooth.
Heat a frying pan. Grease the pan with butter or use a cooking spray.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter into the pan. Tilt the pan until the batter coats the entire bottom.
Cook in low to medium heat. When the edges look dry and the bottom starts to have brown spots, peel it up and flip it over.
Transfer to a plate.
Top the crepe with desired fruits and ingredients.
Serve and Enjoy your yummy Crepe!​

name: Custard Macaroons
instructions: Prepare steamer and boil 1 litter of water.
Whisk eggs then add condensed milk.
Add butter and vanilla. Whisk until well combined.
Stir-in dessicated coconut.
Transfer batter to molds lined with cupcake liners.
Steam for 12-15 minutes.
Insert toothpick to test for doneness. Toothpick should come out clean.
Remove from steamer and cool on wire rack.
Recipe yields 12-13 pieces custard macaroons.

name: Dulce de Leche
instructions: Leftover dulce de leche can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week.
You can use any brand of sweetened condensed milk for this recipe, just avoid using the fat-free kind.
Be sure to check on the water level as it cooks to insure water remains at desired level.
Baking time can  be adjusted up to 2 hours until desired color and thickness is achieved. The longer you bake the deeper the color and flavor will be.
To reheat,  microwave  for about 30 seconds or use a double boiler.

name: Espasol
ingredients: 1/8 cup or 1/4 cup water (if needed), adjust accordingly
instructions: Transfer the mixture into a board, flat surface or tray dusted with toasted flour.
Divide the mixture into parts or sizes according to your preference.
Roll over the sliced mixture into the toasted flour.
Enjoy!​

name: Fried Banana Plantains
ingredients: 5 ore more saba (Cardaba banana or plantain) peeled and sliced
cooking oil enough for deep frying ​
instructions: Preheat oil in work or frying pan.
Peel bananas. Slice diagonally into small pieces.
You can coat them with brown sugar or add the bananas into hot oil then add the brown sugar.
Make sure the sugar sticks to the banana by constantly mixing or turning them over using a tong.
When cooked, take them one by one and let the oil drip or you can place them on a strainer.
Serve and enjoy!​​

name: Floating Island
ingredients: 16 oz ube / purple yam root, boiled and mashed or grated
1 can (12 oz/ 354 ml) + 3/4 cup evaporated milk
instructions: ​Avoid opening and closing the oven door. Meringue will deflate from sudden change in temperature. Use the oven light (if available) to check if meringue is ready.

For a successful meringue, make sure not to drop even a streak of water to it. Also remove excess egg yolks if there are any. Egg whites must be room temperature before whisking. Cream of tartar is essential. Do not substitute or omit and make sure it is not old or expired.
Humidity in your room would affect the meringue as well.

name: Fruit Cocktail Jelly
ingredients: 1 pack 25 g unflavored red gelatin powder
1 cup reserved syrup from fruit cocktail
instructions: Drain canned fruit cocktail and reserve the syrup.
