Transfer fruit cocktail into the prepared molders. Llanera, gelatin molds or any container can be used.
In a large bowl, combine reserved syrup, evaporated milk and condensed milk. Whisk until well combined. Set aside.
In a pot, dissolve gelatin powder in 2 1/2 cups water. Cook over medium heat. Continue stirring until the mixture is steaming hot (not boiling).
Lower the heat then add milk mixture while stirring.
Turn back the heat to medium and bring to a simmer.
Transfer into the prepared molds with fruit cocktail.
Let it cool to set and refrigerate.
Remove from molds and serve.
Enjoy.

name: Fruit Cocktail Jelly 2 Layers
instructions: I used Mr. Hat Gulaman brand for this recipe. If using other brand, please make sure to follow package directions. Brands vary on water requirements so make adjustments if needed.
Leftover Fruit Cocktail Jelly can be placed in an airtight container and be stored in the refrigerator for about 1 week or so. ​

ingredients: 1/4 cup sweet rice flour (toasted) for dusting & coating only (I used Mochiko brand)
instructions: While waiting for the mixture to cool down, toast the sweet rice flour until color turns light brown.
Transfer the mixture into a board or flat surface dusted with toasted sweet flour.
Divide the mixture into parts or sizes according to your preference. ( I did 2 1/2 inch in diameter).
Roll over the sliced mixture into the toasted sweet flour.
Transfer to a serving plate. Enjoy!​

name: Fruit Popsicle
ingredients: Canned fruits - mandarin orange, pineapple tidbits, peaches, etc or use fruit cocktail
5 tbsp syrup from the canned fruits
1/4 cup condensed milk - adjust according to your preference​ ​
instructions: In a large cup, combine evaporated milk, condensed milk and syrup.
Place several slices of fruits into each popsicle container then fill with milk mixture.
Freeze overnight.​
Unmolding:
Fill a pan or container that is at least as tall as your mold with warm (not hot) water.
Briefly dip the mold in until the pops loosen, about 20 to 30 seconds.
Remove the mold from the water and place it on a sturdy surface.
Enjoy!

name: Funnel Cake
ingredients: strawberry jam or any sweet fruit preserves​
instructions: In a bowl, mix the flour, salt, sugar and baking powder.
In another bowl, beat together egg and milk.
Add the flour mixture and continue stirring until smooth. Set aside.
Combine strawberries, water and sugar. Simmer over low heat for about 4-5 minutes.
Add the vanilla extract. Turn off heat and add the cornstarch mixture.
Turn the heat back on and simmer until sauce is thickened.
In a deep fryer or heavy skillet, heat the oil to 375 degrees.
Pour batter using a funnel, or use a pastry or ziploc bag with the tip cut off working from the center to the outside in a circle overlapping and crisscrossing.
Fry until golden brown turning the cake once.
Remove the cake and place it on paper towels to drain.
Transfer to a serving plate.
Top the cake with desired fruits, ice cream, whip cream, and powdered sugar.
Enjoy!

name: Graham de Leche
ingredients: 2 1/2 tbsp sugar (caramel for each flan mold or llanera)
3 cups heavy whipping cream or all purpose cream
1/2 can of 14 oz condensed milk, chilled for 6 hours or overnight (adjust according to sweetness preference)
instructions: ​​Beat heavy whipping cream until soft peaks form.
Add the chilled condensed milk. Continue beating until stiff peaks form.
Arrange the first layer of graham crackers in a pan, (size of pan - enough to fit the flan) about 8x6 pan.
Spread the prepared cream mixture over the graham crackers.
Top the mixture with another layer of graham crackers.
Spread another mixture then sprinkle some crushed grahams.
Add the flan on top of the crushed grahams.
Spread cream mixture on the sides or around the flan.
Sprinkle the cream mixture with some crushed grahams.
Cover the pan and refrigerate to set.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Guava Jelly
ingredients: 6-10 pieces ripe guava (I used guavas with pink flesh)
instructions: Make sure the guavas are ripe and soft. They are easier to cook and will give a nice flavor and sweetness to the jam.
You can omit the saffron if it is not available but I suggest to include it because this spice adds taste and color to the jam.

Make sure to sterilize new bottles or jars. Newly purchased jars are not sterile. To sterilize, submerge the jars in boiling water for 10-15 minutes. Lids can be sterilized by submerging in hot water before use.
The first batch I made was stored in my fridge for more than 6 months. It could probably last longer.
You can double this recipe. Cooking time will be probably about 50-60 minutes. ​

name: Holiday Jello Cups
ingredients: 2 packets,  .25 oz or 7grams each, unflavored gelatin ( I used Knox)
1 cup heavy whipping cream or all purpose cream
instructions: In a bowl, combine strawberry gelatin and 1 cup hot water. Stir until dissolved. Add 1 cup cold water.
Fill each glass or cup about 1/3 full with strawberry gelatin mixture. Remove air bubbles. Place in refrigerator until set.
In a bowl, combine unflavored gelatin (I used Knox gelatin) in a bowl and add 1 cup cold water. Mix well and let stand for 1 minute.
Add condensed milk and 1 cup hot water. Stir to combine.
Fill each glass about 2/3 full with the white gelatin mixture. Remove air bubbles. Place in refrigerator to set.
In a bowl, combine lime gelatin and 1 cup hot water. Stir until dissolved. Add 1 cup cold water.
Fill each glass with lime gelatin mixture until nearly full. Remove air bubbles. Place in refrigerator to set.
To make topping, beat whipping cream until thick. Add condensed milk and continue beating to combine.
Top your layered jello cups with whipped cream and garnish with sprinkles.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Recipe yields 7 (9 oz) cups.
Enjoy!

name: ​Ice Buko with Red Beans (Munggo)
ingredients: 1 cup whipping cream or all-purpose cream
macapuno strings (coconut sport) or fresh coconut strings
instructions: store-bought red mung beans in syrup can be used if desired.
I used macapuno strings (coconut sport). Why because macapuno or gel-like young coconut and I like it when the strings are soft.

If using macapuno strings, please know that they are already sweet and for me 1/2 cup condensed milk is just the right sweetness. But we do have different preferences so make sure to adjust accordingly.
I used whipping cream here because I like it better than all-purpose cream because of its' creaminess.
It is normal that the red beans get slightly firmer after freezing the ice pops.

name: Jelly Flan
ingredients: 1 pack 25 g yellow unflavored gelatin powder
instructions: Scoop 1-2 tbsp of sugar into the llanera or molds.
Caramelize over low heat until amber in color. Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine egg yolk, evaporated milk and condensed milk. Whisk until well combined. Strain to remove egg lumps. Set aside.
In another bowl, dissolve gelatin powder in 4 cups water.
Transfer into a pot over medium heat. Continue mixing until the mixture is steaming hot (not boiling). Lower the heat then add the flan mixture while stirring.
Add the vanilla. Turn the heat back to medium and bring to a simmer.
Transfer into the molds with caramelized sugar.
Let it cool until completely firm.
​Enjoy.

ingredients: 2 packets,  .25 oz or 7grams each, unflavored gelatin ( I used Knox)
1 cup heavy whipping cream or all purpose cream
instructions: In a bowl, combine strawberry gelatin and 1 cup hot water. Stir until dissolved. Add 1 cup cold water.
Fill each glass or cup about 1/3 full with strawberry gelatin mixture. Remove air bubbles. Place in refrigerator until set.
In a bowl, combine unflavored gelatin (I used Knox gelatin) in a bowl and add 1 cup cold water. Mix well and let stand for 1 minute.
Add condensed milk and 1 cup hot water. Stir to combine.
Fill each glass about 2/3 full with the white gelatin mixture. Remove air bubbles. Place in refrigerator to set.
In a bowl, combine lime gelatin and 1 cup hot water. Stir until dissolved. Add 1 cup cold water.
Fill each glass with lime gelatin mixture until nearly full. Remove air bubbles. Place in refrigerator to set.
To make topping, beat whipping cream until thick. Add condensed milk and continue beating to combine.
Top your layered jello cups with whipped cream and garnish with sprinkles.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Recipe yields 7 (9 oz) cups.
Enjoy!

name: Kamote Cue
ingredients: 2 ore more sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced
cooking oil enough for deep frying ​​​ ​
instructions: Preheat oil in work or frying pan.
Peel the sweet potatoes . Slice diagonally into small pieces.
You can coat them with brown sugar or add the yams into hot oil then add the brown sugar.
Make sure the sugar sticks to the potatoes by constantly mixing or turning them over using a tong.
When cooked, take them one by one and let the oil drip or you can place them on a strainer.
You can use a bamboo stick or serve as it is.
Enjoy! your sweet Kamote Cue!

name: Karioka
instructions: Combine flour, coconut milk and coconut flakes. Continue  mixing until a dough is formed.
Make into 1" to 1 1/2" balls and deep fry until color turns light brown. Set aside.
Prepare the coating by combing the two ingredients and cook until mixture thickens. Remove from heat.
Dip the karioka into the sauce until all sides are coated.
Enjoy!

name: Kutsinta
ingredients: 3/4 cup brown sugar (add 1/4 cup if you prefer it sweet)
​Annatto extract: 2 tsp Atsuete or annato seeds & 3 tsp hot water
instructions: Add just enough water in the steamer (about 1 inch height inch from the rim).
Make sure the water in the steamer is boiling when adding the individual molds with mixture into the steamer.
Steam on medium heat.
Do not over steam. A very small amount of liquid on top is fine. You can discard that extra small amount of water. Over steaming makes the Kutsinta hard and firm at the bottom.
Unmold with a knife with a round tip that is brushed with butter to avoid sticking.
Do not add grated coconut on top if you will not consume them right away.
Grated coconut must be stored in the fridge.
Left over Kutsinta can be stored at room temperature for up 2 days or you can refrigerate and warm them up.
Recipe yields 13 pieces.

name: Langka Cheesecake Bars
instructions: A 6x6 square pan can also be used if you want a taller cheesecake bar.
Fresh jackfruit can be used. In a medium pan, add 1 cup langka, 1/2 cup water and 1/4 cup sugar. Cook until langka is soft and sugar has caramelized.

If Langka Flavor is not available, it can be omitted. You can add a small amount of food color if desired to achieve the yellow cake. But I suggest to add as it provides great flavor and color to this dessert.
Step or bullet#6 can be skipped. You can directly add the langka as a topping. I added langka flavor because it gives  the topping a light swirling color effect as well.
Make sure to check your oven before the set time. Oven temperature varies. This dessert is done as soon as cheesecake topping has just set. Do not overbake or the cake will be dry.
Store the cheesecake bars in an air tight container. They can last for up to 5 days chilled in the fridge.

name: Leche Flan
instructions: Transfer the molds into a  large oven-safe dish or pan with water about one-inch high the sides of the pan. (water bath).

name: Macapuno Balls
instructions: Add condensed milk in a pan. Cook over low heat.  The milk will thin out but will eventually become thick (about 5 minutes). Stir continuously to avoid burning.
Add the macapuno preserves. Cook over low heat until consistency is slightly thick.
Dissolve cornstarch in water. Add the cornstarch mixture.
Stir well and continue cooking until mixture is thick and hard to stir.
Shape into balls (about 1/2 tbsp)
Coat with dessicated coconut.
Wrap individually with a cellophane wrappers.

name: Maja Jelly
ingredients: 2 pack or 50 grams yellow unflavored gelatin powder
instructions: In a large bowl, dissolve 1/3 cup cornstarch in 1/2 cup water.
Add  6 cups water and sugar. Stir to dissolve sugar.
Add gelatin powder. Whisk well until gelatin is fully dissolved.
Add evaporated and condensed milk. Stir well.
Transfer the mixture into a large pot.
Add cream corn and mix well.
Cook over medium heat and continue mixing until steaming hot.
Remove from heat.
Prepare the bundt pan or gelatin mold by adding 1/2 cup whole corn then pour the maja gelatin mixture.
Cool completely then refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
Top with grated cheese and whole corn for decoration if desired.
​Enjoy.

name: Mango Cheese Cake Float
ingredients: 2 cups whipping cream or  chilled all purpose cream
2 or more sweet ripe mangoes, peeled and sliced into small cubes
4-6 pieces or more store-bought cheese cupcakes or homemade, crumbled
instructions: In a large bowl, whip heavy cream or all purpose cream until soft peak.
Add condensed milk and beat until stiff peak.
Scoop whipped cream into a piping bag fitted with a star tip. 2M or 2D will work fine. If not available, ziploc can be used by opening a hole on one edge.
Crumble or break the cheese cupcakes into small pieces.
Layer plastic cups or any container of choice with desired amount of crumbled cupcakes.
Pipe the top with whipped cream.
Top with mangoes.
Repeat process by making 2 more layers (2nd layer) and a 3rd layer starting from the crumbled cakes then whipped cream and last on top will be mangoes.
They can be served immediately or refrigerate if desired.
Enjoy.

name: Mango Cream Cheese Ice Cream
instructions: ​Use a blender or food processor to puree 1 cup sliced mango. Set aside.
Beat the cream cheese with a hand mixer until smooth.
Add the condensed milk and beat until well combined.
Add the mango puree. Beat to combine. Set aside.
Beat the heavy whipping cream until thick.
Add the condensed-mango-cheese mixture. Beat until just combined.
Stir-in about 1/2 - 3/4 cup chopped mangoes.
Pour the ice cream mixture into a standard loaf pan, cover with plastic wrap, press against the ice cream.
Freeze until completely firm, about 6 hours or overnight.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Mango Ice Creamdy
ingredients: 2 cups whipping cream or all-purpose cream
1 cup condensed milk, chilled (adjust according to sweetness preference)
more ripe mangoes for filling the bag
instructions: Add sliced mangoes and 1/2 cup condensed milk in a food processor or blender. Blend until smooth. (Makes about 1 cup of sweet pureed mango).
In a large bowl, beat  whipping cream until thick. Add 1/2 cup condensed milk and beat until combined. Add pureed mango and beat until  ingredients are fully incorporated.
Divide the mixture into, leaving the other half plain and the other half mixed with crushed grahams.
Using  a piping bag with a long tip or tip cut to fit the bag, add desired amount of sliced mangoes and pour blended mixture in an ice candy bag. ( 1 1/2" x  10" ) and knot closed.
Repeat with remaining mixture with crushed grahams.
Freeze overnight before serving.
Enjoy.

name: ​Mango Popsicle
instructions: Cut about 2 cups to 2 & 1/2  cups of ripe mangoes.  Using a blender or food processor, blend until smooth, about 1-2 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine 1 cup mango puree, cream, fresh milk and condensed milk. Stir until well combined.
Fill the clear plastic cups ( I used 3 oz disposable cups) with about 2 tbsp or desired amount of cubed mangoes then pour milk mixture.
Cover with a foil, make a small slit in the center and insert  food grade popsicle sticks.
Freeze for at least 6 hours or overnight.  Remove from freezer and thaw for about 3 minutes before unmolding from the cups.
To unmold, press all the sides of the cup to loosen up and push the bottom to release.
Enjoy!
Recipe yields about 16-18 mango popsicles.

name: Maruya (Banana Fritters)
ingredients: Saba or plantain bananas, sliced in half lengthwise
instructions: In a medium bowl, sift flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Stir to combine.
Add egg, milk and vanilla. Whisk until just combined.  Do not over-mix.

Let the batter stand or for 10-15 minutes. Why rest the batter? During the resting period, starch molecules in the flour are absorbing the liquid in the batter. which causes them to swell and gives the batter a thicker, more viscous consistency.
While waiting, peel the banana skin and slice in half (lengthwise).
Dip in batter and coat evenly.
Fry in hot oil until crisp and golden. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
Transfer to serving plate and lightly sprinkle with granulated sugar.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Meringue Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 200 degrees F. Line cookie sheet with parchment papers or silicone mats.
Beat egg whites on low-medium speed until frothy.
Add the cream of tartar and beat until soft peaks form.
Gradually add the sugar giving each addition a minute to fully incorporate before adding the next bit.
Continue beating until the sugar dissolves and the mixture holds very stiff peaks.
Beat in vanilla.
Divide the meringue and add a very tiny drop of food coloring to make pastel colored cookies.
Transfer the meringue to a piping bag.
Pipe using star tip leaving a little room between each one.
Bake for 1 1/2 hours. Make sure to turn the pan halfway through so that the cookies bake evenly.
Turn off the oven and leave the cookies in the oven for 15-20 minutes.
Remove from oven and let it cool.
Remove cookies from parchment paper.
Store in an air tight container.
​Enjoy!

name: Milo Rocky Road Popsicle
ingredients: 2/3 cup whipping cream or all-purpose cream
instructions: ​In a medium sauce pan, heat the milk. Do not boil. Once heated, stir-in chocolate powder. Mix until fully incorporated and powder is fully dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool.
Once cooled, transfer to a large bowl. Add whipping cream and condensed milk.  Whisk until well combined.
Fill the clear plastic cups ( I used 3oz disposable cups) with chocolate chips, peanuts and marshmallows then pour chocolate milk mixture.
Cover with a foil, make a small slit on the center and insert food grade popsicle sticks.

Freeze for at least 6 hours or overnight.  Remove from freezer and thaw for about 3 minutes before unmolding from the cups. To unmold, press all the sides of the cup to loosen up and push the bottom to release. Serve and enjoy!
Recipe yields about 12-15 popsicles.

name: Minatamis na Saging
ingredients: 8-10 medium ripe saba or plantain bananas, sliced diagonally
instructions: In a large deep pan, combine water, sugar and salt. Stir to dissolve and bring to a boil. Let the syrup slightly thickens.
Add sliced banana and vanilla extract.
Cover and simmer over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until saba bananas are tender.
Remove from heat.
Serve alone as a dessert or make Banana Con Yelo by adding evaporated milk and crushed ice.
Enjoy.

name: Mini Blueberry Cheesecake
instructions: If food processor is not available to grind the graham crackers, you can also place them in a Ziploc bag and crush them using a rolling pin or wine bottle. Make sure to make fine crumbs.
Canned Blueberry Pie filling can be used if fresh blueberries are not available.
Freezing the cheesecake for 30 minutes before serving helps peel away the liner easily.

name: Mini Cassava Cake
ingredients: 2 cups or 1 pack 16 oz grated cassava
1/2 cup condensed milk + more for topping
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F.
Grease a non-stick mini cupcake pan or line with mini cupcake liners greased with butter or cooking spray.
In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except the extra condensed milk for topping. Stir until fully incorporated.
Scoop cassava mixture (about 3/4 full) into each cavity of prepared pan.
Bake for about 20 minutes or until cassava is almost set.
Remove from oven and top each cassava with 1/2 tsp condensed milk.
Bake again for another 10-12 minutes or until top starts to bubble and turns golden.
Remove from oven and transfer on a wire rack to cool completely.
Recipe makes 36 mini cassava cakes.
Enjoy!

name: Mocha Graham Float
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups heavy cream or all purpose cream
topping like chocolate chips, marshmallows (if desired)
instructions: In a large mixing bowl using ahand mixer, beat the heavy cream on high speed until thick, about 3-5 minutes.
Add the condensed milk and coffee. You can add more coffee powder depending on your preference.  Beat on high speed until ingredients are fully incorporated and coffee granules are melted.
Arrange the first layer of graham crackers on a pan. I used an 8 x 6 glass container.
Spread a thin layer of mocha cream on top. Drizzle with some chocolate syrup (if desired).
Make another layer of grahams crackers and repeat the process. I made 4 layers total.
Drizzle the top with chocolate syrup. I used a toothpick to make the swirl effect. You can decorate or add toppings of choice like nuts, marshmallows, etc.
Refrigerate before serving. Overnight is better.  Slice, serve and enjoy. Recipe makes about 6 servings.

name: Mochi Donuts
instructions: In a pan heat 1/4 cup whipping cream. Do not boil. Remove from heat before it simmers.  Or microwave for about 30 seconds.  Pour warm whipping cream over a bowl with 1/2 cup white chocolate chips. Stir with a spatula until melted. Switch to a whisk and continue stirring until smooth. Add matcha powder and stir until well combined.  Dip one side of the dough ring until evenly coated. Remove and swirl to allow excess coating to drip. Transfer to a rack with tray a the bottom.

name: Nilupak
instructions: Combine all ingredients in pan or wok.
Mix manually in low heat until well blended and thick.
Arrange on a plate or in a banana leaf and cut into desired shapes.
Top with margarine.
Serve & Enjoy!​

name: No-Bake Chocolate Cake
instructions: In a small saucepan, add whipping cream. Let it come to a light simmer. Do not boil. Remove from heat and pour over 1 cup of chocolate chips. Let stand for 1 minute then stir lightly until mixture is very smooth. Let it sit for few minutes or until desired thickness is achieved.
Transfer the chocolate ganache into a cup with a pout and pour over all over the cake starting from the top all the way to the sides. Make sure that the rack has a tray underneath.
Decorate as desired. Slice and serve.
Make sure to read my RECIPE NOTES below for added TIPS. Enjoy!

name: No-Bake Crema de Fruta Cake
ingredients: fruit cocktail and/or peaches, pineapples, etc.
instructions: Silvanas
Lengua De Gato
Meringue Cookies
Caramel Cloud Cake

name: No-Bake Easy Cake
ingredients: Powdered sugar and cocoa for dusting
instructions: ​​Glaze a few strawberries and blueberries of choice for toppings. This step is optional.

Use 2 teaspoons of your pineapple juice to dilute the cornstarch and make a slurry. Over medium heat, pour the remaining pineapple juice and cornstarch slurry into a saucepan. Add 2 tablespoons sugar and stir. Cook for around 5 minutes or until slightly thick. Remove from heat and add 2 teaspoons of lemon juice. Mix and let cool. Spread on fruits using a basting brush.

name: No-Bake Jiggly Cheesecake Pudding
ingredients: 1 1/2 tbsp or 2 envelopes (.25 oz each) unflavored gelatin powder
1/4 cup + 1/2 cup + 1 cup fresh or 2% milk
instructions: ​Add cornstarch slurry. Simmer while constantly stirring until mixture is thick.
Remove from heat.
Add vanilla extract and gelatin-milk mixture. Stir until mixture is smooth.
Transfer to a pan lined with parchment paper.
Cool completely and refrigerate for 8 hours or more to set.
Invert the loaf pan into a serving tray and remove the parchment liner.
Dust the top with crushed graham crackers.
Slice, serve and enjoy.

name: No-Bake Yema Cake
instructions: In a bowl, mix all wet ingredients.
Sift all dry ingredients into the wet ingredients. Mix well until combined. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat egg whites.
Add cream of tartar. Beat until egg whites are frothy.
Gradually add sugar. Beat until soft peak.
Gently cut and fold the meringue into the cake batter until well combined.
Transfer into llanera mold or pan. Lightly tap the pan to remover air bubbles. Cover with foil.
Steam over medium heat for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from molds and cool on wire rack.

Prepare Yema filling. In a pot mix all the ingredients (except butter). Whisk until well combined. Cook over low fire until thick. Turn off heat then add butter and continue stirring until butter is fully dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool.
Spread yema to the cake. Top with grated cheese.
​Enjoy.

name: Oreo Cake
instructions: Warm up the milk for the cake by microwaving for one minute or heat up on a stove. Warm milk makes it easier for the Oreo crumbs to melt. This gives a much smooth cake batter.
If you have a blender, you can toss all of the ingredients and blend until smooth.

If you'd like to bake this cake instead, bake in a preheated oven at 350F for about 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean. Make sure to check before the set time as oven temperature varies.

No oven? No problem. Using your stovetop. Place a small round steel rack on a medium cooking pot. Turn on heat to medium-low. Place the pan with cake batter on the steel rack and cover the pot. Cook for about 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted on the center comes out clean.  Make sure the pot lid doesn't have a hole in it. If it does, make sure to fill the hole with a piece of cloth or parchment paper.

For the chocolate ganache, the longer it sits, the more it thickens so make sure to check for the consistency. If it happens to thicken and you forgot about it, you can microwave it for few seconds and stir.  You want to achieve a perfect drip, so it won't be too thin or too thick.
Store the cake in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

name: Panna Cotta with Sour Cream
ingredients: 2 cups heavy whipping cream or all-purpose cream

name: Panna Cotta /  Cooked Cream
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a saucepan.
Turn on the stove to medium heat. Stir constantly until it boils.
Remove from heat.
Transfer to molded containers and let it cool until set.
Refrigerate.
Serve with chopped mangoes or peaches.
Enjoy!

name: Papaya Jelly Cake
ingredients: about 3 cups fresh papaya, sliced, makes 1 cup papaya puree
2 packs, 25 grams each clear unflavored gelatin powder
1/2 cup heavy cream or all purpose cream
instructions: Prepare about 3 cups sliced fresh papaya. Use a food processor or a blender and pulse until smooth. Makes 1 cup papaya puree.
In a large bowl, stir together 3 cups water, 1 pack gelatin powder and 1/2 cup sugar. Mix until gelatin and sugar are dissolved.

Add papaya puree. Stir until well combined. Transfer into a cooking pot and turn heat to medium. Cook the mixture while stirring continuously until steaming hot (not boiling). Transfer into a pan or molder. Let it cool to set. (I used bundt pan and two small gelatin molds for the extra mixture.)
In a bowl, stir together 2 cups water, 1 pack gelatin powder and 1/4 cup sugar. Mix until gelatin and sugar are dissolved.

Add evaporated milk, condensed milk and cream. Mix until well combined. Transfer into a cooking pot. Turn the heat to medium and cook the mixture while stirring continuously until steaming hot (not boiling). Pour over the cooled papaya layer.
Cool completely and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Pastillas
ingredients: 2 cups powdered milk ( Anchor or Nido)

name: Pastimallows
ingredients: 1 cup powdered milk , you can use Anchor, Nido or Bear Brand
1/2 of the 14 oz can condensed milk
instructions: Click here to watch the VIDEO how to prepare

Combine powdered milk and condensed milk. Stir until well combined. Add more powdered milk if needed. Consistency must be thick.  (Adjustment depends on what brand of condensed milk and powdered milk being used.)
Cover the bowl and freeze for 30 minutes  or chill for 1 hour until the mixture becomes firm.
Scoop about half tbsp of mixture. Roll the mixture into a ball then flatten until mixture is enough to cover the marshmallow.
Coat with sugar or crushed grahams.
Place it in a mini cupcake liner.
Pastimallows can be chilled again for few minutes or can be served immediately.
Enjoy :)
Recipe yields about 30 pieces.

name: Peanut Brittle
instructions: Grease your measuring cup with oil then add corn syrup. Doing that will make it easier for you to pour the corn syrup into the pot without sticking from the measuring cup.

Use a wooden spoon when stirring the mixture. The syrup mixture will be too hot. Wooden spoon doesn't absorb much heat and will save your hand from burning if you use a regular spoon that's made from stainless steel. Any tool that has a wooden handle is highly recommended.
If thermometer is not available, you can tell when it is ready when boiling slows down and syrup starts to thicken.

Make sure that the pan is greased before transferring the mixture or else it will stick and will be hard to release. When unmolding, just bend the pan lightly and you will hear a crack at the bottom which means it is released.

When spreading into the pan, grease a spatula with wooden handle. Greasing will avoid sticking and wooden handle can handle the heat of the mixture. Also, the pan can get warmer so place it  in the cooling rack. It will cool faster and protect your surface from heat.
As you have read above, I used roasted and salted peanuts. If using unsalted, add 1 tsp salt.
Why use Baking Soda? Baking soda creates little air bubbles in the brittle which makes it crunchy.
When arranging in an airtight container, line up with a wax paper or parchment paper in between the peanut brittles to avoid sticking.
Store in an airtight container at room temperature. Do not refrigerate, moisture from the fridge will cause the brittle to soften. Store for 6-8 weeks.

name: Polvoron
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups powdered milk ( Anchor or Nido)
instructions: Toast the flour until brown in color. Remove from heat. Let it cool.
Melt the butter. Set aside.
Combine powdered milk, sugar and toasted flour.
Add the melted butter and mix until well combined. Make sure you break the lumps while stirring the mixture.
Divide polvoron mixture if you want to add other flavors (2 tbsp of each like peanuts, cashew, etc.).
Press the mould in the Polvoron mixture till you have filled up the cavity, it’s okay that it is overflowing a bit.
On a plate, press the mould to make the mixture more compacted.

Push the ejector handle to release the moulded Polvoron, if it is still sticking to the flat metal plate, gently hold the sides of the Polvoron with your thumb and forefinger and move it a little bit, it will release itself.
Use a cellophane wrapper to wrap the molded Polvoron.
Serve, share and Enjoy! ​

name: Pichi-Pichi
ingredients: 2 cups grated cassava or 1 package (16 oz) frozen grated cassava
Fresh grated coconut for topping or sweetened coconut flakes
instructions: Combine grated cassava, sugar, water and pandan essence.
Add lye water (lihiya) while mixing.
Pour into individual molds.
Steam for 30-35 minutes or until the mixture becomes translucent.
Remove from the steamer and let the temperature cools down.
Remove from molds and roll over the grated coconut.
Serve & Enjoy!

name: Pinipig Ice Candy
instructions: In a pan, toast pinipig over medium heat until color turns golden.
In a large bowl,  combine coconut milk, water and sugar. Stir until sugar is fully dissolved.
Using a funnel add desired amount of pinipig and pour blended mixture in an ice candy bag. ( I used 1 1/2" x  10") and knot closed.
Repeat with remaining buko pandan mixture.
Freeze overnight before serving.
Recipe yields about 12-15 ice candies.

name: Pudding Pie
ingredients: 8" or 9" ready made graham pie crust
instructions: Beat milk and pudding mix with whisk for 2 minutes.
Let stand for 5 minutes.
Pour at once into graham pie crust.
Refrigerate at least 1 hour or until set.
Top each serving with whipped topping.
Enjoy!​

name: Raffaello
ingredients: 15-18 pieces whole almond or macadamia nuts
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine dessicated coconut and condensed milk. Mix until fully combined.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until hard enough to form a ball.
Grab a dallop of the mixture, add almond or macadamia nut in the middle and roll using the palm of your hands to form  ball.
Roll in dessicated coconut until fully coated.
Place in a candy paper or mini baking cups.
Continue until the whole batch is finished.
Refrigerate before serving.
Recipe yields about 15-18 pieces.
Enjoy.

name: Rocky Road Ice Cream
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups heavy whipping cream (all purpose cream can be substituted)
instructions: Beat the heavy whipping cream until thick, about 5 minutes.
Add the condensed milk. Beat until just combined.
Add the milo chocolate powder. Continue beating until mixture is fully combined.
Stir-in marshmallows, peanuts and chocolate chips.
Pour the ice cream mixture into a standard loaf pan, cover with plastic food wrap and press against the ice cream.
Freeze until completely firm, about 6 hours or overnight.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Taro Ice Cream
ingredients: 1 to 1-1/2 lbs or 1/2 kilo small taro, peeled,
1 (14-ounce) can sweetened condensed milk, adjust accordingly
instructions: Peel off the taro skin with a knife or a peeler. (make sure to wear gloves or oil your hands when handling taro). Rinse thoroughly.
Boil the peeled taro for 25-30 minutes or until taro is soft.
​Add boiled taro into a blender. Blend until completely smooth. (If a blender is not available, you can mash the boiled taro with a fork until really smooth.)
Add the condensed milk and mix to combine.
In a large mixing bowl, add the cream. Whip on medium-high speed until thick.
Add the taro mixture and beat just until just combined then gently fold together with a rubber spatula until completely combined.
Pour the ice cream mixture into a standard loaf pan, cover with plastic wrap, press against the ice cream and freeze until completely firm, about 6 hours or overnight.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Tiramisu
ingredients: 1 cup mascarpone cheese, room temperature  (to substitute, see below)
1  1/2 cups espresso or strong coffee, room temperature
instructions: ​Do not over beat the whipping cream after adding the mascarpone cheese. Beat until just combine or until the mixture forms a stiff peak. If you over beat, the mixture will be runny and will be wasted.
​When dipping ladyfingers into the coffee, just dunk it quickly. Do not soak as the biscuits will fall apart.​
1 tbsp liquor or brandy can be added  to the coffee if desired.

For mascarpone substitute,  blend 8 ounces softened cream cheese with 1/4 cup heavy cream and 2 tablespoons softened unsalted butter . This an option I found online and I have not tried it myself just for your information if mascarpone cheese is not available in your area.
if you are in the Philippines, Broas is the closest you can substitute for ladyfingers.

name: Tiramisu Truffles
ingredients: 5oz / 140g ladyfingers (about 16 pieces or 1 3/4 cups when crushed)
instructions: Ladyfingers can be substituted with Broas or Mamon Tostado.
Powdered sugar can be adjusted accordingly.
If you will serve this with kids or those you are very sensitive to caffeine, you can omit the coffee or make it decaffeinated.
If it will be served to an adult party, you can add liquor into the coffee if you like.
To substitute mascarpone, beat together 8oz/226g softened cream cheese, 2 tbsp softened butter and 1/4 cup whipping cream until smooth and creamy.
These truffles need to be stored in the refrigerator placed in airtight container  and serve within 5 days.
If you plan to make it ahead, make the truffles then freeze. Thaw then dust with cocoa powder before serving.
Recipe yields about 20-25 truffles.

name: Turon
ingredients: 5 saba (Cardaba banana) cut in half lengthwise
1/2 cup ripe jackfruit (langka) cut into wide strips (optional)
cooking oil enough for deep frying
instructions: Roll each sliced saba banana in brown sugar.
Place the coated sliced banana in the spring roll wrapper.
Add 2 pcs of jackfruits strips.
Wrap and roll into shape of an egg roll.
Heat the cooking oil in a pan.
Fry in deep oil. Sprinkle some brown sugar on top of the turon.
Fry until the color turns golden brown.
Remove from pan and put in a strainer to drain the oil.
Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Ube Cheese Ice Candy
instructions: In a large bowl,  combine coconut milk, water, sugar and ube extract. Stir until sugar is fully dissolved.
Add desired amount of grated cheese inside the ice candy bag.
Using a funnel, pour blended mixture in an ice candy bag ( I used 1 1/2" x  10") with cheese and knot tightly closed.
Repeat with remaining mixture.
Freeze overnight before serving.
Recipe yields about 12-15 ice candies.

ingredients: 5 saba (Cardaba banana) cut in half lengthwise
1/2 cup ripe jackfruit (langka) cut into wide strips (optional)
cooking oil enough for deep frying
instructions: Roll each sliced saba banana in brown sugar.
Place the coated sliced banana in the spring roll wrapper.
Add 2 pcs of jackfruits strips.
Wrap and roll into shape of an egg roll.
Heat the cooking oil in a pan.
Fry in deep oil. Sprinkle some brown sugar on top of the turon.
Fry until the color turns golden brown.
Remove from pan and put in a strainer to drain the oil.
Serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Ube Halaya/Purple Yam Jam
instructions: Recipe yields four 8 ounces jars and one 7 x 4 x 2 container or 3 Lyanera/Llyanera moulds.
1 kilo purple yam can be substituted with 2 (16oz) packs of store-bought ready to use grated ube.
If you have a food processor or blender, use it instead of grating the yam.
You can omit or add 1/2 can more condensed milk. It will depend on your sweetness preference.
You can also toss all ingredients, except butter in blender and transfer to the pan with heated butter.
When serving, you can top your Ube Halaya with Latik or Grated Cheese.
Ube Jam or Ube halaya can be used as a filling for bread recipes, cakes, cookies and more. I have a list of recommended recipes.
Ube Crinkles, Pan de Ube, Ube Mamon, Ube Cake, Ube Buchi, Ube Kalamay, Ube Ice Cream, Ube Bar and more!​
If you try this recipe, let me know what you think about this recipe. Comment section below. Enjoy!

name: StrawberTry Mango Sago
ingredients: 2 pieces ripe mangoes (cut into small cubes)
3/4 cup to 1 cup  all-purpose cream or whipping cream
instructions: Boil 4 cups water in a sauce pan.  Add sago. Boil until the pearls are cooked or color becomes clear, about 12 minutes. Drain and rinse in cold water. Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine evaporated milk, condensed milk and all purpose cream. Mix until well incorporated.
Add the fruits and cooked sago. Stir to combine.
Refrigerate before serving.
Serve insmall individual cups and enjoy.

name: Sweet Red Beans
instructions: Soak the red beans in cold water for 30 minutes. Drain.
In a clean pot, place red beans and 7 cups of water, cover, and let it simmer at low heat for 45 mins or until the beans are soft.
Add 1 cup of sugar. Stir and simmer for another 15 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Transfer 4 tablespoons of sweet red beans, 2 tbsp cream corn and 3 tbsp coconut milk in a bowl.
Stir and serve.
Enjoy!

name: Ube Banana Langka Roll
ingredients: ripe jackfruit (langka) cut into thin strips
cooking oil enough for deep frying
instructions: Place about 3 tbsp mashed banana, few pieces of langka,  1 tbsp halayang ube in the spring roll wrapper. Sprinkle some brown sugar.
Wrap and roll into shape of an egg roll.
Heat the cooking oil in a pan. Sprinkle some brown sugar on top of the roll.
Fry the banana roll in medium heat until the color turns golden brown.
Remove from pan and put in a strainer to drain the oil.
Serve and Enjoy!​

name: Ube Banana Langka Turon with Pineapple Rum Sauce
instructions: ​Slice each banana into 4 pieces (lengthwise). The saba banana I got are large so I sliced them into four. If using small, just slice it in half.
Lay the wrapper flat on a clean surface with one corner or edge facing or pointing towards you.

Place one piece sliced banana, about 3-4 langka strips and 1-2 tbsp ube jam then add another piece of banana. Roll it up then fold both sides towards the middle then tuck in both ends, roll tightly until 2 inches of wrapper remain. Brush or moisten with water to seal the edges and finish rolling. Repeat the process on remaining banana.
Heat cooking in a deep pan and drop the lumpia in hot oil. Do not overcrowd the pan. Fry until crispy and golden. Remove from oil and drain. Set aside.

In a separate pan or wok, melt margarine or butter. Add langka, cinnamon powder and rum. Cook for about 2 minutes. Add pineapple juice and let it boil then add brown sugar. Continue cooking until sugar caramelizes and sauce is thick.
Add the fried banana rolls and quickly toss until evenly coated. Immediately remove the pan.  Serve while warm. Enjoy!

name: Ube Buchi
ingredients: 1 1/2 to 1 3/4 cups glutinous rice flour (adjust accordingly)
instructions: Prepare 1 cup of glutinous rice flour in a bowl. Set aside.
In a bowl, combine coating ingredients together. Set aside.
​In a small pot, combine water and sugar together. Simmer until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat then add to the prepared flour. Mix until smooth.
Add the remaining flour. Add more if needed depending on consistency. Please the video what it should look like.
Knead until a dough is formed.
Add vegetable oil. (This is optional. It just makes the dough easy to manage. Will not be a big deal if you add it or not). Knead until just combined.
Form into a log. Divide into 10 equal parts.
Flatten each dough with your fingers to make a round shape
Place about 1 tsp Ube filling on the center.
Gather all the sides and pinch together. Seal well.
Roll using the palm of your hands to make a nice round shape.
Dip the rice balls on coating mixture. Make sure all sides are covered.
Roll the coated rice balls in sesame seeds.
Heat oil in a deep pan.
Deep fry the sesame balls. Cook until
Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve warm.
Enjoy :)

name: ​Ube Crinkles
ingredients: 1/2 cup ube jam/halaya or make it from scratch using my ube halaya recipe
instructions: Scoop about 1 tbsp of mixture and roll into a ball.
Coat with powdered sugar. Coat again to get  a nice  powdered cracks on top after baking.
Place on baking sheet lined with silicone baking mat or parchment paper spacing them at least 2" apart.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350F for 10-12 minutes or until nearly set. (They should be soft when touched and should appear slightly under-baked. )
Allow to cool a minute or two on the sheets before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Serve and enjoy.
Left overs can be stored in an airtight container.
Recipe yields 25-30 cookies.

name: ​Ube Graham de Leche in a Cup
ingredients: 2 1/2 tbsp sugar (caramel for each flan mold or llanera)
2 cups heavy whipping cream or all purpose cream
1/4 cup condensed milk, chilled for 6 hours or overnight (adjust according to sweetness preference)
instructions: Use any piping tip desired for the cream. I used 4B but you can also use 1M or 2D.
Layer the cup however you like it. Graham can be added first then the cream. It's up to you.
Recipe yields 4 small plastic cups.
Leche flan recipe yields about 3 llanera molds. You can cut the recipe in half since we will only be using 1 for this recipe.
If you would like to use all the flan, adjust the ube cream mixture. You can triple or quadruple the measurements.

name: Ube Macapuno Ice Cream
ingredients: Rocky Road Ice Cream using Milo
instructions: In a large bowl, beat cream until thick.
Add condensed milk and beat to combine.
Add jam, macapuno and ube extract. Beat until all ingredients are fully incorporated.
Transfer to a loaf pan and container of juice,
Pour the ice cream mixture into a standard loaf pan, cover with plastic food wrap and press against the ice cream.
Freeze until completely firm, about 6 hours or overnight.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Avocado Toast
ingredients: 2 slices bread, white or whole grain, toasted
instructions: In a small bowl, mash the avocado and combine with lime juice, salt and pepper.
​Spread the mixture on each toasted bread.
Top with egg.
Sprinkle with pepper flakes if desired.
Enjoy this yummy and healthy breakfast treat!

ingredients: fruits of your choice e.g. banana, strawberries, blueberries
instructions: Sift dry ingredients together into a mixing bowl.
Add beaten egg, buttermilk and oil.
Beat just until batter is smooth. Do not overbeat!
Drop batter onto a hot, greased griddle.
Cook until top is full of tiny bubbles and the underside is brown.
Turn and brown on the other side.
Top with butter and fruits of choice.
Enjoy!

name: Banana Nutella Pancake Stacks
ingredients: fruits of your choice e.g. banana, strawberries, blueberries
instructions: Sift dry ingredients together into a mixing bowl.
Add beaten egg, buttermilk and oil.
Beat just until batter is smooth. Do not overbeat!
Drop batter onto a hot, greased griddle.
Cook until top is full of tiny bubbles and the underside is brown.
Turn and brown on the other side.
Serve pancakes stacked with nutella spread and sliced bananas.
Sprinkle top with powdered sugar.
Enjoy!

name: ​Beef Tapa
instructions: Combine marinade. Stir well..
Arrange meat in a container or ziploc bag.
Pour marinade. Make sure the beef is fully coated with marinade.
Cover and refrigerate overnight. Turn at least once.
In a pan with cooking oil. Fry the marinated beef until lightly brown.
Serve with sunny side up eggs and plain rice or garlic rice.
Enjoy!​​​

name: Banana Pancake
ingredients: 1 cup pancake mix (I used Bisquick, you can use other pancake mix but get a good brand.)
1 tbsp sugar (adjust according to your preference)
2 medium overripe banana, about 1/2 cup-3/4 cup when mashed
1/2 cup whole milk, you can also use almond milk
instructions: Combine pancake mix, sugar and baking powder. Mix until well combined.
Add, milk, eggs, mashed bananas and vanilla extract. Whisk until blended.
Let it sit on the counter for 5-10 minutes. I find it fluffier when I do this.
Heat up a pan or griddle. I used an 8" pan.
Add a small amount of butter or margarine.
Pour 1/3 of the batter into the pan or griddle.
Cook in low heat and cover for about 2 1/2 minutes or until it starts to bubble and edges are dry.
Flip the pan (which I can't do lol) or use a spatula to lift it and flip to cook the other side.
Cook until golden.
Transfer to a serving plate.
Serve or top with your favorite fruits, syrup and sprinkle with powdered sugar.
Recipe yields 3 (8") pancakes.
Enjoy.
Please scroll down for more recipes to try.

name: Buttermilk Pancakes
ingredients: fruits of your choice e.g. banana, strawberries, blueberries
instructions: Sift dry ingredients together into a mixing bowl.
Add beaten egg, buttermilk and oil.
Beat just until batter is smooth. Do not overbeat!
Drop batter onto a hot, greased griddle.
Cook until top is full of tiny bubbles and the underside is brown.
Turn and brown on the other side.
Top with butter and fruits of choice.
Enjoy!

name: Buttermilk Waffles
instructions: In a mixing bowl, stir dry ingredients together.
Add beaten egg, buttermilk and oil. Beat just until batter is smooth.
Spray a waffle iron with nonstick spray or brush with oil, heat waffle iron.
Pour mixture into waffle iron and bake until waffles are golden brown.
Serve, using any of the following garnishes: Maple or other flavored syrup, whipped butter, powdered sugar, whipped cream, fruit sauce and/or fresh fruit, chocolate sauce, molasses or even ice cream!

name: Chocolate Bombs
ingredients: Semi-sweet chocolate chips or any chocolate bar of choice or almond bark, I used about 1 cup of chocolate chips to make 6 chocolate bombs
chocolate milk powder or cocoa powder, I used Milo chocolate powder mix
instructions: You can also microwave the chocolate in increments of  20-30 seconds. Do not overdo it or else the chocolate will be dry. Melting it on a heated proof bowl over a pan with boiling water (double boiler) gives a good result and I highly suggest to use that. ​
Make sure to wipe or clean the molds diligently as any residue will affect the result e.g. the chocolate sphere will not be as shiny or they will have holes.

Evenly coat the spheres from bottom to the sides paying attention to the edges.  If coating on the edges are too thin, they will crack when you release it from the mold.  You can do a first coat, freeze, then coat a thin layer again. Either way, it works.

If your chocolate bomb was molded too thick, the steaming hot milk will have a hard time melting it in a mug. You'll miss the fun part. The chocolate bomb will still melt because of the hot milk but you have force it with a spoon. You don't want that.

When melting the 2nd half's edges or rim over the hot pan, do not re-use the part with melted chocolate already. If you do this, it will ruin your 2nd sphere and will have to repeat the process. Use the clean area of the pan.

If you will decorate with white chocolate like how I did, melt the chocolate like how you melted the chocolate for the sphere. Transfer to a piping bag then cut the tip to make a very small hole. Immediately decorate with sprinkles. You don't want the white chocolate to dry up and the sprinkles won't stick.
Consume the chocolate bombs within 24 hours for best results or store a room temperature for up to 5 days.
I hope all these tips helps you make these amazing Chocolate Bombs.

name: Corned Beef with Potatoes
ingredients: 1 can (11.5 oz) corned beef (I used Ox & Palm or Palm Brand )
instructions: Heat 2 tbsp of cooking oil in a pan or wok.
Pan fry potatoes until tender. Remove from pan. Set aside.
Using the same pan, saute garlic, cook until color turns light brown.
Add onion. Cook until translucent then add tomatoes and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the corned beef. Stir to combine and cook for about 5 minutes.
Season with salt according to your taste.
Best serve with white steamed rice and fried egg if you will be preparing it for breakfast.
Enjoy :)

name: Champorado​
instructions: Rinse the rice until water runs clear.
In a pot, boil the rice and water.
Bring to a boil, cook in low heat for about 15 minutes (or until the glutinous rice is cooked) while constantly stirring.
Add the cocoa powder, sugar and vanilla.
Cook for another 5 minutes or until the texture becomes thick.
Remove from heat.
Transfer to a serving bowl and top with condensed milk.
Enjoy!

name: Chicken Tocino​
instructions: Pound chicken with a meat mallet until flat. Set aside.
Combine marinade. Stir well.
Marinade chicken in mixture.
Cover and refrigerate overnight. Turn at least once.
Pan-fry in cooking oil.
Serve with sunny side up eggs and plain rice or garlic rice.
Enjoy!

name: Daing na Bangus
ingredients: 1 whole milkfish (bangus), cleaned & sliced daing-style (butterfly cut)​
instructions: Combine marinade. Stir.
Arrange bangus in a container or ziploc bag.
Pour marinade. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Turn at least once.
Fry until brown.
Serve with tomatoes and or salted egg and plain rice or fried rice.
Or serve with Pickled Papaya or what we call Atchara. Link for the recipe below.
Enjoy!

name: Japanese Souffle' Pancakes
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together egg yolks, milk and vanilla.
Sift all purpose flour and baking powder.
In another bowl, using a hand mixer, beat egg whites and cream of tartar.
Gradually add sugar while continue beating until stiff peak.
Gently cut and fold the meringue into the cake batter until well combined.
Heat a large non-sticky frying pan and lightly grease with butter or oil. Place a food ring lined with parchment paper. Pour souffle mixture into the molder. Fill half way up the ring molder.

If a food ring is not available, stack up about 2-3 scoops of batter. When the bottom starts to dry up, add more batter on top then continue cooking at the lowest heat setting. (The ring also helps them achieve a better height as they cook up instead of spreading out. If you make them free form, they just likely won’t be as round and may not rise as high.)

Drop 1 tablespoon of water to empty spaces in the frying pan to add moisture in the pan. Cover and cook over low heat for about 4 to 5 minutes or until the bottom is slightly firm and golden brown.  Remove the ring molder and the parchment paper. Flip the souffle', add another 1 tbsp water around the pan. Cover again and cook for another 4-5 minutes or until cooked through.
Dust with powdered sugar and drizzle with syrup if desired. Serve with butter, syrup and fruits of choice.
Makes about 6 pancakes. Enjoy.

name: Mochi Waffles
ingredients: 1/2 tsp ube extract or pandan extract
instructions: You can also just make the waffle plain then drizzle with ube or pandan extract.
If Waffle Maker is not available, you can make Mochi Pancakes instead. Just add 1/4 cup all-purpose flour to the dry ingredients.
Make sure to great the waffle maker or pan (if making pancakes) to avoid sticking.

name: Paradadas / Corned Beef Pandesal
ingredients: 3/4 cup corned beef ( I used Palm brand)
instructions: Whisk the egg. Set aside.
Heat a very small amount of cooking oil in a pan.
Saute onion.
Add corned beef.
Cook for 3-5 minutes.
Remove from pan.
Fill the pandesal with corned beef.
Coat in scrambled egg.
In a another pan, heat a very small amount of cooking oil.
Fry the coated pandesal turning each side until egg is cooked.
Remove from the pan.
Drain on paper towel to remove excess excess oil.
Serve warm. Enjoy! ​

name: ​Skinless Longganisa
ingredients: 5-8 cloves garlic (add more if you prefer), crushed or finely chopped
1 tbsp all-purpose flour (can be substituted with 1/2 tbsp plain bread crumbs)
instructions: Combine all ground pork, brown sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, pepper and paprika. Mix until fully incorporated. Add garlic and flour or breadcrumbs and stir to combine.
Refrigerate for at least an hour.

Roll about 2-3 tbsp of the pork mixture in a 7"x 7" plastic food / cling wrap . Shape in to a small log about 2 1/2 to 3 inches and roll  tightly while pressing both sides. Continue rolling and secure the sides.
Freeze the Longganisa for at least 4 hours or until ready to cook.
If frozen overnight, thaw for at least 2 hours in the fridge before frying.
Unwrap and fry in batches in hot oil until fully cooked.
Serve with fried eggs and garlic or plain rice and vinegar dipping sauce.

name: Souffle' Pancake
ingredients: fruits of your choice e.g. banana, strawberries, blueberries
instructions: Pour batter into the pan and reduce the heat to low. Cook for 4 minutes.
Place the fruit on top of the pancake.
Place the pan in the pre-heated oven (middle rack) and bake for 4 minutes until the middle is just set.
Turn the oven to broil, move the pan to the top rack and leave in the oven for 1 - 1 1/2 minutes. (just browning the top; keep an eye on your pancake, it might burn the top).
Remove from the oven and transfer to a serving plate.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar.
Enjoy!

name: Strawberry French Toast Roll Ups
ingredients: 3-4 pieces strawberries, cut into small cubes
2 tsp powdered sugar + more for dusting
instructions: In a small bowl, combine cream cheese and powdered sugar.
In  another bowl, stir together strawberries and granulated sugar.
Trim edges of sliced breads and flatten with a rolling pin. (You can also use anything round like a wine bottle or glass container to use as a rolling pin.)
Spread the flattened bread with desired amount of cream cheese.  Scoop about 1 tbsp of sweetened strawberries. Fold and seal to make a roll.
In a medium bowl, make an egg wash. Combine egg, milk and cinnamon. Stir to combine. Dip the roll into the egg wash.
In a frying pan, heat 1- to 2 tbsp butter . Fry the rolls until sides are golden. Drain on paper towels.
Dust with powdered sugar if desired. Best served when warm.
Recipe yields 6-8 Strawberry French Toasts.
Enjoy.

name: Taho
ingredients: 1 package silken tofu or extra soft tofu
instructions: Transfer the tofu in glass, cup or bowl. Microwave the extra soft tofu for 1 - 1 1/2 minutes.
Remove from the microwave.
Add enough arnibal to sweeten. Add sago and lightly stir.
Serve warm.
Enjoy!  ​

name: Taho using Soy Milk
instructions: In a small pot, add the brown sugar
Caramelize or let the sugar dissolve. Stir occasionally.
Add the water. Let it boil until the sugar is fully dissolved.

name: Ube Champorado​
instructions: Combine rice and water in a deep pot.  Let it boil and stir occasionally. Continue boiling until the rice is fully cooked about 15-20 minutes.
Add sugar and condensed milk. Stir until fully dissolved.
Add ube halaya or ube jam. Stir until full combined.
Add coconut milk and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the ube flavor. Stir and cook until mixture becomes slightly thick.
Transfer to a bowl and top with evaporated milk. It can also be paired with tuyo or dried herring if desired.
Best served for breakfast or snack.
Yields up to 10 servings.
Left over can be warmed up in the microwave for about 1 minute. Add a small amount of water if mixture becomes too dry.

name: Avocado Shake
ingredients: 4 small ripe avocados, peeled and pitted
1/4 cup condensed milk / add more if needed

name: Black Gulaman with Sago
instructions: Boil water in a saucepan. Add in uncooked sago.
Stir to prevent sticking.
Cook until transparent.
Drain then rinse. Set aside.

name: Chocolate Bombs
ingredients: Semi-sweet chocolate chips or any chocolate bar of choice or almond bark, I used about 1 cup of chocolate chips to make 6 chocolate bombs
chocolate milk powder or cocoa powder, I used Milo chocolate powder mix
instructions: You can also microwave the chocolate in increments of  20-30 seconds. Do not overdo it or else the chocolate will be dry. Melting it on a heated proof bowl over a pan with boiling water (double boiler) gives a good result and I highly suggest to use that. ​
Make sure to wipe or clean the molds diligently as any residue will affect the result e.g. the chocolate sphere will not be as shiny or they will have holes.

Evenly coat the spheres from bottom to the sides paying attention to the edges.  If coating on the edges are too thin, they will crack when you release it from the mold.  You can do a first coat, freeze, then coat a thin layer again. Either way, it works.

If your chocolate bomb was molded too thick, the steaming hot milk will have a hard time melting it in a mug. You'll miss the fun part. The chocolate bomb will still melt because of the hot milk but you have force it with a spoon. You don't want that.

When melting the 2nd half's edges or rim over the hot pan, do not re-use the part with melted chocolate already. If you do this, it will ruin your 2nd sphere and will have to repeat the process. Use the clean area of the pan.

If you will decorate with white chocolate like how I did, melt the chocolate like how you melted the chocolate for the sphere. Transfer to a piping bag then cut the tip to make a very small hole. Immediately decorate with sprinkles. You don't want the white chocolate to dry up and the sprinkles won't stick.
Consume the chocolate bombs within 24 hours for best results or store a room temperature for up to 5 days.
I hope all these tips helps you make these amazing Chocolate Bombs.

name: Dalgona Coffee
instructions: ​In a medium bowl, combine coffee, sugar and water. Stir until coffee is fully dissolved.
Beat on high speed until mixture is light, fluffy and frothy. Texture should resemble like whipped cream. Kind of like foamy.
Add ice cubes in a tall cup or drinking glass.
Pour milk about 3/4 full.
Top with foamy mixture and stir.
Serve and enjoy.
Recipe yields 1 tall glass container.

name: Dalgona Milo
instructions: In a medium bowl, beat whipping cream until thick.
Add sugar and beat until sugar is completely dissolved.
Add Milo and beat until mixture is light and fluffy.
Add ice cubes in a tall cup or drinking glass.
Pour milk about 3/4 full.
Top with foamy mixture and stir.
Serve and enjoy.
Recipe yields 1 tall glass container.

name: Dalgona Strawberry
ingredients: 1/2 cup whipping cream or all-purpose cream (chilled)
1 tbsp strawberry flavor instant drink mix powder (Tang brand or similar)
Milk (whole, low fat, soy, almond, etc.)
Boba or tapioca pearls, cooked according to package instructions (optional)
Ice cubes or omit if you want hot milk
instructions: Beat whipping cream or all-purpose cream until thick.
Add  strawberry instant mix powder. Beat until light and fluffy.
Add ice cubes in a tall cup or drinking glass.  Add Boba or tapioca pearls if desired.
Pour milk about 3/4 full.
Top with foamy mixture and stir.
Top with Oreo cookies if desired.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Fruit Punch
instructions: Combine all ingredients together.
Add ice cubes.
Serve and Enjoy! ​​

name: Hot Chocolate Bombs
ingredients: Semi-sweet chocolate chips or any chocolate bar of choice or almond bark, I used about 1 cup of chocolate chips to make 6 chocolate bombs
chocolate milk powder or cocoa powder, I used Milo chocolate powder mix
instructions: You can also microwave the chocolate in increments of  20-30 seconds. Do not overdo it or else the chocolate will be dry. Melting it on a heated proof bowl over a pan with boiling water (double boiler) gives a good result and I highly suggest to use that. ​
Make sure to wipe or clean the molds diligently as any residue will affect the result e.g. the chocolate sphere will not be as shiny or they will have holes.

Evenly coat the spheres from bottom to the sides paying attention to the edges.  If coating on the edges are too thin, they will crack when you release it from the mold.  You can do a first coat, freeze, then coat a thin layer again. Either way, it works.

If your chocolate bomb was molded too thick, the steaming hot milk will have a hard time melting it in a mug. You'll miss the fun part. The chocolate bomb will still melt because of the hot milk but you have force it with a spoon. You don't want that.

When melting the 2nd half's edges or rim over the hot pan, do not re-use the part with melted chocolate already. If you do this, it will ruin your 2nd sphere and will have to repeat the process. Use the clean area of the pan.

If you will decorate with white chocolate like how I did, melt the chocolate like how you melted the chocolate for the sphere. Transfer to a piping bag then cut the tip to make a very small hole. Immediately decorate with sprinkles. You don't want the white chocolate to dry up and the sprinkles won't stick.
Consume the chocolate bombs within 24 hours for best results or store a room temperature for up to 5 days.
I hope all these tips helps you make these amazing Chocolate Bombs.

name: Margarita
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Serve in a salt-trimmed glass with a slice of lime.
I always serve mine with crackers with ﻿salmon spread﻿ or beef tacos.
Enjoy! ​

name: Melon Juice
ingredients: 3/4 cup powdered milk or 1/2 cup evaporated milk
instructions: Remove the seeds by scraping it with a spoon.
Grate the inside part of the cantaloupe.
Combine all ingredients in a pitcher. Stir until the well combined.
Add ice cubes.
Serve cold. Enjoy!​

name: Milk Tea
ingredients: 2 tbsp condensed milk, adjust according to sweetness preference
3 tbsp evaporated milk or whole milk
honey (to be added to tapioca pearls after cooking to avoid sticking)
instructions: Cook tapioca pearls according to package directions. If it's not provided, boil them in water for 25 minutes . Stir occasionally. Turn off the flame, cover and  leave it for 30 minutes. Strain and rinse in ice cold water. Transfer to a bowl with honey.
Boil 1 cup water.
Sip 2 bags of black tea. Let it cool.
Add cooked tapioca pearls onto a glass or cup.
Add condensed milk.
Add  black tea.
Add milk.
Add ice.
Stir.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Milk Tea with Boba
ingredients: 1/2 cup black tapioca pearls or boba
1/2 cup evaporated milk, fresh or whole milk
2 tbsp honey (to be added to tapioca pearls after cooking to avoid sticking)
instructions: Cook tapioca pearls according to package directions.
I've used two different brands before:
1. Boil in water for 25 minutes. Stir occasionally. Turn off heat, cover and  leave it for 30 minutes. Strain and rinse in ice cold water. Transfer to a bowl with honey.

2.  Add tapioca pearls in boiling water. Stir. Wait for the pearls to float. Cover and boil for 5-8 minutes. Turn off heat and leave it for another 5-8 minutes. Scoop out in a bowl and rest in cold water for 20 seconds. Scoop out into a dry bowl and add honey.
Boil 2 cups water. Sip 4 bags of black tea.
Prepare two tall glasses or cups.
Add desired amount of cooked tapioca pearls.
Add 1-2 condensed milk in each glass or cup.
Fill each cup with warm black tea. Stir until condensed milk is dissolved.
Add 1/4 cup milk and ice on each cup. Stir to combine.
Serve and enjoy!
Recipes makes 2 glasses or cups.

name: Mojito
instructions: Combine 8 mint leaves, lime juice and powdered sugar in a glass.
Mash using a cocktail muddler or a wooden spoon,
Be careful not to over muddle and completely tear the leaves to little pieces - just keep pressing on them until the drink is super fragrant.
Fill glass with ice.
Pour rum over ice.
Top with lemon-lime soda.
Garnish with lime slice and additional mint.
I serve it with crackers with salmon dip.
Enjoy :)

name: Strawberry Banana Shake
ingredients: 1 cup fresh milk or almond milk

name: Strawberry-mango Punch
instructions: Combine mango, strawberries and rum in  blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a pitcher.
Stir in soda.
Serve over ice.
Garnish with fresh strawberries if desired.
Serve with your favorite appetizer.
I served mine with easy homemade beef tacos.

name: Atchara
ingredients: 1 large green papaya or 3 cups when grated
1/2 tsp ground black pepper black pepper
1/3 cup carrots, julienned or slice into tiny strips
1 small or 1/3  cup red onion, thinly sliced
1 small or 1/3 cup red bell pepper, julienned or slice into tiny strips
instructions: 3 Steps to dehydrate the papaya:

name: Avocado Dip
ingredients: 5 small ripe hass avocados, peeled & pitted
instructions: In a small bowl, mash avocados until smooth.
Stir in tomatoes, onion, lime juice, hot sauce and salt to taste.
Serve with chips. (I suggest Tostitos with a hint of lime).
Enjoy!!!

name: Cream Cheese
instructions: In a medium saucepan. Bring water to a boil.
Set the heat to medium then add powdered milk. Stir until milk has fully dissolved.
Bring to a low simmer.
Add vinegar one at a time until milk curdles.
Remove from heat then transfer the mixture through a cheesecloth with strainer and bowl underneath.
Let it rest for about 10-15 minutes or until liquid has been fully drained. Do not squeeze.
Transfer the curdled milk to a blender or food processor then blend for about 1 minute. Add salt and continue blending until smooth.
If mixture is too dry, add some whey (liquid from the mixture), about 1 tsp at a time. Since I did not squeeze my cheese, I didn't add any whey.
Now, you can use this when making any recipes that require cream cheese.
This recipe yields about 3/4 cup cream cheese.

name: Ensaladang Labanos
instructions: Mix radish slices with salt and set aside for about 15-20 minutes or until the salt has melted. Mash and squeeze radish slices thoroughly in salt. Discard squeezed juice.
In a bowl mix in the tomatoes, vinegar & sugar.
Serve with fried seafood like, Bangus. Tilapia or Hasa-Hasa.
​Enjoy :)

name: Ensaladang Talong
instructions: Grill the eggplants until the skin are slightly singed and blistered in medium-high heat.  Turn the eggplants occasionally for even cooking.
Let it cool. Remove skin and detach the flesh from the stem part and roughly tear the flesh into chunky shreds.
Place all the ingredients in a medium bowl and mix all the ingredients are evenly distributed.
Best for TUYO (dried salted fish).

name: Italian Buttercream Frosting
ingredients: 2 cups or 16 ounces unsalted butter, room temperature cut into small pieces
instructions: In a medium saucepan add the 1 cup sugar and 1/3 cup water then place on medium-high heat until temperature reads 235-240 F.

While waiting to achieve your desired temperature for the sugar syrup, beat the egg whites until foamy. Add cream of tartar then slowly add in 1/3 cup of sugar and continue beating until soft peaks form.
When sugar syrup is ready, drizzle the sugar into the meringue immediately.
Continue beating until meringue is cool/tepid.
Add room temperature butter into running mixer one piece at a time.
Add vanilla .
Beat until butter is combined and mixture has reached a silky consistency.

ingredients: 2 cups or 16 ounces unsalted butter, room temperature cut into small pieces
instructions: In a medium saucepan add the 1 cup sugar and 1/3 cup water then place on medium-high heat until temperature reads 235-240 F.

While waiting to achieve your desired temperature for the sugar syrup, beat the egg whites until foamy. Add cream of tartar then slowly add in 1/3 cup of sugar and continue beating until soft peaks form.
When sugar syrup is ready, drizzle the sugar into the meringue immediately.
Continue beating until meringue is cool/tepid.
Add room temperature butter into running mixer one piece at a time.
Add vanilla .
Beat until butter is combined and mixture has reached a silky consistency.

name: Siopao Sauce
instructions: On a medium bowl, stir together cornstarch and water.
Add soy sauce and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Using a medium sauce pan, turn on heat to medium-low.
When hot enough, add vinegar and cook for about 20 seconds.
Add the sauce. Bring the heat to low and bring the sauce to a light boil.
Add star anise. Stir constantly and cook until sauce is thick.
Serve with Siopao Asado.
Enjoy.
Grill the eggplants until the skin are slightly singed and blistered in medium-high heat.  Turn the eggplants occasionally for even cooking.
Let it cool. Remove skin and detach the flesh from the stem part and roughly tear the flesh into chunky shreds.
Place all the ingredients in a medium bowl and mix all the ingredients are evenly distributed.
Best for TUYO (dried salted fish).

name: 3-Ingredient Banana Bar
ingredients: 2 cups rolled oats / old fashioned oats
1 cup mashed banana, about 2-3 medium bananas
1/3 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips plus more for topping (optional)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F/176C.
Line an 8x8 square baking dish or pan with parchment then grease with oil or butter. Set aside.
In a medium bowl, combine oats, banana and peanut butter. Stir until well combined then stir in chocolate chips if desired.
Transfer the mixture into the prepared pan then spread evenly. Top with more chocolate chips if desired.
Bake in a preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until  the top is golden and firm in the center.
Remove from the oven and let cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes then remove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack.
Slice, serve, and enjoy.
Store in an airtight container.

name: Avocado Tuna Lettuce Wrap
ingredients: 1 can , 5 oz tuna in water, fully drained
2 tbsp mayonnaise, (light mayo can be used)
instructions: In a small bowl, combine avocado, cilantro and lemon juice.  Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir until fully incorporated.
In another bowl, combine drained tuna, carrots, cucumber, mayonnaise and pickle relish. Add the avocado mixture and stir until just combined.
Arrange fresh lettuce on a plate and scoop desired amount of tuna salad.
Lettuce can be rolled if desired.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Cauliflower Rice
ingredients: 1-2 tbsp chopped parsley or green onions
instructions: If using a food processor, do not over process or the cauliflower will becomes mushy. Only pulse until it resembles the texture of the rice.
Once you have the cauliflower rice and plans to serve as a side dish, you can enjoy eating it raw but I highly recommend cooking it.
Leftover cauliflower rice can be stored in airtight container and refrigerate of up to 5 days.
You can also grate the cauliflower ahead of time. Place them in a zip bag with paper towels and store in the refrigerator for the 3-5 days or freeze for up to 1 month.

name: Crispy Vegetable Pancake
instructions: ​In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, cornstarch, salt, and turmeric powder then add the water. Whisk until well incorporated.
Add the vegetables and stir until vegetables are fully coated with the batter.

Over medium fire, heat about 2-3 tbsp cooking oil in an 8-inch pan.  Make sure before adding the mixture, the oil is hot enough. You can test the oil with a wooden spoon or chopstick by dipping it into hot oil. If the oil creates rapid bubbles around it, then it's ready.

Scoop the mixture into the pan with hot oil. Arrange as flat and thin as possible. Cook each side about 2-3 minutes or until each side is crispy, making sure to use a spatula to press the mixture into the pan in order to achieve a crispy texture.
While cooking, combine the sauce ingredients. Mix well.
When ready, remove the vegetable pancake from the pan and serve with the dipping sauce.
Recipe yields about 6 vegetable pancakes.

name: Green Juicing​
instructions: What I did was combined 1 piece lemon (skin removed), 1 green apple, 1/2 of medium cucumber, thumb size ginger (skin removed), 4 stalks celery and a small amount of water about 1/2 cup. Blend on high speed for about one minute. Then I added about 4 cups Spinach and continued blending for another one minute.
Pass through a sieve with cloth. Tightly squeeze all the juices out of the mixture.
Serve and enjoy!

The 2nd mixture I prepared was 1 orange (skin removed), 1 green apple, thumb size ginger (skin removed, 1/2 cucumber, 4 stalks celery, about 4 cups kale. For this one I did not add any water as I added an extra orange.
The 3rd juice was a combination of 1 orange, 1/2 cucumber, 4 stalks, celery, 1 lemon, thumb size ginger, 2 small carrots and Kale.  I added an extra water for this one.

These are best consumed the day you made them or up to 3 days for freshness. Using tight lids for your glass containers are highly suggested to prolong the life of your juices. Store them in your refrigerator.

name: Tofu & Kangkong in Oyster Sauce
ingredients: 1 14oz or 16oz pack of Tofu, firm or extra firm
3 tablespoons oyster sauce (add more depending on your taste)
instructions: Pressing the tofu holds its shape
Pressing avoids soggy and produces extra crispy tofu when fried
Bubbles form around the wooden spoon when oil is ready for frying
Do not let the oil reach smoking point as this produces an off burnt taste on whatever you are frying
To avoid burns from hot oil, always throw in whatever you are frying with a gentle, slow and outward toss of hand so that the oil splatters away from you.
Do not flip the tofu immediately when frying as the tofu might stick and break your tofu. Wait for it to brown and crisp before flipping.
Paper towels absorb excess oil well.

name: Chicken Cachiatore
ingredients: half a head of garlic, crushed
instructions: Wash chicken and pat dry.
Coat chicken pieces with flour and fry in oil over medium heat till light brown. Remove chicken and set aside.

name: Chicken with Pickles & Hotdog Bits
ingredients: 6 hotdogs (or more if you prefer) sliced diagonally into small pieces and fried
2 large pieces sweet pickles, sliced diagonally
2 cups tomato sauce or UFC banana catsup (or any sweet blend catsup)
1/4 cup fish sauce or 3 teaspoons salt
instructions: In large pot, saute garlic in 2 tablespoons vegetable oil.
Add the onions and cook until translucent. Set aside in the pot, and add the tomatoes in, saute alone until wilted.
Then mix with the onion and garlic. Add in the chicken and fish sauce. Stir and cover. Let simmer 8 minutes or until chicken is slightly tender.
Scrape off scum and chicken fat or oil from top of liquid.
Add in the pepper, stir, then the pickles and stir again. Let simmer 3 minutes.
Pour in the tomato sauce or catsup and let boil. Lower heat to simmer and add in the hotdogs and MSG, 3 minutes.
Taste sauce. Add more fish sauce to desired taste.
Turn heat off and serve with rice.

name: Coleslaw
instructions: Have a basin of iced water ready before you begin. Finely slice or shred the cabbage and carrots soaking it in the ice cold water after each slice. Strain the pineapple tidbits and the raisins. Then strain the shredded cabbage and carrots. In a large bowl or basin, toss altogether the cabbage, carrots, tidbits, and raisins. Sprinkle the salt a teaspoon at a time while tossing. Let stand for around 15 minutes so liquid will be released. Strain again. You may also use a clean cheesecloth to dry the ingredients. Place ingredients back in basin, add the mayonnaise and toss. Sprinkle with pepper if you desire.​
Serves 15 to 20 persons.

name: Custard Pie
ingredients: 1 3/4 cups shortening (Crisco) or use locally bought purico
instructions: For Custard:

name: Ensaladang Ampalaya
ingredients: 4 or 5 large ampalaya or bittergourd (approximately 2 kilos)
instructions: Have a basin of water with salt ready for soaking the ampalaya in.
Cut ampalaya in half, use a spoon to remove seeds and pit.
Cut diagonally into thin slices. Soak in the salted water for at least 30 minutes. Rinse thoroughly. Then pour warm water (not too hot or boiling) over the ampalaya and set aside.
Mix the vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper. Rinse ampalaya again and squeeze out excess water from the ampalaya.
Place ampalaya in a large salad bowl.
Pour in vinegar mixture and toss.
Garnish top with sliced boiled eggs, sliced tomatoes and boiled shrimp.

name: Ginataang Hipon with Kamias
ingredients: 1 Kilo Coconut milk (Kakang Gata plus second squeeze)
medium sized bowl of Kamias or Pias (around half a kilo) make sure to cut off the ends
5 pieces Green Pepper Fingerlings or Siling Panigang
1 medium sized Ginger sliced and minced
Half a head of Garlic minced
instructions: In a large pot on medium heat, pour in vegetable oil.
Saute ginger first to release taste, heat and aroma, until slightly brown in color.
Set aside in pot and add the garlic. Do not mix with the ginger yet.
Slightly brown the garlic, then add the onion and saute till translucent.
When both garlic and onion are cooked thru, mix with the ginger and saute a bit more.
Then add the prawns and fish sauce and stir occassionally until prawns turn a bit red in color.
Add the Kamias or Pias, stir and cover for 5 to 8 minutes.
Pour in the kakang gata, followed by the second sqeeze while stirring slowly.
Add only up till you reach the consistency you desire for the soup base of the dish.
Keep stirring to avoid curdling. Stir until it reaches boiling point. Let simmer for 5 minutes, then add the green pepper fingerlings and msg. Simmer another 5 minutes.
Turn heat off. Serves 12 to 15 people.* optional: if you prefer a thicker consistency for the soup base, you may add diced squash before the prawns and wait till tender before adding in the prawns.

name: Ginisang Sinigang
ingredients: 3 medium sized tomatoes (cut into small pieces)
3 grams sampaloc or tamarind (boiled until soft)
1 large raddish or labanos (sliced into circles then cut in half)
2 large eggplants or talong (sliced into circles and cut in half)
5 stalks pechay baguio (cut tip of stalk, slightly pound white part of stalk, then cut up into 1 inch slices including leaves)
instructions: First mash the boiled tamarind or sampaloc and set aside.
In a large pot, saute garlic, onions, and tomatoes.
Add in the chopped beef and let simmer until beef changes color.
Add in the fish sauce, cover and let simmer till beef is tender.
Use a strainer and pour in the boiled water with the mashed tamarind, extracting the juice from the tamarind.
Add more water to equal at least 10 cups liquid. Let boil.
Add more tamarind extract to your desired acidity. Then add the raddish first. Let simmer 8 minutes or until raddish is tender.
