Add in the eggplant, let simmer another 5 minutes. Then add the pechay baguio and siling panigang or fingerling peppers last. Cover and turn heat off.
The pechay and pepper will continue to cook at this point.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Kalabasa Bread
ingredients: 2 cups kalabasa (squash or pumpkin), pre-cooked and pureed or mashed
instructions: Preheat oven at 350 deg F.
You will need two 9 x 5 loaf pans.
Spread softened butter on bottom, sides, and corners. Set aside.
In bowl sift flour, baking soda, salt and mix with sugar.
In separate bowl, mix eggs, kalabasa, all-spice, cinnamon, ground cloves, water, olive oil and mix thoroughly.
Pour into flour mixture and mix, while mixing add in roasted cashew. Divide and pour into loaf pans.
Bake 1 hour. Check doneness by sticking clean barbeque stick or skewer in middle of loaf. If it comes out clean, then it's done.
Let cool 10 minutes.
Invert pan on plate to remove bread from pan.
With baked side up, cut into 1/4 inch slices.
Serve with hot coffee!

name: Kutsinta
instructions: Have steamer ready with boiling water, then set fire on low.
Mix all ingredients thoroughly making sure to rid it of lumps and that sugar is dissolved.
With a fine sieve, strain mixture.
Pour a 2/3 into small muffin pans (do not fill to brim).
Stir mixture constantly as you pour into pans, the flour and sugar mixture tend to settle.
Steam 25 mins.
Remove from steamer.
You will see the top is still of liquid consistency.
LET COOL to set.
Pour out remaining drops of liquid.
With butter knife loosen round edges until kutsinta moves freely in pan.
Transfer to plate and serve with grated coconut.​

name: Menudo
ingredients: 2 Kilos of Pork (diced or cut into cubes)
1/4 Kilo Liver (also diced or cut into cubes)
instructions: Mix calamansi or lemon juice with the soy sauce.
Marinate the pork and liver in this mixture for at least and hour. The longer it marinates the tastier it will get.
In a large pot, heat oil. Saute the garlic and onion, set aside inside the pan and add the tomatoes.
Let the tomatoes cook until wilted then stir with the garlic and onions.
Remove pork and liver from marinade (set marinade aside) and add to mixture.
Saute until pork changes color, then pour in marinade. Wait till it boils and add the bay leaves. Let simmer till pork is tender.
Then add the carrots and garbanzos, simmer 10 mins.
Add the potatoes, simmer 8 mins.
Add the bell pepper and raisins, simmer another 5 mins.
Pour in tomato sauce and salt. Add MSG (optional). Let reduce until sauce is of slightly thick consistency.

name: Mexican style Barbecue
instructions: Mix all spices, make sure ribs are dry then rub with mixture.
Grill the ribs that were rubbed with mixed spices. You may use a stove top grill or grill directly over charcoal.
Place grilled ribs in heavy metal or glass baking dish.
Pour a third of sauce mixture on top. Cover with aluminum foil.
Broil in oven at 185 or 200 degrees celcius for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven, turn ribs and pour in another third and return to oven.
Repeat and pour the last third of the sauce. Broil another 30 minutes.

name: Nilagang Manok
ingredients: 2 medium sized carrots (cut into 1 inch thick slices then cut in half)
2 medium sized potatoes (cut the same as the carrots)
2 Cans Asparagus Spears (you can also use fresh asparagus)
instructions: Wash and clean chicken pieces thoroughly.
After washing, place chicken pieces in a large pot, along with the quartered onions.
Start cooking chicken pieces and onions over medium heat. Cover.
After 5 minutes, check if chicken meat changed color.
Add the fish sauce, let simmer 5 minutes more.
Add the water and let boil.
Drop in the carrots, let simmer till half tender but not too soft, drop in the potatoes, let simmer some more until both carrots and potatoes are tender.
Then drop in the asparagus spears and add MSG. Simmer another 5 minutes. Taste.
You can add more fish sauce according to your taste.
Serve hot.

name: Pancit Bami
ingredients: 1 kilo pork and bones boiled for broth
1 kilo baguio beans (cut in a diagonal slant, and finely cut)
Tengang daga (dried mushroom soaked in water to soften then finely cut)
Pias, chopped coarsely, optional (you can use calamansi or lemon)
1 to 2 tbsps. atsuete seeds (soaked in 1 tsp lye water)
instructions: Meanwhile soak sotanghon in water to soften a bit and cut with scissors at folded ends.
Don't soak too long, just till it softens to be able to cut it. Throw out the water after cutting.
Put sotanghon in boiling red broth and stir continuously.
Lower heat when most of the broth has been absorbed by the sotanghon.
Add the bean-tengang daga mixture in batches and toss with sotanghon to distribute evenly.
Leave a batch for topping.
Turn heat off when cooked and no broth is left.
Serve topped with remaining batch of bean-tengang daga mixture, fried tokwa, chopped pias and crumble your fried garlic on top.

name: Pata Tim
ingredients: asparagus spears cut in length 2 inches
1/2 cup dried black mushrooms soaked in water (tengang daga)
instructions: Mix 4 cups water,with the soysauce, pineapple juice, half of cubed onion and star anise.
In large skillet, boil pata in this mixture. Let boil, lower heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove pata from skillet and set mixture aside.
In a turbo broiler or oven set at 250 degrees, broil for 40 minutes or until brown and firm.
While pata is cooking, saute garlic and remaining onion in skillet, then add in the mixture that was set aside and let simmer.
Take broiled pata and cut meat off bone.
Add to the simmering mixture.
Add in the asparagus and black mushroom (make sure to take off the hard parts). Simmer a few minutes.
Add in brown sugar.
Mix flour with the remaining 1 cup water.
Add this in while stirring just to thicken mixture a bit.
Simmer 5 minutes more to cook thickening agent.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Puto Pao
instructions: In a bowl, combine flour, powdered milk, sugar, baking powder and water. Mix well until smooth. Set aside.
In separate bowl, mix cream of tartar with egg whites.
Beat on high and gradually add the sugar. Continue beating on high until you reach stiff peak stage.
Pour egg white mixture into batter and fold until well mixed. Do not overmix.
Pour batter in small greased muffin cups, about a third full. Add a tablespoon of filling in each cup. Cover the filling with another layer of batter until muffin cup is two-thirds full.
Top with sliced salted red eggs and steam for 10 to 15 minutes.
You may also use 9x4" loaf pans or 9" cake pan but double your steaming time (20 to 30 minutes).
In a bowl, combine flour, powdered milk, sugar, baking powder and water. Mix well until smooth. Set aside.
In separate bowl, mix cream of tartar with egg whites.
Beat on high and gradually add the sugar. Continue beating on high until you reach stiff peak stage.
Pour egg white mixture into batter and fold until well mixed. Do not overmix.
Pour batter in small greased muffin cups, about a third full. Add a tablespoon of filling in each cup. Cover the filling with another layer of batter until muffin cup is two-thirds full.
Top with sliced salted red eggs and steam for 10 to 15 minutes.
You may also use 9x4" loaf pans or 9" cake pan but double your steaming time (20 to 30 minutes).​​

name: Relyenong Ampalaya
ingredients: 2 to 3 large red bell peppers, chopped coarsely
1 tsp iodized salt (or 1/8 cup fish sauce)
1 sachet Maggi Magic Sarap or seasoning of choice
generous amount of salt for brine
instructions: Wash ampalaya, cut in the middle crosswise. If ampalaya is too long, cut into 2" to 3" sections.
Scrape core with spoon. Rub insides with rock salt, add a generous amount of rock salt (about a handful) and cover with water. Let stand 15 to 20 mins. Rinse thoroughly and set aside.
In skillet, saute garlic and onion.
Add in pork and continue stirring until pork changes color or browns.
Season with pepper, salt (or fish sauce), and Magic Sarap. Let simmer until juices dry.
Add in bell pepper and raisins. Stir. Let cook 5 to 10 mins. Set aside and let cool.
When pork mixture has cooled, add beaten eggs. Stuff pork mixture into ampalaya.

name: Sweet & Sour Meatballs
ingredients: and 1/2 cup salad oil for frying.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Shape by rounded tablespoonfuls into balls.
In large skillet, cook meatballs in oil about 20 minutes.
For the sauce, add water to reserved pineapple syrup to measure 1 cup liquid.
Stir in the flour.
Add the vinegar, soy sauce, worcestershire sauce in a skillet.
Heat to boiling, stirring constantly. Boil and stir 1 minute.
Stir in sugar, salt, pepper. Reduce heat.
Add pineapple and green bell peppers; cook uncovered 10 minutes.
Stir in bean sprouts, water chestnuts and chili sauce; cook 5 minutes longer. You can add the meat balls in while cooking, or pour mixture on top of meatballs.

name: Tortang Alimasag / Crab Patties
ingredients: Meat from 2 kilos crabs (cooked, remove head and wash, set aside)
2 cups diced potstoes (fried in oil the drained)
instructions: In large skillet, saute garlic until light brown in color.
Add chopped onion and cook until translucent.
Add in the crabmeat and stir.
Add the red bellpeppers and cilantro, mix and let cook 5 minutes.
Season with salt, pepper and MSG.
Mix well and add the cook potatoes last. Set aside and let cool.
When crab meat cools, add the beaten eggs.
Stuff into crab heads and fry in vegetable oil with crab head in oil first, for 3 minutes.
Turn and cook meat side another 3 minutes or until golden brown in color. ***For leftover meat mixture, fry into patties.​

name: Carrot Cake
instructions: ¾ cup double cream cheese
¼ cup butter
2 cups icing sugar
½ teaspoon lemon zest (grated- yellow skin)
1 teaspoon vanilla

name: Chicken Cashew
instructions: Pour water in the sauteed garlic and onions, add sugar and mix well.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce and cornstarch, let it simmer for 2 .minutes.
Add the fried cubed chicken breasts, cashew nuts, carrots and spring onions.
Salt to taste.
Serve with steamed white rice.

name: Cheesecake with Cherries on Top
ingredients: CRUST:* 15 pcs graham crackers, crushed* 2  1/2 tbsp. butter, melted
instructions: Preheat oven to 175 degrees C (350 degrees F). Grease 9 inch round pan.

name: Cheesecake with Choco-Almond topping
instructions: Using a whire whisk, mix condensed milk and cocoa powder.
Cook mixture in a double broiler. Stir occasionally.
Add butter.
Spread over the cheesecake.​
Add crushed almonds.
Enjoy :)

name: Chocolate Crinkles
instructions: Mix together cocoa powder, sugar and vegetable oil.
Beat in eggs, one at a time. Stir in vanilla. Set aside.
On a separate container, combine the flour, baking powder and salt.
Stir into cocoa mixture. Mix until well combined.
Cover the dough and chill for at least 4 hours.
Preheat oven to 175deg C (350deg F).
Roll dough into balls (use your palm).
Use 1 tbsp scoop. Coat each ball in icing sugar before placing onto pan.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.
Let it cool.
Serve and enjoy :)

name: Chocolate Mint Cake
instructions: 1/2 cup butter, softened
2 cups icing sugar
1 tbsp water
8 pcs. fresh mint leaves, minced
1/4 tsp. green food coloring

name: Hamonadong Hubad ​
ingredients: 1 kilo pork pigue, sliced thinly (tapa style)
1 can (439 grams) pineapple chunks, drained (reserve syrup)

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 1 medium size potato, diced in small sizes

name: Thai Chicken ​
ingredients: 6 pcs lemon grass (cut each into 4 pcs)
½ tsp. crushed dried chilies or pepper flakes
instructions: In a large pot add olive oil, sauté garlic and onions.
Add chopped chicken, let it simmer for 10 minutes.
Add fish sauce and lemongrass, let it simmer for 10 minutes.
Dissolve coconut milk powder in 1 ½ cups water.
Add coconut milk mixture to the chicken and simmer for another 10 minutes.
Add crushed dried chilies or pepper flakes and salt.
Serve.

name: Ampalaya Ensalada
ingredients: 1 kilo ampalaya (thinly sliced,mashed with salt to remove bitter taste) rinsed and blanched.
5 pcs. eggs (hard boiled, each sliced into 6pcs.)
vinegar, salt, sugar, pepper (mixed to make a sweet-sour-salty salad syrup)

name: by Mylene
ingredients: 1 kilo ampalaya (thinly sliced,mashed with salt to remove bitter taste) rinsed and blanched.
5 pcs. eggs (hard boiled, each sliced into 6pcs.)
vinegar, salt, sugar, pepper (mixed to make a sweet-sour-salty salad syrup)

name: Apple Pie by AnnaLissa
ingredients: 5 small pink lady apples (if u want a bit sour use green apples)
instructions: Slice apples thinly then add all your ingredients but set aside a little bit of butter for later.
Cut your pastry into 4 squares and fill the middle with the apples.

Wrap like a parcel or if u want bigger pies cut the pastry into two. You can wrap them anyway you want as long as the filling is sealed. Any size will do as well. (See pics below). Adjust the baking time if needed.
Brush the pie with beaten egg before baking.
Bake at 400 deg F for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Brush again with a bit of butter after baking.
Sprinkle with a bit of brown sugar on top if you like them sweet.
Enjoy!

name: Beef in Red Wine Sauce by Amour
ingredients: 1  1/2 lb. beef chuck steak, cut into sm. cubes or strips
1 cup baby carrots or sliced carrots
Kitchen bouquet (or 1/2 tsp each dried parsley, thyme and basil)green peas (optional)
instructions: Brown meat in bacon grease, set aside.
Add onions and carrots; saute them.
In a dutch oven or slow cooker, Add beef, sauteed veggies, broth, garlic and spices at this time.
Add the red wine. Simmer for a few minutes and then add the cornstarch mixed with the beef broth to thicken the stew.
Simmer until tender adding broth if the sauce gets too thick, you may want to add some green peas. Serve over wide cooked noodles or rice.
Serves 4. Serve with steamed vegetables! ​

name: Beef Mechado by Anna May
instructions: Boil beef in onion, garlic, vinegar and soy sauce until beef becomes tender.
Heat butter in a pan. Fry potatoes and beef in butter. Set aside.
In another pan combine tomato sauce, 1/4 cup water and sauce from the boiled beef.
Add the beef, potatoes and capsicum and cook for few minutes.
Taste and add little seasoning as u like.
Enjoy :)

name: Bicol Express by Dallen
ingredients: 1 kilo pork belly (cut into small strips)
instructions: Saute garlic & onion then add the pork.
Cover and bring to a boil.
Add the coconut milk and simmer for 20 mins or until the pork is tender.
Add the green chile and salt to taste.
Serve hot with white rice.

name: Bread Pudding by Imelda
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
Grease an 8x8 baking dish.
In a saucepan, heat milk and all-purpose cream until warm.
Soak bread in warm milk mixture for a few minutes.
In another bowl, combine sugar,eggs, melted butter, salt and vanilla.
Mix well until thoroughly combined.
Mix in soaked bread and blend well.
Pour into prepared pan and bake over a water bath (bain-marie or baño Maria)until set, about an hour.
Let cool. ~~ENJOY!~~

name: Bringhe by Ate Marivic
instructions: Tenderize the gizzard in boiling water then boil the liver.
Slice both gizzard and liver lengthwise into strips.
Saute garlic and onions.
Add the turmeric powder.
Add the chicken breast, gizzard, liver, salt and stir.
Pour in the coconut milk.
Stir constantly and let boil for about 10 minutes.
Add the glutinous rice. Keep stirring until the rice cooks.
When nearly cooked, add the raisins and bellpepper strips a little at a time.
Garnish with boiled egg slices.
Transfer to a container with banana leaves. (optional)
​Enjoy!

name: Brownies by Imelda
instructions: Line a 9x13 pan.
Sift the 1st three ingredients.
Melt butter over low fire. Remove from fire and stir in the cocoa. Set aside.
In the bowl of the mixer, beat eggs and sugar for about 5 minutes at medium speed.
At low speed, stir in cocoa mixture, walnuts, vanilla and the sifted dry ingredients.
Pour into prepared pan and bake for 45 minutes.
Brush top with corn syrup. Cool and cut into bars. ​

name: Buttered Tilapia in Milk by Maricel
ingredients: Saute garlic,onion and ginger in butter. Add a small amount of water and let it boil.
Add the fish (tilapia) until it's cooked, together with pechay.
Pour a cup of evaporated milk.

name: Butterscotch by Imelda
instructions: Preheat oven to 325 deg F.
Grease and line a 9x13 pan.
Sift the dry ingredients (1st three) and set aside.
Melt butter over low fire then transfer into the bowl of the mixer.
Add the sugar, glucose and vanilla. Beat on medium just until combined.
Add eggs one a a time mixing until blended. And continue mixing at medium speed for 20 minutes.
At low speed add dry ingredients and the cashew nuts.
Pour into the prepared pan.
Bake 35-45 minutes or until top is firm.
Cool and cut into bars.

name: Cheesecake by Melissa
ingredients: CRUST:* 15 pcs graham crackers, crushed* 2  1/2 tbsp. butter, melted
instructions: Preheat oven to 175 degrees C (350 degrees F). Grease 9 inch round pan.

name: Chicken
instructions: In a pan or wok, saute, potato, carrots and bell pepper. Cook until tender. Set aside.
In the same pan or wok, saute garlic and onion.
Add the chicken and cook until tender. Add fish sauce in between.
Add the tomato sauce and liver spread. Simmer for 3-5 minutes.
Add the sauteed vegetables. Then add the water.
Add salt to taste and simmer for 5 minutes or until the sauce gets thick.

name: Caldereta by Mommy Zeny
instructions: In a pan or wok, saute, potato, carrots and bell pepper. Cook until tender. Set aside.
In the same pan or wok, saute garlic and onion.
Add the chicken and cook until tender. Add fish sauce in between.
Add the tomato sauce and liver spread. Simmer for 3-5 minutes.
Add the sauteed vegetables. Then add the water.
Add salt to taste and simmer for 5 minutes or until the sauce gets thick.

name: Chicken Cordon Bleu by Gj
ingredients: 4 pieces boneless chicken breast, about 6 ounces each
instructions: Add last 3 mixture.
Heat to just warm in microwave to help dissolve bouillon.
Melt butter in saucepan on low heat.
Add flour and stir until smooth and bubbly.
Add Milk mixture and heat.
Tenderize the gizzard in boiling water then boil the liver.
Slice both gizzard and liver lengthwise into strips.
Saute garlic and onions.
Add the turmeric powder.
Add the chicken breast, gizzard, liver, salt and stir.
Pour in the coconut milk.
Stir constantly and let boil for about 10 minutes.
Add the glutinous rice. Keep stirring until the rice cooks.
When nearly cooked, add the raisins and bellpepper strips a little at a time.
Garnish with boiled egg slices.
Transfer to a container with banana leaves. (optional)
​Enjoy!

name: Chicken Curry by Joanne
ingredients: 2 tbsp chicken curry (mckormick)(depends on ur taste)
instructions: 1. Fry chicken, set aside.
2. Fry carrots, set aside.
3. Fry potatoes, set aside.
4. Saute onion,garlic and ginger.
5. Add chicken, saute.
6. Add mckormicks (flavorings) cook for 3-5 minutes.
7. Add coconut milk 6-10 minutes.
8. Add pepper.
9. Add potatoes and carrots cook for 3 minutes.
10. Add bell peppers another 3 minutes
11. Add on chili ,
12. Adjust seasonings/flavorings
13. Serve with steamed rice.

name: Chicken Feet by Lily
ingredients: 1/4 tsp.salt(or you can add more according to your taste)
chopped siling labuyo or hot chili sauce
Sibot (*Sibot is a chinese herb used as flavor enhancer and tonic for good health available in chinese specialty shop or in spices section of SM mall)
instructions: 1. Wash with salt/water and peel the skin off the chicken feet.(If skin is too tight,dip it in boiling water for 1 to 2 minutes,drain and then quickly it dip in cold water). Chop off nails. Wash it again with baking soda/water(to rid the off smell). And lastly,rinse with water.Set aside.
2. Put 3/4 liter water in the pressure cooker. Add the chicken feet. Cover the lid. Make sure it's secured. Turn the flame to high heat.

3. Bring to boiling point for 25 minutes. Lower down the flame to medium and cook for 10 minutes more. Turn off the flame then bring pressure cooker on the sink and place under running water. (Warning:Use glove pot holder to avoid getting burned from hot steam. Step away quickly after turning the water faucet on. Open the lid only if no steam comes out anymore). Drain chicken feet. Set aside.

4. Saute garlic,ginger and onion in cooking oil. Add the chicken feet.Keep stirring until the color changes(a bit brownish). Mix in the spices.For Spicy Adobo:*Ground black pepper and bay leaf,soy sauce,vinegar,salt,magic sarap mix and brown sugar,add chopped siling labuyo or hot chili sauce before serving.For Sibot Recipe: *Sibot,salt,magic sarap mix.
5. Add 2 to 3 cups water,cover and cook for 5 to 20 minutes (if desiring a more tender chicken feet or until chicken broth turns a bit saucy in texture)

name: Chicken Pastel by Mommy Zeny
ingredients: 360g. or 1 can cream of mushroom soup
instructions: Melt butter in a saucepan.
Saute garlic and onion.
Add chicken. Cook until tender.
Add carrots, potatoes and bell pepper.
Add the mushrooms.
Pour-in cream of mushroom and chicken broth.
Allow to simmer for 5 minuters.
Stir-in vienna sausage and grated cheese.
Season with salt and pepper.
Let it simmer until vegetables are tender.
Serve at once.
Enjoy!

name: Chicken Pastel by Arlene
ingredients: 1 kilo chicken fillet cut into cubes
1 med. sized bell pepper cut into cubes
1 tetra pack Nestlé All Purpose Cream

name: Chicken Potato Noodle by Ruth
ingredients: 1/2 kilo chicken thigh fillet or breast
1/2 cup kikoman teriyaki sauce or enough to cover the chicken pieces
500 grams potato noodle (sold at Asian stores)
2 tbsp mushroom & oyster sauce or (oyster sauce will do)
any preferred vegetable (carrot, bokchoy, bell pepper, brocolli, fresh mushroom, celery)
instructions: Marinate chicken fillets or breast pieces in teriyaki sauce for at least 2 hours or overnight is better.
Cook the potato noodle as per package direction. (but half cook only). Set aside.
Heat cooking oil in a wok. Saute garlic and onion.
Add the marinated chicken pieces including the sauce.
Cook for 10 minutes or until the chicken pieces are cooked.
Add the vegetables. Cook until tender.
Stir-in potato noodles. Add hot water a little at a time when the noodles starts to dry out.
Stir-in sweet sauce and oyster sauce.
Cook for few minutes.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Enjoy!

name: Chicken Roll by John
ingredients: 8 to 10 pieces boneless chicken breast skin-on
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken breast in MARINADE preferably overnight.
2. Combine FILLING ingredients and mix well,keep in fridge overnight.
3. Flatten chicken breast using a mallet and put FILLING at the center just enough for you to roll the chicken breast.
4. Secure with string to hold the shape before rolling in foil.
5. Steam chicken rolls for 30 to 40 minutes and set aside to cool completely OR bake in oven 320 degrees F 45 minutes to 60 minutes.
6. Serve with ketchup and enjoy.

name: Choco Cookies ala Biboy by Imelda
instructions: Cream the butter and sugars until well blended.
Add-in the egg, beat well. add the vanilla, molasses and glucose. Mix thoroughly.
Add 1/2 cup of choco chips.

name: Coconut Curry Crab by John
instructions: Steam the crabs. Cut in halves. Set aside.
Saute' garlic, onion and ginger in a pan or wok with cooking oil.
Add the coconut milk. Let it simmer.
Add curry paste, pickled peppers and pepper juice.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the steamed crabs.
Best served with hot steamed rice.
Enjoy!

name: Coconut Macaroons by Dallen
instructions: Preheat the oven for 10 mins at 350 degree F.
Cream the margarine,gradually add the sugar. Beat well.
Add the milk, eggs and vanilla to the creamed margarine, blend thoroughly.
Add the dessicated coconut and flour and continue mixing until well blended.
Fill the paper cups with the coconut mixture and bake for 15-20 mins.

name: Crepe by Jason
ingredients: > vanilla ice cream or any flavor you prefer
instructions: > Place the wrapper in a plate then place sliced bananas into half part of the wrapper.
> Fold the wrapper into half.
> Drizzle with chocolate syrup.

name: Escabeche by Mommy Zeny
instructions: Fry fish and set aside.
In a pan or wok, saute ginger, garlic and onion.
Add water, salt and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add the vinegar. Do not stir. Bring to a boil.
When boiling, add the fried fish. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with hot rice.
Enjoy!

name: Espasol by Rowena
ingredients: 1 cup toasted ground malagkit or sweet rice flour
extra toasted sweet rice flour for dredging
instructions: Put coconut milk and sugar in a saucepan, heat until the sugar is melted then add the macapuno strips, bring to a gentle boil.
Gradually add the toasted ground sweet rice while stirring. The flour will absorb all the liquid and will form into a ball.
Lower the heat and cook for about 10 minutes with continuous stirring.
Turn off heat and let cool for about 10 minutes.

When the dough is cool enough to handle, You can divide it into balls and roll each ball into a mini log like a tootsie roll and dredged it in toasted flour or if you want it to be more fun and appetizing for the kids, cut it with different shapes using cookie cutters. Roll it first to your desired thickness in a floured surface then cut, dredge and serve.
Enjoy! ​​​

name: Ginataang Ampalaya by Jadycelle
ingredients: Ampalaya ( cut in half, remove the white part)
Gata ng niyog (2 piga, pagbukurin ng lalagyan ang 1st and 2nd na gata)
Baboy (pakuluan sa tubig na may asin at vetsin)
Tinapa (himayin, itabi ang ulo at katasan ito)

name: Ginisang Halaan by Tita Nene
ingredients: * 1/4 tsp. iodized salt or iodized rock salt
instructions: 1. Saute garlic, onion and ginger.
2. Add 8 cups of water then put halaan (clams ) until shells are open.
3. Season with 1 tsp of iodized salt or iodized rock salt.
4. Put siling pansigang.
5. Simmer until cooked.

name: Kilawin Tenga ng Baboy by Macquee
ingredients: 1 piece pig ear with *maskara (face part of the pig)
2 thumb-sized ginger; peeled, crushed then minced
1 piece medium-sized red bell pepper; slice into small parts
1 cup white vinegar; I prefer sukang *pinakurat (Iligan City specialty)
pinch of sugar; I don't use MSG
additional *siling labuyo* (Thai pepper, Bird's Eye Chili, chilli pepper, chili pepper, Cayenne pepper) for a stronger spice.
instructions: 1. Tenderize the pig ear with *maskara in a pan of *saline solution ( just enough water to cover the meat and enough salt to flavor). The time the meat to tenderize depends the age of the pig you used. TO be able to know if the meat is soft enough to be a kilawin is by using fork. If you can punch a hole in the ear with fork without using force, then the pork ear is well-done.
2. Drain water.

3. If it is clear from dripping water and if you can endure the heat, start slicing the ear and maskara in thin and long slices ( ideally one inch by 1/8 inch). It actually depends in your preference.
4. Put the sliced pig ear in a deep bowl. Add the onion, ginger red bell pepper. Mix!
5. Add the vinegar and mix.
6. Add the salt according to your taste.
7. Add a pinch of sugar.
8. If the desired flavor is achieved, add the tomato, spring onion and siling labuyo to finalize the dish!
9. Serve with newly-cooked rice.

name: Kinilaw na Tenga ng Baboy by Mom Zeny
ingredients: 3 tsp siling labuyo, chili pepper, chopped

name: Kutsinta by Anna Lissa
instructions: Mix flour and sugar.
Add water and mix properly making sure that there is no more lumps left .
Dissolve atsuete in a little bit of hot water with lye water then mix it with the flour mixture.
If you are not happy with the color you can add more atsuete.
Put the mixture in a little round container and steam for 20 minutess in low fire.

name: Lumpiang Sariwa by Gj
ingredients: 1 pack extra firm tofu sliced in strips
instructions: 1 cup all-purpose flour
2 pieces raw eggs
2 tbsp cooking oil
½ tsp salt
1½ cups milk

name: Majic Fresh Lumpia by Joy
instructions: 1. Saute garlic and onion in oil
2. Add fish, singkamas, carrot and green peas
3. Season with maggi magic sarap and add kinchay
4. Transfer in a plate to cool
5. Wrap 2 tbsp of the mixture and fry until golden brown.
***Servings: 4-6

name: Mixed Veggies in White Sauce by
ingredients: 16 oz mix veggie bag ( small bag)
1  (450 ml) table cream (big can nestle cream if available)
salt or patis ( fish sauce ) to taste
instructions: On a medium pan heat butter until it melts.
Saute garlic until golden brown, add onions (until clear or translucent).
Add the shrimp, 2 tsp salt and a pinch of pepper keep sauteing until the shrimp is cooked.
Remove shrimp from pan leaving a little bit of onions and garlic. Set it aside.
Pour the veggie mix on the pan. Add 1/2 cup of the water and let it simmer for 3-5 minutes (do this because some of the ready mixed veggies are bought frozen).
When it starts boiling, add water chestnuts (drained), young corn (drained), and the table cream then stir.
Depending on how tender u want the vegetables add the remaining 1/2 cup of water and let it boil.
You can add the shrimp and quail eggs and wait for the sauce to boil and thicken a little bit or you could just top it at the end!
Serve and enjoy!

name: Nachos by Mylene
ingredients: 3 pcs. tomatoes ( cut into small pieces)
1 small pouch cheese spread (put in a small plastic for easy spreading)
1 small pouch mayonnaise (put in a plastic for easy spreading)
2 packs of nova and v-cut chips(or any chips available)
instructions: Saute garlic, onion and ground pork, add salt to taste. Set aside.
In a plate put some chips, add tomatoes, cucumber and lettuce.
Add sauteed ground pork.
Spread with mayo and cheese.

name: Oven-Baked Spare Ribs by Melanie
ingredients: 1/2 tbsp crushed red pepper (or chili powder)
instructions: Combine the sugar, salt, and crushed red pepper (or chili powder) and mix well.
Put-in the garlic, worcestershire sauce or soysauce, barbeque sauce, and ground black pepper then mix it well.
Pour into the spareribs. Marinate for 3 hours.
Drain all the sauce from the spareribs and place them in a sauce pan.
Set aside the marinated sauce from the spareribs.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Bake for 30-45 minutes on both sides of the spareribs until dark brown.
While the spareribs is in the oven, brush the spareribs with the sauce.
Remove the Spareribs from the oven.
Serve and Enjoy!

name: Paella by AnnaLissa
ingredients: a pinch of saffron flower soaked in 1 tbsp hot water
instructions: Saute again 1/3 of the garlic and onion.
Add the tomatoes then add the capsicum.
Add the rice and cook for few minutes.
Add the soaked saffron flower and slowly add the chicken stock. Stir.
Cover and simmer.
When it starts to dry, stir and add the cooked seafood. (Leave some for decoration.)
Cover again and simmer in low heat for 15 minutes or until the rice is cooked.
Remove from heat. Add the cooked seafood that was set aside for decoration.
Serve straight from the pan or transfer to a serving plate.
Enjoy! ​

name: Pandan Crepe by Michael
instructions: 90g Jeeny’s palm sugar
1 tbs caster sugar
1 pandan leaf, knotted
50mls water
220 grams freshly grated coconut

name: Pasta Parmigianna by Joy
ingredients: 1/2 lb chicken breast fillets cut into pieces
1/2 cup cooking oil for frying chicken
1-1 lb bag or box Penne Pasta
1/4 tsp ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a cooking pot boil water and add Penne pasta. Cooked Al Dente. Drain and set aside.

name: Peach Cobbler by Beth
instructions: Drain peaches.
Layer the baking dish with following: 1 can peaches (drained), spread half of yellow cake mix over the slices peaches.
Then spread the other can of sliced peaches, pour some of the syrup over the peaches.
Spread the rest of the cake mix over the peaches.
Slice the block of butter and spread them over the cake mix.
Set the oven to 375 degrees and bake for about 45 mins, uncovered.Enjoy!

name: Pinakbet by Cielo
ingredients: 4 pcs eggplants cut into 4 diagonally or 5 pcs of round eggplant (talong) cut into 4
bagoong (shrimp paste) diluted in 1 cup water
instructions: Crush and spread the tomatoes on the bottom of the casserole dish.
Add the ginger and onion spreading evenly.
Add the eggplants and okra.
Pour the used oil and bagoong mixture.
Cover the casserole and toss the ingredients until well blended.
Add the ampalaya (bitter gourd).
Cover and cook in low fire.

name: Puto cake by Anna Liss
ingredients: 3 cups self-rising flour or cake flour
instructions: Beat the egg whites, sugar (1/4 cup), and cream of tartar until stiff.
In a separate bowl, combine self-rising flour or cake flour, sugar (1 cup), baking powder and water.
Carefully fold-in the egg white mix to the flour mix.
Transfer the puto batter to muffin pans or puto molds and fill up to 2/3 full.
Add cheese on top.
Place a cheesecloth in between the steamer tray to avoid water drips.
Steam for 20-25 minutes. Puto is ready when toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Remove from the steamer and transfer to a serving plate.

name: Puto with Cheese
ingredients: cheddar cheese cut into thin strips for toppings​
instructions: Get all the dry ingredients and mix them in a bowl.
Add the water. Dissolve all the ingredients.
Add the cooking oil ( I used canola oil)
Continue mixing until you achieve a smooth texture.
Transfer the mixture into the little puto molds.
Rest the batter mixture for 30 mins before steaming.
Add the thin strips of cheese on top.
Steam for 10 to 15 mins on medium heat.
Enjoy :)​

name: by Roselle
ingredients: cheddar cheese cut into thin strips for toppings​
instructions: Get all the dry ingredients and mix them in a bowl.
Add the water. Dissolve all the ingredients.
Add the cooking oil ( I used canola oil)
Continue mixing until you achieve a smooth texture.
Transfer the mixture into the little puto molds.
Rest the batter mixture for 30 mins before steaming.
Add the thin strips of cheese on top.
Steam for 10 to 15 mins on medium heat.
Enjoy :)​

name: Pork Afritada by Michael
ingredients: 1 lb Pork Stew - cut in 1 1/2 inches chunk size
1 Large potato - peel your potato and chop them in chunks
instructions: Step 1: Heat the oil in a wok or heavy-based pan over medium heat. Wait about 30 seconds and add your chopped onions to the wok and saute for about 2 minutes. Add your fresh "smashed" garlic and saute until it turns slightly brown.
Step 2: Add your chopped tomatoes & saute for about 2 mins.
Step 3: Add the Pork Stew and saute for about 5 mins. Add 1/2 cup of water. Cover and allow to simmer for another 10 minutes or until pork is tender.
Step 4: Add your potatoes and cover again and allow to simmer for another 5-10 mins. or until tender.

name: Sapin-Sapin by Marivic
ingredients: 4 cups sweet or glutinous rice flour
1-2 drops of ube or purple food color
instructions: Mix first three ingredients together. Divide mixture into three. The first part will remain white, the 2nd part mix some ube flavor for the purple part, for the third part add lye water and annatto, this will turn the mixture yellow.
In pan (grease with non-stick spray or brush with oil), pour in the white mixture.
Steam for 10 minutes. Add in the ube mixture, steam another 10 minutes. Then finally, add the yellow mixture and steam for 10 minutes. Total steaming time is 30 minutes.
Top with latik, (coconut milk heated till it curdles and turns brown).

name: Spaghetti by Mommy Zeny
ingredients: 1 (750grams) Del Monte Sweet Style Spaghetti Sauce
instructions: Heat the cooking oil in a wok and saute garlic and onion.
Add the ground beef and continue cooking until the meat turns light. Add salt.
Add the hotdogs & sliced mushrooms. Cook for 3 minutes.
Add the tomato paste, spaghetti sauce and ketchup.
Cook on medium heat while constantly stirring for 15 minutes.
Add the liver spread, pineapple tidbits and condensed milk. Cook until the sauce gets thick.
Serve with spaghetti noodles (see package directions in cooking the spaghetti noodles).
Top with grated cheese.
Enjoy!

name: Sisig by Melanie
ingredients: 1 piece lemon or 3 to 5 pieces calamansi)
instructions: Pour water in a pan and bring to a boil. Add salt and pepper.
Put-in the pig’s ears and pork belly then simmer for 40 minutes to 1 hour (or until tender).
Remove the boiled ingredients from the pot then drain excess water.
Broil at 350 degrees the boiled pig ears and pork belly until done for 30-45 minutes.
Chop the pig ears and pork belly into fine pieces.
In a pan, melt the butter then add the onions. Cook until onions are soft.
Add the chicken liver and cook until well done.
Crush the chicken liver while being cooked in the pan.
Add the chopped pig ears and pork belly then cook for 10 minutes.
Put-in the soy sauce and chili then mix well.
Add salt and pepper to taste.

name: Soft Hotdog Bun by Imelda
instructions: Cook (A) until of paste consistency.
Sift all the dry ingredients 3x.
Add in the yeast, egg, and the paste mixture (A).
Turn on the mixer with the hook attacment and slowly add in the water.
Knead 10 minutes. Add the soft butter and continue until smooth and elastic.
Take the dough out and knead a little by hand. In a greased bowl, cover and let rise for an hour.
Punch down and give a few knead and let rest for 10 minutes.
Shape and fill with hotdog OR hotdog/cheese.
Rest for another 30 minutes.
Brush with an egg wash.
And bake 15-20 minutes at 350 degrees.

name: Tilapia in Evaporated Milk by Maricel
ingredients: Saute garlic,onion and ginger in butter. Add a small amount of water and let it boil.
Add the fish (tilapia) until it's cooked, together with pechay.
Pour a cup of evaporated milk.

name: Tinolang Manok by Vanessa
ingredients: 1 cup green papaya or chayote (sayote), cut into wedges
instructions: In a preheated pan, saute ginger, garlic and onion in cooking oil.
Add chicken, fish sauce, water or chicken broth. Reduce heat and simmer until chicken is cooked.
Remove the chicken breast and cook. Debone. Carefully cut meat into 2.5cm /  1 inch cubes. Set aside.
Strain the broth and return to the pot.
Just before serving, bring the broth to a boil again.
Add the papaya and cook until tender.
Add the chicken.
Season to taste.
Add dahon ng sili.
Serve and enjoy :)

name: Tortang Alimasag by Bernadette
ingredients: Meat from 2 kilos crabs (cooked, remove head and wash, set aside)
2 cups diced potstoes (fried in oil the drained)
instructions: In large skillet, saute garlic until light brown in color.
Add chopped onion and cook until translucent.
Add in the crabmeat and stir.
Add the red bellpeppers and cilantro, mix and let cook 5 minutes.
Season with salt, pepper and MSG.
Mix well and add the cook potatoes last. Set aside and let cool.
When crab meat cools, add the beaten eggs.
Stuff into crab heads and fry in vegetable oil with crab head in oil first, for 3 minutes.
Turn and cook meat side another 3 minutes or until golden brown in color. ***For leftover meat mixture, fry into patties.​

name: Tuna and Mixed Veggies Pasta by Amour
ingredients: 200G TUNA IN CAN, WELL DRAINED and FLAKED
75G. WHOLEMEAL CRUMBS OR DRY BREAD CRUMBS

name: T
ingredients: 500g grey prawns, shelled, and tails left intact
Toasted bread slices or plain rice.

name: urmeric Prawn by Amour
ingredients: 500g grey prawns, shelled, and tails left intact
Toasted bread slices or plain rice.

name: Vegetable Stir Fry by Jason
instructions: SAUTE GARLIC AND ONION IN 2TBSP OF OIL.
ADD PORK STRIPS. COOK UNTIL PORK TURNS LIGHT BROWN IN COLOR.
ADD FISH SAUCE, CARROTS AND CHAYOTE. COOK FOR 5 MINUTES OR UNTIL VEGETABLES ARE TENDER.
ADD WATER AND SIMMER FOR 3 MINUTES.
SEASON WITH GROUND PEPPER.
SERVE HOT.

name: Wonton Soup by Jessica​
ingredients: 20-25 pcs wonton balls (ready made in the frozen isle - I used pork & shrimp flavor)
instructions: Boil chicken breast in 4-5 cups of water. Shred the chicken (set aside) and reserve 4 cups of broth.
In large pot, saute garlic in cooking oil.
Add the onions and cook until translucent. Add the shredded chicken breast and cook for few minutes.
Add in the broth and water. Let it simmer then add the chicken broth.
Add the wonton balls. Stir occassionally (very gently), until the wontons float.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the green onions.
Enjoy your hot soup!
